hymns.title: HYMN I. Agni.
hymns.text:
p: HIGH hath the #Mighty risen before the dawning, and come to us with #light from out the darkness. Fair-shapen @Agni with white-shining #splendour hath filled at birth all #human habitations.

p: Thou, being #born, art #Child of $Earth and $Heaven, parted among the plants in #beauty, @Agni! The glooms of night thou, Brilliant Babe, subduest, and art come forth, loud roaring, from thy Mothers.

p: Here, being manifested, lofty @Visnu, full #wise, protects his own #supremest station. When they have offered in his mouth their sweet #milk, to him with one accord they sing forth praises.

p: Thence bearing #food the Mothers come to meet thee, with #food for thee who givest #food its increase. These in their altered #form again thou meetest. Thou art Invoking Monk in homes of mortals.

p: Monk of the holy rite, with #car that glitters, refulgent Banner of each act of #worship, Sharinging every @Deva.through #might and #glory, even @Agni Guest of #men I summon hither.

p: So @Agni stands on $Earth's most central station, invested in well-decorated garments. #Born, red of hue, where #men pour out #libations, O #King, as great High Monk bring the #Devas hither.

p: Over the $Earth and over $Heaven, O @Agni #Son, hast ever spread above thy #Parents. Come, Youthfullest! to those who long to meet thee, and hither bring the #Devas, O #Mighty Victor.

hymns.title: HYMN II. Agni.
hymns.text:
p: GLADDEN the yearning #Devas, O thou Most Youthful: bring them, O #Lord of #Seasons, knowing #seasons, with all the Monks Celestial, O @Agni. Best #worshipper art thou of all Invokers.

p: Thine is the Herald's, thine the Cleanser's office, thinker art thou, #wealth-giver, true to #Order. Let us with @Svaha offer up oblations, and @Agni, worthy @Deva, pay the #Devas #worship.

p: To the #Devas’ pathway have we travelled, ready to execute what #work we may accomplish. Let @Agni, for he knows, complete the #worship. He is the Monk: let him fix rites and #seasons.

p: When we most ignorant neglect the statutes of you, O #Deities with whom is knowledge, #Wise @Agni shall correct our faults and failings, skilled to assign each @Deva.his fitting season.

p: When, weak in mind, of feeble understanding, mortals bethink them not of sacrificing, then shall the prudent and discerning @Agni #worship the #Devas, best #worshipper, in season.

p: Because the #Father hath produced thee, #Leader of all our solemn rites, their brilliant Banner: So win by #worship pleasant homes abounding in #heroes, and rich #food to nourish all #men.

p: Thou whom the $Heaven and $Earth, thou whom the #Waters, and @Tvastar, maker of fair things, created, well knowing, all along the #Fathers' pathway, #shine with resplendent #light, enkindled, @Agni.

hymns.title: HYMN III. Agni.
hymns.text:
p: O #KING, the potent and terrific envoy, kindled for strength, is manifest in #beauty. He shines, all-knowing, with his lotty #splendour: chasing black Night he comes with white-rayed #Morning.

p: Having o’ercome the glimmering Black with #beauty, and bringing forth the dame the Great Sire's Daughter, Holding aloft the radiant #light of @Surya, as messenger of $Heaven he shines with #treasure.s.

p: Attendant on the Blessed Dame the Blessed hath come: the Lover followeth his #Sister. @Agni, far-spreading with conspicuous lustre, hath compassed Night with whitelyshining garments.

p: His goings-forth kindle as ’twere high voices the goings of the auspicious #Friend of @Agni. The rays, the bright beams of the #strong-jawed, #mighty, #adorable Steer are visible as he cometh.

p: Whose radiant splendours #flow, like sounds, about us, his who is lofty, brilliant, and effulgent, who reaches $Heaven with best and brightest lustres, sportive and piercing even to the summit.

p: His #powers, whose chariot fellies gleam and glitter have loudly roared while, as with teams, he hasted. He, the most @Deva.ike, far-extending envoy, shines with flames ancient, resonant, whitely-shining.

p: So bring us ample #wealth: seat thee as envoy of the two youthful Matrons, $Earth and $Heaven. Let @Agni rapid with his rapid, #horses, impetuous with impetuous #Steeds, come hither.

hymns.title: HYMN IV. Agni.
hymns.text:
p: To thee will send #praise and bring oblation, as thou hast merited lauds when we invoked thee. A fountain in the desert art thou, @Agni, O Ancient #King, to #man who fain would #worship,

p: Thou unto whom resort the gathered #people, as the kine seek the warm stall, O Most Youthful. Thou art the messenger of #Devas and mortals, and goest #glorious with thy #light between them.

p: Making thee grow as ’twere some noble infant, thy #Mother nurtures thee with sweet affection. Over the desert slopes thou passest longing, and seekest, like some beast set free, thy fodder.

p: Foolish are we, O #Wise and free from error: verily, @Agni, thou dost know thy grandeur. There lies the #form: he moves and licks, and swallows, and, as House-#Lord, kisses the Youthful Maiden.

p: He rises ever fresh in ancient fuel: smoke-bannered, gray, he makes the wood his dwelling. No swimmer, Steer, he presses through the #waters, and to his place accordant mortals bear him.

p: Like thieves who risk their lives and haunt the forest, the twain with their ten girdles have secured him. This is a new #hymn meant for thee, O @Agni: yoke as it were thy #car with parts that glitter.

p: Homage and prayer are thine, O #Jatavedas, and this my #song shall evermore exalt thee. @Agni, protect our children and descendants, and guard with ever-watcliful care our bodies.

hymns.title: HYMN V. Agni.
hymns.text:
p: HE only is the Sea, holder of #treasure.s: #born many a time he views the hearts within us. He hides him in the secret couple's bosom. The #Bird dwells in the middle of the fountain.

p: Inhabiting one dwelling-place in common, #strong Stallions and the Mares have come together. The sages guard the seat of Holy #Order, and keep the highest names concealed within them.

p: The Holy Pair, of wondrous power, have coupled: they formed the Infant, they who bred produced him. The central point of all that moves and moves not, the while they wove the #Sage's thread with insight

p: For tracks of #Order and refreshing #offerings attend from ancient times the goodly Infant. Wearing him as a mantle, $Earth and $Heaven grow #strong by #food of pleasant drink and fatness.

p: He, calling loudly to the Seven red Sisters, hath, skilled in sweet drink, brought them to be looked on. He, #born of old, in middle #air hath halted, and sought and found the covering robe of @Pusan.

p: Seven are the pathways which the #wise have fashioned; to one of thes. May come the troubled mortal. He standeth in the dwelling of the Highest, a Pillar, on sure ground where paths are parted.

p: Not Being, being in the highest $Heaven, in @Aditi's bosom and in @Daksa's birthplace, is @Agni, our first-#born of Holy #Order, the Milch-#cow and the Bull in #life's beginning.

hymns.title: HYMN VI Agni
hymns.text:
p: THIS is that @Agni, he by whose protection, favour, and #help. the #singer is successful. Who with the noblest flames of glowing fuel comes forth encompassed with far-spreading lustre.

p: @Agni, the Holy One, the everlasting, who shines far beaming with celestial splendours; He who hath come unto his #friends with friendship, like a fleet steed who never trips or stumbles.

p: He who is #Lord of all divine oblation, shared by all living #men at break of #morning, @Agni to whom our #offerings are devoted, in whom rests he whose #car, through #might, is scatheless.

p: Increasing by his strength. while lauds content him, with easy flight unto the #Devas he travels. @Agni the cheerful Monk, best Offerer, balms with his tongue the #Devas with whom he mingles.

p: With #songs and adorations bring ye hither @Agni who stirs himself at @Dawn like @Indra, whom sages laud with hymns as #Jatavedas of those who wield the ceremonial ladle.

p: In whom all goodly #treasure.s meet together, even as #steeds and riders for the booty. Inclining hither bring us #help, O @Agni, even assistance most desired by @Indra.

p: Yea, at thy birth, when thou hadst sat in #glory @Agni, wast the aim of invocations. The #Devas came near, obedient to thy sunimons, and thus attained their rank as #chief Protectors.

hymns.title: HYMN VII. Agni.
hymns.text:
p: O @Agni, shared by all #men living bring us good luck for #offering from $Earth and $Heaven. With us be thine intelligence, WonderWorker! Protect us, @Deva, with thy far-reaching blessings.

p: These hymns brought forth for thee, O @Agni, laud thee for bounteous #gifts, with #cattle and with #horses. Good #Lord, when #man from thee hath gained enjoyment, by hymns, O noblyborn, hath he obtained it.

p: @Agni I deem my Kinsman and my #Father, count him my #Brother and my #Friend forever. I honour as the face of lofty @Agni in $Heaven the bright and holy #light of @Surya.

p: Effectual, @Agni, are our meditations for profit. He whom, at #home thou, Monk forever, guardest Is rich in #food, drawn by red #steeds, and holy: by day and night to him shall all be pleasant.

p: #Men with their arms have generated @Agni, helpful as some kind #friend, adorned with splendours, and stablished as Invoker mid the #people the ancient Monk  'the #offering's lover.

p: #Worship, thyself, O @Deva, the #Devas in $Heaven: what, void of knowledge, shall the fool avail thee? As thou, O @Deva, hast worshipped #Devas by #seasons, so, nobly-#born! to thine own self pay #worship.

p: @Agni, be thou our Guardian and Protector bestow upon us #life and vital vigour. Accept, O #Mighty One, the #gifts we offer, and with unceasing care protect our bodies.

hymns.title: HYMN VIII. Agni.
hymns.text:
p: @Agni advances with his lofty banner: the Bull is bellowing to the $Earth and heavens. He hath attained the $Sky's supremest limits. the Steer hath waxen in the lap of #waters.

p: The Bull, the youngling with the hump, hath frolicked, the #strong and never-ceasing Calf hath bellowed. Bringing our #offerings to the @Deva's assembly, he moves as #Chief in his own dwelling-places.

p: Him who hath grasped his #Parents' head, they stablished at #offering a wave of heavenly lustre. In his swift flight the red #Dawns borne by #horses refresh their bodies in the #home of #Order.

p: For, @Vasu thou precedest every #Morning, and still hast been the Twins' illuminator. For #offering, seven places thou retainest while for thine own self thou engenderest @Mitra.

p: Thou art the Eye and Guard of #mighty #Order, and @Varuna when to #offering thou comest. Thou art the #Waters’ #Child O #Jatavedas, envoy of him whose #offering thou acceptest.

p: Thou art the #Leader of the rite and region, to which with thine auspicious teams thou teadest, Thy #light-bestowing head to $Heaven thou liftest, making thy tongue the oblationbearer, @Agni.

p: Through his #wise insight @Trita in the cavern, seeking as ever the #Chief Sire's intention, Carefully tended in his #Parents' bosom, calling the weapons kin, goes forth to combat.

p: Well-skilled to use the weapons of his #Father, @Aptya, urged on by @Indra, fought the battle. Then @Trita slew the foe seven-rayed, three-headed, and freed the #cattle of the #Son of @Tvastar.

p: #Lord of the #brave, @Indra cleft him in pieces who sought to gain much strength and deemed him #mighty. He smote his three heads from his body, seizing the #cattle of the oniniform #Son of @Tvastar.

hymns.title: HYMN IX. Waters.
hymns.text:
p: YE, #Waters, are beneficent: so #help ye us to energy That we may look on great #delight.

p: Give us a portion of the sap, the most auspicious that ye havelike mothers in their longing love.

p: To you we gladly come for him to whose abode ye send us on; And, #Waters, give us procreant strength.

p: The #Waters. be to us for drink, Devis for our aid and #bliss: Let them #stream to us health and strength.

p: 1 beg the Floods to give us balm, these Queens who rule o’er precious things, and have supreme control of #men.

p: Within the #Waters-#Soma thus hath told me-dwell all balms that heal, and @Agni, he who blesseth all.

p: O #Waters, teem with medicine to keep my body safe from harm. So that I lon. May see the #Sun.

p: Whatever sin is found in me, whatever evil I have wrought, If I have lied or falsely sworn, #Waters, remove it far from me.

p: The #Waters I this day have sought, and to their moisture have we come: O @Agni, rich in #milk, come thou, and with thy #splendour cover me.

hymns.title: HYMN X.Yama Yami.
hymns.text:
p: FAIN would I win my #friend to kindly friendship. May the #Sage, come through the #air's wide $Ocean, Remembering the $Earth and days to follow, obtain a #son, the issue of his #father.

p: Thy #friend loves not the friendship which considers her who is near in kindred as stranger. #Sons of the #mighty #Asura, the #Heroes, supporters of the heavens, see far around them.

p: Yea, this the Immortals seek of thee with longing, #progeny of the sole existing mortal. Then let thy soul and mine be knit together, and as a loving #husband take thy consort.

p: Shall we do now what we ne’er did aforetime? we who spake righteously now talk impurely? #Gandharva in the floods, the Dame of #Waters-such is our bond, such our most lofty kinship.

p: Even in the womb @Deva.@Tvastar, Vivifier, shaping all forms, #Creator, made us consorts. None violates his holy ordinances: that we are his the heavens and $Earth acknowledge.

p: Who knows that earliest day whereof thou speakest? Who hatb beheld it? Who can here declare it? Great is the Law of @Varuna and @Mitra. What, wanton! wilt thou say to #men to tempt them?

p: I, Yami, am possessed by love of @Yama, that . May rest on the same #couch beside him. I as a #wife would yield me to my #husband. Like #car-wheels let us speed to meet each other.

p: They stand not still, they never close their eyelids, those sentinels of #Devas who wander round us. Not me-go quickly, wanton, with another, and hasten like a chariot wheel to meet him.

p: May @Surya's eye with days and nights endow him, and eve. May his #light spread out before him. In $Heaven and $Earth the kindred Pair commingle. On Yam! be the unbrotherly act of @Yama.

p: Sure there will come succeeding times when brothers and sisters will do acts unmeet for kinsfolk. Not me, O fair one.seek another #husband, and make thine arm a #pillow for thy consort.

p: Is he a #brother when no #lord is left her? Is she a #sister when Destruction cometh? Forced by my love these many words I utter. Come near, and hold me in thy close embraces.

p: I will not fold mine arms about thy body: they #call it sin when one comes near his #sister. Not me.prepare thy pleasures with another: thy #brother seeks not this from thee, O fair one.

p: Alas! thou art indeed a weakling, @Yama we find in thee no trace of heart or #spirit. As round the tree the woodbine clings, another will cling albout thee girt as with a girdle.

p: Embrace another, Yami; let another, even as the woodbine rings the tree, enfold thee. Win thou his heart and let him win thy fancy, and he shall #form with thee a blest alliance.

hymns.title: HYMN XI. Agni
hymns.text:
p: THE Bull hath yielded for the Bull the #milk of $Heaven: the #Son of @Aditi can never be deceived. According to his wisdom @Varuna knoweth all. May he, the Holy, hallow times for #offering.

p: Gandharvi spake. May she, the Lady of the flood, amid the #river's roaring leave my heart untouched. May @Aditi accomplish all that we desire, an. May our eldest #Brother tell us this as #Chief.

p: Yea, even this blessed #Morning, rich in store of #food, splendid, with heavenly lustre, hath shone out for #man, Since they, as was the wish of yearning #Devas, brought forth that yearning @Agni for the assembly as the Monk.

p: And the fleet Falcon brought for #offering from afar this flowing Drop most #excellent and keen of sight, then when the Aryan tribes chose as Invoking Monk @Agni the Wonder-Worker, and the #hymn rose up.

p: Still art thou kind to him who feeds thee as with #grass, and, skilled in #offering, #offers thee holy #gifts. When thou, having received the #sage's strengthening #food with lauds, after long toil, cornest with many more.

p: Urge thou thy #Parents, as a lover ' to #delight: the Lovely One desires and craves it from his heart. The priest calls out,  'the offeringr shows his skill, the #Asura tries his strength, and with the #hymn is stirred.

p: Far-famed is he, the mortal #man, O @Agni, thou #Son of Strength, who hath obtained thy favour. He, gathering power, borne onward by his #horses, makes his days lovely in his #might and #splendour.

p: When, Holy @Agni, the divine assembly, the sacred synod mid the #Devas, is gathered, and when thou, @Deva.ike One, dealest forth #treasure.s, vouchsafe us, too, our portion of the #riches.

p: Hear us, O @Agni, in your common dwelling: harness thy rapid #car of Amrta. Bring $Heaven and $Earth, the #Deities' #Parents, hither: stay with us here, nor from the #Devas be distant.

hymns.title: HYMN XII. Agni
hymns.text:
p: $Heaven and $Earth, first by everlasting #Order, speakers of truth, are near enough to hear us, when the @Deva, urging #men to #worship. sitteth as Monk, assuming all his vital vigour.

p: As @Deva.comprising #Devas by #Law Eternal, bear, as the #Chief who knoweth, our oblation, Smoke-bannered with the fuel, radiant, joyous, better to #praise and #worship, Monk forever.

p: When the #cow's nectar wins the @Deva.completely, #men here below are $Heaven's sustainers. All the #Devas came to this thy heavenly Yajus which from the motley Pair milked oil and #water.

p: 1 #praise your #work that y. May make me prosper: hear. $Heaven and $Earth, Twain Worlds that drop with fatness. While days and nights go to the world of spirits, here let the #Parents with sweet #meath refresh us

p: Hath the #King siezed us? How have we offended against his holy ordinance? Who knoweth? For even @Mitra mid the #Devas is angry there are both #song and strength for those who come not.

p: ’Tis hard to understand the #Immortal's nature, where she who is akin becomes astranger. Guard ceaselessly, great @Agni, him who ponders @Yama's name, easy to be comprehended.

p: They in the synod where the #Devas rejoice them, where they are seated in @Vivasvan's dwelling, have given the #Moon his beams, the #Sun his #splendour-the Two unweariedly maintain their brightness.

p: The counsel which the #Devas meet to consider, their secret plan.of that we have no knowledge. There let @Deva.@Indra, @Indra, @Varuna, and @Mitra, #Soma, @Maghavan, @Savitar, @Visnu, @Aditi, and @Mitra proclaim to @Varuna that we are sinless.

p: Hear us, O @Agni, in your comninn dwell ing: harness thy rapid #car, the #car of Amrta. Bring $Heaven and $Earth, the #Deities' #Parents, hither: stay with us here, nor from the #Devas be distant.

hymns.title: HYMN XIII Havirdhanas.
hymns.text:
p: I YOKE with prayer your ancient inspiration. May the laud rise as on the prince's pathway. All #Sons of Immortality shall hear it, all the possessors of celestial natures.

p: When speeding ye came nigh us like twin sisters, religious-hearted votaries brought you forward. Take your place, ye who know your proper station: be near, be very near unto our #Soma.

p: Five paces have I risen from $Earth. I follow her who hath four feet with devout observance. This by the Sacred Syllable have I measured: I purify in the central place of #Order,

p: He, for @Deva's sake, chose #death to be his portion. He chose not, for #men's good, a #life eternal They offered @Narasamsa the Rsi. @Yama delivered up his own dear body.

p: The Seven #flow to the Youth on whom the #Maruts wait: the #Sons unto the #Father brought  'the #offering. Both these are his, as his they are the Lords of both: both toil; belonging unto both they prosper well.

hymns.title: HYMN XIV. Yama.
hymns.text:
p: HONOUR the #King with thine oblations, @Yama, @Vivasvan's #Son, who gathers #men together, who travelled to the lofty heights above us, who searcbes out and shows the path to many.

p: @Yama first found for us a place to dwell in: this pasture never can be taken from Us. #Men #born on $Earth tread their own paths that lead them whither our ancient #Fathers have departed.

p: Mitali prospers there with Kavyas, @Yama with @Angiras' #sons, @Narasamsa with Rkvans: Exalters of the #Devas, by #Devas exalted, some #joy in #praise and some in our oblation.

p: Come, seat thee on this bed of #grass, O @Yama, in company with #Angirases and #Fathers. Let texts recited by the sages bring thee O #King, let this oblation make thee joyful.

p: Come, @Yama, with the #Angirases the Holy, rejoice thee here with children of @Virupa. To sit on sacred #grass at this our #worship, I #call @Vivasvan, too, thy #Father hither.

p: Our #Fathers are #Angirases, #Navagvas, Atharvans, #Bhrgus who deserve the #Soma. May these, the Holy, look on us with favour. May we enjoy their gracious loving-kindness.

p: Go forth, go forth upon the ancient pathways whereon our sires of old have gone before us. 'Mere shalt thou look on both the #Kings enjoying their sacred #food, @Deva.@Varuna and @Yama.

p: Meet @Yama, meet the #Fathers, meet the merit of free or ordered acts, in highest $Heaven. Leave sin and evil, seek anew thy dwelling, and bright with #glory wear another body.

p: Go hence, depart ye, fly in all directions: this place for him the #Fathers have provided. @Yama bestows on him a place to rest in adorned with days and beams of #light and #waters.

p: Run and outspeed the two dogs, @Sarama's #offspring, brindled, four-eyed, upon thy happy pathway. Draw nigh then to the gracious-minded #Fathers where they rejoice in company with @Yama.

p: And those two dogs of thine, @Yama, the watchers, four-eyed, who look on #men and guard the pathway. Entrust this #man, O #King, to their protection, and with prosperity and health endow him.

p: Dark-hued, insatiate, with distended nostrils, @Yama's two envoys roam among the #People; May they restore to us a fair existence here and to-day, that we may see the sunlight.

p: To @Yama pour the #Soma, bring to @Yama consecrated #gifts: To @Yama #offerings prepared and heralded by @Agni goes.

p: Offer to @Yama holy #gifts enriched with butter, and draw near: May he grant that we may live long days of #life among the #Devas.

p: Offer to @Yama, to the #King, oblation very rich in #meath: Bow down before the #Rsis of the ancient times, who made this path in days of old.

p: Into the six Expanses flies the Great One in Trkadrukas. The Gayatri, the Trstup, all metres in @Yama are contained.

hymns.title: HYMN XV. Fathers.
hymns.text:
p: MAY they #ascend, the lowest, highest, midmost, the #Fathers who deserve a share of #Soma- May they who have attained the #life of spirits, gentle and righteous, aid us when we #call them.

p: Now let us pay this homage to the #Fathers, to those who passed of old and those who followed, Those who have rested in the earthly region, and those who dwell among the #Mighty Races.

p: 1 have attained the gracious-minded #Fathers, I have gained #son and #progeny from @Visnu. They who enjoy pressed juices with oblation seated on sacred #grass, come oftenest hither.

p: #Fathers who sit on sacred #grass, come, #help us: these #offerings have we made for you; accept them. So come to us with most auspicious favour, and give us health and strength without a trouble.

p: May they, the #Fathers, worthy of the #Soma, invited to their favourite oblations. Laid on the sacred #grass, come nigh and listen. May they be gracious unto us and bless us.

p: Bowing your bended knees and seated southward, accept this #offering of ours with favour. Punish us not for any sin, O #Fathers, which we through #human frailty have committed.

p: Lapped in the bosom of the purple Mornings, give #riches to the #man who brings oblations. Grant to your #sons a portion of that #treasure., and, present, give them energy, ye #Fathers.

p: Our ancient #Fathers who deserve the #Soma, who came, most noble, to our #Soma #banquet. With these let @Yama, yearning with the yearning, rejoicing eat our #offerings at his pleasure.

p: Come to us, @Agni, with the gracioug #Fathers who dwell in glowing #light, the very Kavyas, who thirsted mid the #Devas, who hasten hither, oblation winners, theme of singers' praises.

p: Come, @Agni, come with countless ancient #Fathers, dwellers in #light, primeval, @Deva.adorers, Eaters and drinkers of oblations, truthful, who travel with the #Deities and @Indra.

p: #Fathers whom @Agni's flames have tasted, come ye nigh: ye kindly leaders, take ye each your proper place. Eat sacred #food presented on the #grass: grant #riches with a multitude of #hero #sons.

p: Thou, @Agni #Jatavedas, when entreated, didst bear the #offerings which thou madest fragrant, and give them to the #Fathers who did cat them with Svadha. Eat, thou @Deva, the #gifts we bring thee.

p: Thou, #Jatavedas, knowest well the number of #Fathers who are here and who are absent, Of #Fathers whom we know and whom we know not: accept  'the #offering wellprepared with portions.

p: They who, consumed by fire or not cremated, #joy in their #offering in the midst of $Heaven. Grant them, O Sovran #Lord, the world of spirits and their own body, as thy pleasure wills it.

hymns.title: HYMN XVI. Agni.
hymns.text:
p: Burn him not up, nor quite consume him, @Agni: let not his body or his skin be scattered. O #Jatavedas, when thou hast matured him, then send him on his way unto the #Fathers.

p: When thou hast made him ready, #Jatavedas, then do thou give him over to the #Fathers. When he attains unto the #life that waits him, he shall become the #Deities' controller.

p: The #Sun receive thine eye, tne Wind thy #spirit; go, as thy merit is, to $Earth or $Heaven. Go, if it be thy lot, unto the #waters; go, make thine #home in plants with all thy members.

p: Thy portion is the goat: with heat consume him: let thy fierce flame, thy glowing #splendour, burn him With thine auspicious forms, o #Jatavedas, bear this #man to the region of the pious.

p: Again, O @Agni, to the #Fathers send him who, offered in thee, goes with our oblations. Wearing new #life let him increase his #offspring: let him rejoin a body, #Jatavedas.

p: What wound soe’er the dark #bird hath inflicted, the emmet, or the serpent, or the jackal, may @Agni who devoureth all things heal it and #Soma who hath passed into the #Brahmans.

p: Shield thee with flesh against the flames of @Agni, encompass thee about with fat and marrow, So will the Bold One, eager to attack thee with fierce glow fail to girdle and consume thee.

p: Forbear, O @Agni, to upset this ladle: the #Devas and they who merit #Soma love it. This ladle, this which serves the #Devas to drink from, in this the #Immortal #Deities rejoice them.

p: 1 send afar flesh eating @Agni, bearing off stain. May he depart to @Yama's subjects. But let this other #Jatavedas carry oblation to the #Devas, for he is skilful.

p: I choose as @Deva.for #Father-#worship @Agni, flesh-eater, who hath past within your dwelling, While looking on this other #Jatavedas. Let him #light flames in the supreme assembly.

p: With #offerings meet let @Agni bring the #Fathers who support the Law. Let him announce oblations paid to #Fathers and to #Deities.

p: Right gladly would we set thee down, right gladly make thee burn and glow. Gladly bring yearning #Fathers nigh to cat the #food of #offering.

p: Cool, @Agni, and again refresh the spot which thou hast scorched and burnt. Here let the #water-lily grow, and tender #grass and leafy herb.

p: O full of coolness, thou cool Plant, full of fresh moisture, freshening Herb, Come hither with the female frog: fill with #delight this @Agni here.

hymns.title: HYMN XVII. Various Deities.
hymns.text:
p: @Tvastar prepares the #bridal of his Daughter: all the world hears the tidings and assembles. But @Yama's #Mother, #Spouse of great @Vivasvan, vanished as she was carried to her dwelling.

p: From mortal #men they hid the #Immortal Lady, made one like her and gave her to @Vivasvan. Saranyu brought to him the Asvin brothers, and then deserted both twinned pairs of children.

p: Guard of the world, whose #cattle ne’er are injured. May @Pusan bear thee hence, for he hath knowledge. May he consign thee to these #Fathers' keeping, and to the gracious #Devas let @Agni give thee.

p: May @Ayu, giver of all #life, protect thee, and bear thee forward on the distant pathway. Thither let @Indra, @Indra, @Varuna, and @Mitra, #Soma, @Maghavan, @Savitar transport thee, where dwell the pious who have passed-before thee.

p: @Pusan knows all these realms. May he conduct us by ways that are most free from fear and danger. Giver of blessings, glowing, all-heroic. May he, thewise and watchful, go before us.

p: @Pusan was #born to move on distant pathways, on the road far from $Earth and far from $Heaven. To both most wonted places of assembly he travels and returns with perfect knowledge.

p: The pious #call @Sarasvati, they #worship @Sarasvati while #offering proceedeth. The pious called @Sarasvati aforetime. @Sarasvati send #bliss to him who giveth.

p: @Sarasvati, who camest with the #Fathers, with them rejoicing thee in our oblations, Seated upon this sacred #grass be joyful, and give us strengthening #food that brings no sickness.

p: Thou, called on as @Sarasvati by #Fathers who come right forward to our solemn service, Give #food and #wealth to present offerers, a portion, worth a thousand, of refreshment.

p: The #Mother Floods shall make us bright and shining, cleansers of holy oil, with oil shall cleanse us: For, Devis, they bear off all defilement: I, rise up from them purified and brightened.

p: Through days of earliest date the Drop descended on this place and on that which was before it. I offer up, throughout the seven oblations, the Drop which still to one same place is moving.

p: The Drop that falls, thy stalk which arms have shaken, which from the bosom of the press hath fallen, or from the Adhvaryu's purifying filter, I offer thee with heart and cry of Vasat!

p: That fallen Drop of thine, the stalk which from the ladle fell away, This present @Deva.@Narasamsa shall pour it forth to make us rich.

p: The plants of $Earth are rich in #milk, and rich in #milk is this my speech; And rich in #milk the essence of the #Waters: make me pure therewith.

hymns.title: HYMN XVIII. Various Deities.
hymns.text:
p: Go hence, O #Death, pursue thy special pathway apart from that which #Devas are wont to travel. To thee I say it who hast eyes and hearest: Touch not our #offspring, injure not our #heroes.

p: As ye have come effacing Mrtyu's footstep, to further times prolonging your existence, may ye be rich in children and possessions. cleansed, purified, and meet for sacrificing.

p: Divided from the dead are these, the living: now be our calling on the #Devas successful. We have gone forth for dancing and for laughter, tofurther times prolonging our existence.

p: Here I erect this rampart for the living; let none of these, none other, reach this limit. May they survive a hundred lengthened autumns, an. May they bury #Death beneath this mountain.

p: As the days follow days in close succession, as with the #seasons duly come the #seasons, as each successor fails not his foregoer, so #form the lives of these, O great Ordainer.

p: Live your full lives ap! find old age delightful, all of you striving one behind the other. May @Tvastar, maker of fair things, be gracious and lengthen out the days of your existence.

p: Let these unwidowed #dames with noble husbands adorn themselves with fragrant balm and unguent. Decked with fair jewels, tearless, free from sorrow, first let the #dames go up to where he lieth.

p: Rise, come unto the world of #life, O #woman: come, he is lifeless by whose side thou liest. Wifehood with this thy #husband was thy portion, who took thy hand and wooed thee as a lover.

p: From his dead hand I take the bow be carried, that he may be our power and #might and #glory. There art thou, there; and here with noble heroe. May we o’ercome all hosts that fight against us.

p: Betake thee to the Iap of $Earth the #Mother, of $Earth far-spreading, very kind and gracious. Young Dame, wool-soft unto the guerdongiver. May she preserve thee from Destruction's bosom.

p: Heave thyself, $Earth, nor press thee downward heavily: afford him easy access, gently tending him. Cover him, as a #mother wraps her skirt about her #child, O $Earth.

p: Now let the heaving $Earth be free from motion: yea.let a thousand clods remain above him. Be they to him a #home distilling fatness, here let them ever be his place of refuge.

p: I stay the $Earth from thee, while over thee I place this piece of $Earth. May I be free from injury. Here let the #Fathers keep this pillar firm for thee, and there let @Yama make thee an abiding-place.

p: Even as an arrow's feathers, they have set me on a fitting day. The fit word have I caught and held as ’twere a courser with the rein.

hymns.title: HYMN XIX. Waters or Cows.
hymns.text:
p: TURN, go not farther on your way: visit us, O ye Wealthy Ones. @Agni and #Soma, ye who bring #riches again, secure us #wealth.

p: Make these return to us again, bring them beside us once again. May. @Indra give them back to us, and @Agni drive them hither-ward.

p: Let them return to us again: under this herdsman let them feed. Do thou, O @Agni, keep them here, and let the #wealth we have remain.

p: 1 #call upon their herdsman, him who knoweth well their coming nigh, their parting and their #home-return, and watcheth their approach and rest.

p: Yea, let the herdsman, too, return, who marketh well their driving-forth; Marketh their wandering away, their turning back and coming #home.

p: #Home-#leader, lead them #home to us; @Indra, restore to us our kine: We will rejoice in them alive.

p: 1 offer you on every side butter and #milk and strengthening #food. May all the Holy #Deities pour down on us a flood of #wealth.

p: O thou #Home-#leader, lead them #home, restore them thou who bringest #home. Four are the quarters of the $Earth; from these bring back to us our kine,

hymns.title: HYMN XX. Agni.
hymns.text:
p: SEND unto us a good and happy mind.

p: 1 #worship @Agni, Youthfullest of #Devas, resistless, #Friend of laws; Under whose guard and heavenly #light the Spotted seek the #Mother's breast:

p: Whom with their mouth they magnify, bannered with flame and homed in #light. He glitters with his row of teeth.

p: Kind, Furtherer of #men, he comes, when he hath reached the ends of $Heaven, #Sage, giving #splendour to the clouds.

p: To taste #man's #offerings, he, the #Strong, hath risen erect at #offerings: Fixing his dwelling he proceeds.

p: Here are oblation, #worship, rest: rapidly comes his furtherance. To sword-armed @Agni come the #Devas.

p: With service for #chief #bliss I seek the #Lord of #Offering, @Agni, whom They #call the Living, #Son of Cloud.

p: Blest evermore be all the #men who come from us, who magnify @Agni with #offerings #gifts.

p: The path he treads is black and white and red, and striped, and brown, crimson, and #glorious. His sire begat him bright with hues of #gold.

p: Thus with his thoughts, O #Son of Strength, O @Agni, hath @Vimada, accordant with the Immortals, Offered thee hymns, soliciting thy favour. Thou hast brought all #food, strength, a prosperous dwelling.

hymns.title: HYMN XXI. Agni.
hymns.text:
p: WITH #offerings of our own we choose thee, @Agni, as Invoking Monk, for #offering with trimmed #grass.at your glad carouse-piercing and brightly shining. Thou art waxing great.

p: The wealthy ones adorn thee, they who bring us #horses as their #gift: The sprinkling ladle, @Agni.at your glad carouse -and glowing #offering taste thee. Thou art waxing great.

p: The holy statutes rest by thee, as ’twere with ladles that o’erflow. Black and white-gleaming colours.at your glad carouse-all glories thou assurnest. Thou art waxing great.

p: O @Agni, what thou deemest #wealth, Victorious and #Immortal One! Bring thou to give us vigour.at your glad carouse -splendid at #offers. Thou art waxing great.

p: Skilled in all lore is @Agni, he whom erst Atharvan brought to #life. He was @Vivasvan's envoy, at your glad carouse-the weIl-loved #friend of @Yama, Thou art waxing great.

p: At #offers they adore thee, @Agni, when the rite proceeds. All fair and lovely #treasure.s-at your glad carouse-thou givest him who #offers. Thou art waxing great.

p: #Men, @Agni, have established thee as welcome Monk at holy rites, thee whose face shines with butter.at your glad carouse-bright, with eyes most observant. Thou art waxing great.

p: Wide and aloft thou spreadest thee, O @Agni, with thy brilliant flame. A Bull art thou when bellowing.at your glad carouse-thou dost impregn the Sisters. Thou art waxing great.

hymns.title: HYMN XXII. Indra.
hymns.text:
p: WHERE is famed @Indra heard of? With what folk is he renowned to-day as @Mitra is. Who in the #home of #Rsis and in secret is extolled with #song?

p: Even here is @Indra famed, and among us this day the #glorious Thunderer is praised. He who like @Mitra mid the folk hath won complete and full renown.

p: He who is Sovran #Lord of great and perfect strength, exerter of heroic #might, who bears the fearless thunder as a #father bears his darling #son.

p: Harnessing to thy #car, as @Deva, two blustering #Steeds Of the Wind-@Deva, O Thunderer, that speed along the shining path, thou making ways art glorified.

p: Even to these dark #Steeds of Wind thou of thyself hast come to ride, Of which no drive. May be found, none, be he @Deva.or mortal #man.

p: When ye approach, #men ask you, thee and @Usana: Why come ye to our dwelling-place? Why are ye come to mortal #man from distant realms of eapth and $Heaven?

p: O @Indra, thou shalt speak us fair: our holy prayer is offered up. We meditate to thee for #help as thou didst strike the monster @Susna dead.

p: Around us is the #Dasyu, riteless, void of sense, inhuman, keeping alien laws. Baffle, thou Slayer of the foe, the weapon which this Dasa wields.

p: #Hero with #Heroes, thou art ours: yea, #strong are they whom thou dost #help. In many a place are thy full #gifts, and #men, like vassals, sing thy #praise.

p: Urge thou these #heroes on to subdue the enemy, #brave Thunderer! in the fight with swords. Even when hid among the tribes of Sages numerous as stars.

p: Swift come those #gifts of thine whose hand is prompt to rend and burn, O #Hero Thunder-armed: As thou with thy Companions didst destroy the whole of SuSnia's brood.

p: Let not thine #excellent assistance come to us, O #Hero @Indra, profitless. May we. May we enjoy the #bliss of these thy favours, Thunderer!

p: May those soft impulses of thine, O @Indra, be fruitful and innocent to us. May we know these whose #treasure.s are like those of milch-kine, Thunderer!

p: That $Earth, through power of knowing things tha. May be known, handless and footless yet #might thrive, Thou slewest, turning to the right, gu;na forevery living #man.

p: Drink, drink the #Soma. #Hero @Indra; be not withheld as thou art good, O #Treasure-giver. Preserve the singers and our liberal princes, and make us wealthy with abundant #riches.

hymns.title: HYMN XXIII. Indra.
hymns.text:
p: @Indra, whose right hand wields the bolt, we #worship, driver of Bay #Steeds seeking sundered courses. Shaking his beard with #might he hath arisen, casting his weapons forth and dealing bounties.

p: The #treasure. which his Bay #Steeds found at #offering.this #wealth made opulent @Indra slayer of the foe. Rbhu, @Rbhuksan, @Vaja-he is #Lord of #Might. The Dasa's very name I utterly destroy.

p: When, with the Princes, Maghavari, famed of old, comes nigh the thunderbolt of #gold, and the Controller's #car Which his two #Tawny Coursers draw, then @Indra is the Sovran #Lord of power whose #glory spreads afar.

p: With him too is this #rain of his that comes like herds: @Indra throws #drops of moisture on his yellow beard. When the sweet #juice is shed he seeks the pleasant place, and stirs the #worshipper as wind disturbs the wood.

p: We laud and #praise his several deeds of valour who, fatherlike, with power hath made us stronger. Who with his #voice slew many thousand wicked ones who spake in varied manners with contemptuous cries.

p: @Indra, the Vimadas have formed for thee a laud, copious, unparalleled, for thee Most Bountiful. We know the good we gain from him the #Mighty One when we attract him as a herdsman calls the kine.

p: Ne’e. May this bond of friendship be dissevered, the Rsi @Vimada's and thine, O @Indra. We know thou carest for us as a #brother with us, O @Deva, be thine auspicious friendship.

hymns.title: HYMN XXIV. Indra. Asvins.
hymns.text:
p: O @Indra, drink this #Soma, pressed out in the mortar, full of sweets. Send down to us great #riches.at your glad carouse-in thousands, O Most healthy. Thou art waxing great.

p: To thee with offeringss, with oblations, and with lauds we come. #Lord of all strength and power, grant-at your glad carouse-the best choiceworthy #treasure.. Thou art waxing great.

p: Thou who art #Lord of precious boons, inciter even of the churl. Guardian of singers, @Indra.at your glad carouse-save us from woe and hatred. Thou art waxing great.

p: #Strong, Lords of Magic power, ye Twain churned the united worlds apart, when ye, implored by @Vimada, @Nasatyas, forced apart the pair.

p: When the united pair were rent asunder all the #Devas complained. The #Devas to the @Nasatyas cried, Bring these together once again.

p: Sweet be my going forth, and rich in sweets be my approach to #home. So, through your Deity, both #Devas, enrich us with all pleasantness.

hymns.title: HYMN XXV. Soma.
hymns.text:
p: SEND us a good and happy mind, send energy and mental power. Then-at your glad carouse-let #men #joy in thy love, Sweet #juice! as kine in pasture. Thou. art waxing great.

p: rn all thy forms, O #Soma, rest thy #powers that influence the heart. So also these my longings-at your glad carouse-spread themselves seeking #riches. Thou art waxing great.

p: Even if, O #Soma, I neglect thy laws through my simplicity, be gracious-at your glad carouse-as sire to #son. Preserve us even from slaughter. T'hou. art waxing great.

p: Our #songs in concert go to thee as #streams of #water to the wells. #Soma, that we may live, grant-at your glad carouse-full #powers of mind, like beakers. Thou art waxing great.

p: O #Soma, through thy #might who art skilful and #strong, these longing #men, these sages, have thrown open-at your glad carouse-the stall of kine and #horses. Thou art waxing great

p: Our herds thou guardest, #Soma, and the moving world spread far and wide. Thou fittest them for living.at your glad carouse-looking upon all beings. Thou art waxing great.

p: On all sides, #Soma, be to us a Guardian ne’er to be deceived. #King, drive away our foemen-at your glad carouse:—let not the wicked rule us. Thou art waxing great.

p: Be watchful, #Soma, passing #wise, to give us store of vital strength. More skilled than #man to guide us.at your glad carouse-save us from harm and sorrow. Thou art waxing great.

p: #Chief slayer of our foemen @Indu, art @Indra's gracious #Friend, when warriors invoke him-at your glad carouse -in fight, to win them #offspring. Thou art waxing great.

p: Victorious is this gladdening drink: to @Indra dear it grows in strength. This-at your glad carouse -enhanced the #mighty #hymn of the great #sage Kaksivan. Thou art waxing great.

p: This to the #sage who #offers #gifts brings power that comes from #wealth in kine. This, better than the seven, hath-at your glad carouse-furthered the blind, the cripple. Thou art waxing great.

hymns.title: HYMN XXVI. Pusan.
hymns.text:
p: FORWARD upon their way proceed the ready teams, the lovely #songs. Further them #glorious @Pusan with yoked chariot, and the #Mighty Twain!

p: With sacred hymns let this #man here, this #singer, win the @Deva.to whom Belong this majesty and #might. He hath observed our eulogies.

p: @Pusan the #Strong hath knowledge of sweet praises even as @Indu hath. He dews our corn with moisture, he bedews the pasture of our kine.

p: We will bethink ourselves of thee, O @Pusan, O thou @Deva, as One. Who brings fulfilment of our hymns, and stirs the #singer and the #sage.

p: joint-sharer of each #offering, the driver of the chariot #steeds; The Rsi who is good to #man, the #singer's #Friend and faithful Guard.

p: One who is #Lord of Suca, #Lord of Suca caring for herself: Weaving the raiment of the sheep and making raiment beautiful.

p: The #mighty #Lord of #spoil and #wealth, #Strong #Friend of all prosperity; He with #light movement shakes his beard, lovely and ne’er to be deceived.

p: O @Pusan. May those goats of thine turn hitherward thy chariot-pole. #Friend of all suppliants; art thou, #born in old time, and arm and sure.

p: May the majestic @Pusan speed our chariot with his power and #might. May he increase our store of #wealth and listen to this #call of ours.

hymns.title: HYMN XXVII. Indra.
hymns.text:
p: THIS, #singer, is my firm determination, to aid the #worshipper who pours the #Soma. I subdue the #man who brings no milkoblation, unrighteous, powerful, the truth's perverter.

p: Then Will I, when I lead my #friends to battle against the radiant persons of the godless, prepare for thee at #home a vigorous bullock, and pour for thee the fifteen-fold #strong juices.

p: I know not him who sayeth and declareth that he hath slain the godless in the battle. Soon as they see the furious combat raging, #men speak forth praises of my vigorous #horses.

p: While yet my deeds of #might were unrecorded, all passed for @Indra, @Indra, @Varuna, and @Mitra, #Soma, @Maghavan, @Savitar, Visnus though I existed. The potent one who dwelt in peace I conquered, grasped by the foot and slew him on the mountain.

p: None hinder me in mine heroic exploits, no, not the #mountains when I will and purpose. Even the deaf will tremble at my roaring, and every day will dust be agitated.

p: To see the Indraless oblation-drinkers, mean offerers, o’ertaken by destruction! Then shall the fellies of my #car pass over those who have blamed my joyous #Friend and scorned him.

p: Thou wast, thou grewest to full vital vigour: an earlier saw, a later one shall see thee. Two canopies, as ’twere, are round about him who reacheth to the limit of this region.

p: The freed kine eat the barley of the pious. 1 saw them as they wandered with the herdsman. The calling of the pious rang around them. What portion will these kine afford their owner?

p: When we who cat the #grass of #men are gathered I am with barley-eaters in the corn-land. There shall the captor yoke the yokeless bullock, and he who hath been yoked seek one to loose him.

p: There wilt thou hold as true my spoken purpose, to bring together quadrupeds. and bipeds. I will divide, without a fight, his #riches who warreth here, against the Bull, with women.

p: When a #man's daughter hath been ever eyeless, who, knowing, will be wroth with her for blindness? Which of the two will loose on him his anger-the #man who leads her #home or he who woos her?

p: How many a #maid is pleasing to the suitor who fain would marry for her splendid #riches? If the girl be both good and fair of feature, she finds, herself, a #friend among the #people.

p: His feet have grasped: he eats the #man who meets him. Around his head he sets the head for shelter. Sitting anear and right above he smites us, and follows $Earth that lies spread out beneath him.

p: High, leafless, shadowless, and swift is $Heaven: the #Mother stands, the Youngling, loosed, is feeding. Loud hath she lowed, licking Another's #offspring. In what world hath the #Cow laid down her udder?

p: Seven #heroes from the nether part ascended, and from the upper part came eight together. Nine from behind came armed with winnowing-baskets: ten from the front pressed o’er the rock's high ridges.

p: One of the ten, the tawny, shared in common, they send to execute their final purpose. The #Mother carries on her breast the Infant of noble #form and soothes it while it knows not.

p: The #Heroes dressed with fire the fatted wether: the #dice were thrown by way of sport and gaming. Two reach the plain amid the heavenly #waters, hallowing and with means of purifying.

p: Crying aloud they ran in all directions: One half of them will cook, and not the other. To me hath @Indra, @Indra, @Varuna, and @Mitra, #Soma, @Maghavan, @Savitar, @Visnu, this @Deva, declared it: He will perform, whose #food is wood and butter.

p: I saw a troop advancing from the distance moved, not by wheels but their own @Deva.like nature. The Friendly One seeks #human generations, destroying, still new bands of evil beings.

p: These my two Bulls, even Pramara's, are harnessed: drive them not far; here let them often linger. The #waters even shall aid him to his object, and the all-cleansing #Sun who is above us.

p: This is the thunderbolt which often whirleth down from the lofty misty realm of @Surya. Beyond this realm there is another #glory so through old age they pass and feel no sorrow.

p: Bound fast to,every tree the #cow is lowing, and thence the #man-consuming birds are flying, then all this world, though pressing #juice for @Indra and strengthening the Rsi, is affrighted.

p: In the #Devas’ mansion stood the first-created, and from their separation came the later. Three warm the $Earth while holding stores of #water, and Two of these convey the murmuring moisture.

p: This is thy #life: and do thou mark and know it. As such, hide not thyself in time of battle. He manifests the #light and hides the vapour: his foot is never free from robes that veil it.

hymns.title: HYMN XXVIII. Indra. Vasukra.
hymns.text:
p: Now all my other #friends are here assembled: my Sire-in-law alone hath not come hither. So #might he eat the grain and drink the #Soma, and, satisfied, return unto; his dwelling.

p: Loud belloweth the Bull whose horns are sharpened: upon the height above $Earth's breadth he standeth. That #man I guard and save in all his troubles who fills my flanks when he hath shed the #Soma.

p: #Men with the stone press out for thee, O @Indra, #strong, gladdening #Soma, and thereof thou drinkest. Bulls they dress for thee, and of these thou eatest when, @Indra, @Indra, @Varuna, and @Mitra, #Soma, @Maghavan, @Savitar, @Visnu, with #food thou art invited.

p: Resolve for me, O #singer, this my riddle: The #rivers send their swelling #water backward: The fox steals up to the approaching lion: the jackal drives the wild-boar from the brushwood.

p: How shall I solve this riddle, I, the simple, declare the thought of thee the #Wise and #Mighty? Tell us, well knowing, as befits the season: Whitherward is thy prosperous #car advancing?

p: Thus do they magnify me, me the #mighty higher than even high $Heaven is my #car-pole. I all at once demolish many thousands: my Sire begot me with no foe to match me.

p: Yea, and the #Devas have known me also, @Indra, as #mighty, fierce and #strong in every exploit. Exulting with the bolt I slaughtered @Vrtra, and for the offerer oped with #might the #cow-stall.

p: The #Deities approached, they carried axes; splitting the wood they came with their @Attendants. They laid good timber in the fire-receivers, and burnt the #grass up where they found it growing.

p: The hare hath swallowed up the opposing razor: I sundered with a clod the distant mountain. The great will I make subject to the little: the calf shall wax in strength and cat the bullock.

p: There hath the #strong-winged eagle left his talon, as a snared lion leaves the trap that caught him. Even the wild steer in his thirst is captured: the leather strap still holds his foot entangled.

p: May the leather strap their foot entangle who fatten on the #offerings of the Brahman. They all devour the bulls set free to wander, while they themselves destroy their bodies' vigour.

p: They were well occupied with holy duties who sped in person with their lauds to #Soma. Speaking like #man, mete to us #wealth and booty: in $Heaven thou hast the name and fame of #Hero.

hymns.title: HYMN XXIX. Indra.
hymns.text:
p: As sits the young #bird on the tree rejoicing, ye, swift Pair, have been roused by clear laudation, whose Herald-Monk through many days is @Indra, $Earth's Guardian, #Friend of #men, the best of #Heroes.

p: May we, when this @Dawn and the next dance hither, be thy best servants, most heroic #Hero! Let the victorious #car with triple #splendour bring hitherward the hundred chiefs with @Kutsa.

p: What was the gladdening draught that pleased thee, @Indra? Speed through our doors to #songs, for thou art #mighty. Why comest thou to me, what #gift attracts thee? Fain would I bring thee #food most meet to offer.

p: @Indra, what fame hath one like thee mid #heroes? With what plan wilt thou act? Why hast thou sought us? As a true #Friend, Wide-Strider! to sustain us, since #food absorbs the thought of each among us.

p: Speed happily those, as @Surya ends his #journey, who meet his wish as bridegrooms meet their #spouses; #Men who present, O @Indra #strong by nature, with #food the many #songs that tell thy praises.

p: Thine are two measures, @Indra, wide-wellmeted, $Heaven for thy majesty, $Earth for thy wisdom. Here for thy choice are Somas mixed with butter. May the sweet #meath be pleasant for thy drinking.

p: They have poured out a bowl to him, to @Indra, full of sweet #juice, for faithful is his bounty. O'er $Earth's expanse hath he grown great by wisdom, the #Friend of #man, and by heroic exploits.

p: @Indra hath conquered in his wars, the #Mighty: #men strive in multitudes to win his friendship. #Ascend thy chariot as it were in battle, which thou shalt drive to us with gracious favour.

hymns.title: HYMN XXX. Waters.
hymns.text:
p: As ’twere with swift exertion of the #spirit, let the #Sage speed to the #celestial #Waters, the #glorious #food of @Varuna and @Mitra. To him who spreadeth far this laud I offer.

p: Adhvaryus, he ye ready with oblations, and come with longing to the longing #Waters, Down on which looks the. purple-tinted Eagle. Pour ye that flowing wave this day, deft-handed.

p: Go to the #reservoir, O ye Adhvaryus #worship the #Waters’ #Child with your oblations. A consecrated wave he now will give you, so press for him the #Soma rich in sweetness.

p: He who shines bright in floods, unfed with fuel, whom sages #worship at their #offers: Give #waters rich in sweets, #Child of the #Waters, even those which gave heroic #might to @Indra:

p: Those in which #Soma joys and is delighted, as a young #man with fair and pleasant damsels. Go thou unto those #Waters, O Adhvaryu, and purify with herbs what thou infusest.

p: So maidens bow before the youthful gallant who comes with love to them who yearn to meet him. In heart accordant and in wish one-minded are the Adhvaryus and the heavenly #Waters.

p: He who made room for you when fast imprisoned, who freed you from the #mighty imprecation. Even to that @Indra send the #meath-rich current, the wave that gratifies the #Devas, O #Waters.

p: Send forth to him the #meath-rich wave, O #Rivers, which is your #offspring and a well of sweetness, Oil-balmed, to be implored at #offers. Ye wealthy #Waters, hear mine invocation.

p: Send forth the rapture-giving wave, O #Rivers, which @Indra drinks, which sets the Twain in motion; The well that springeth from the clouds, desirous, that wandereth triple-formed, distilling transport.

p: These winding #Streams which with their double current, like #cattle-raiders, seek the lower pastures. #Waters which dwell together, thrive together, Queens, Mothers of the world, these, Rsi, honour.

p: Send forth  'our #offering with holy #worship send forth the #hymn and prayer for gain of #riches. For need of #offering disclose the udder. Give gracious hearing to our #call, O #Waters.

p: For, wealthy #Waters, ye control all #treasure.s: ye bring auspicious intellect and Amrta. Ye are the Queens of independent #riches @Sarasvati give full #life to the #singer!

p: When I behold the #Waters coming hither, carrying with them #milk and mcath and butter, bearing the well-pressed #Soma #juice to @Indra, they harmonize in #spirit with Adhvaryus.

p: Rich, they are come with #wealth for living beings, O #friends, Adhvaryus, seat them in their places. Seat them on holy #grass, ye #Soma-bringers in harmony with the #Offspring of the #Waters.

p: Now to this #grass are come the longing #Waters: the Pious Ones are seated at our #worship. Adbvaryus, press the #Soma #juice for @Indra so will the service of the #Devas be easy.

hymns.title: HYMN XXXI, Devas.
hymns.text:
p: MAY benediction of the #Devas approach us, holy, to aid us with all rapid assists. Therewit. May we be happily befriended, and pass triumphant over all our troubles.

p: A #man should think on #wealth and strive to win it by adoration on the path of #Order, Counsel himself with his own mental insight, and grasp still nobler vigour with his #spirit.

p: The #hymn is formed, poured are the allotted portions: as to a ford #friends come unto the Wondrous. We have obtained the power of case and comfort, we haVe become acquainted, with Immortals.

p: Pleased be the Eternal #Lord who loves the household with this #man whom @Deva.@Indra, @Indra, @Varuna, and @Mitra, #Soma, @Maghavan, @Savitar, @Visnu created. May @Bhaga @Aryaman grace him with #cattle. May he appear to him, and be, delightful.

p: Like the #Dawns' dwelling-place be this assembly, where in their #might #men rich in #food have gathered. Striving to share the praises of this #singer. To us come strengthening and effectual #riches!

p: This Bull's most gracious far-extended favour existed first of all in full abundance. By his support they are maintained in common who in the #Asura's mansion dwell together.

p: What was the tree, what wood, in sooth, produced it, from which they fashioned forth the $Earth and $Heaven? These Twain stand fast and wax not old forever: these have sung #praise to many a day and #morning.

p: Not only here is this: more is beyond us. He is the Bull, the $Heaven's and $Earth's supporter. With power divine he makes his skin a filter, when the Bay Coursers bear him on as @Surya.

p: He passes o’er the broad $Earth like a Stega: he penetrates the world as Wind the mist-cloud. He, balmed with oil, near @Varuna and @Mitra, like @Agni in the wood, hath shot forth #splendour.

p: When suddenly called the #cow that erst was barren, she, self-protected, ended all her troubles. $Earth, when the first #son sprang from sire and #mother, cast up the gami, that which #men were seeking.

p: To Nrsad's #son they gave the name of Kainva, and he the brown-hued courser won the #treasure.. For him dark-coloured streamed the shining udder: none made it swell for him. Thus #Order willed it.

hymns.title: HYMN XXXII. Indra.
hymns.text:
p: FORTH speed the Pair to bring the meditating @Deva, benevolent with boons sent in return for boons. May @Indra graciously accept both #gifts from us, when he hath knowledge of the flowing #Soma #juice.

p: Thou wanderest far, O @Indra, through the spheres of #light and realms of $Earth, the region, thou whom many #praise! Let those who often bring their solemn rites conquer the noisy babblers who present no #gifts.

p: More beautiful than #beauty must this seem to me, when the #son duly careth for his #parents' line. The #wife attracts the #husband: with a shout of #joy the #man's auspicious marriage is performed aright.

p: This beauteous place of meeting have I looked upon, where, like MilchCows, the kine #order the marriage train; Where the Herd's #Mother counts as first and best of all, and round her are the seven-toned #people of the choir.

p: The Pious One hath reached your place before the rest: One only moves victorious with the #Rudras' band. To these your helpers pour our #meath, #Immortal #Devas, with whom your #song of #praise hath power to win their #gifts.

p: He who maintains the Laws of @Deva.informed me that thou wast lying hidden in the #waters. @Indra, who knoweth well, beheld and showed thee. By him instructed am I come, O @Agni.

p: The stranger asks the way of him who knows it: taught by the skilful guide he travels onward. This is, in truth, the #blessing of instruction: he finds the path that leads directly forward.

p: Even now he breathed: these days hath he remembered. Concealed, he sucked the bosom of his #Mother. Yet in his youth old age hath come upon him: he hath grown gracious, good, and free from anger.

p: O Kalasa, all these blessings will we bring them, O Kurusravana, who give rich presents. May he, O wealthy princes, and this #Soma which I am bearing in my heart, reward you.

hymns.title: HYMN XXXIII. Various Deities.
hymns.text:
p: THE urgings of the #people have impelled me, and by,the nearest way I bring you @Pusan. The Universal #Devas have brought me safely. The cry was heard, behold, Dubsasu cometh!

p: The ribs that compass me give pain and trouble me like rival wives. Indigence, nakedness, exhaustion press me sore: my mind is fluttering like a #bird's.

p: As rats eat weavers' threads, cares are consuming me, thy #singer, gatakratu, me. Have mercy on us once, O @Indra, Bounteous #Lord: be thou a #Father unto us.

p: I the monks' Rsi chose as prince most liberal Kurusravana, the #son of Trasadasyu's #son,

p: Whose three bays harnessed to the #car bear me straight onward: I will laud The giver of a thousand meeds,

p: The sire of Upamasravas, even him whose words were passing sweet, as a fair field is to its #lord.

p: Mark, Upamasravas, his #son, mark, grandson of Mitratithi: I am thy #father's eulogist.

p: If I controlled #Immortal #Devas, yea, even were I #Lord of #men, My liberal prince were living still.

p: None lives, even had he hundred lives, beyond the statute of the #Devas So am I parted from my #friend.

hymns.title: HYMN XXXIV. Dice, Etc.
hymns.text:
p: SPRUNG from tall trees on windy heights, these rollers transport me as they turn upon the table. Dearer to me the die that never slumbers than the deep draught of Mujavan's own #Soma.

p: She never vexed me nor was angry with me, but to my #friends and me was ever gracious. For the die's sake, whose single point is final, mine own devoted #wife I alienated.

p: My #wife holds me aloof, her #mother hates me: the wretched #man finds none to give him comfort. As of a costly #horse grown old and feeble, I find not any profit of the gamester.

p: Others caress the #wife of him whose #riches the die hath coveted, that rapid courser: Of him speak #father, #mother, brothers saying, We know him not: bind him and take him with you.

p: When I resolve to play with these no longer, my #friends depart from me and leave me lonely. When the brown #dice, thrown on the #board, have rattled, like a fond girl I seek the place of meeting.

p: The gamester seeks the $GamblingHouse, and wonders, his body all afire, shall I be lucky? Still do the #dice extend his eager longing, staking his gains against his adversary.

p: #Dice, verily, are armed with goads and driving-hooks, deceiving and tormenting, causing grievous woe. They give frail #gifts and then destroy the #man who wins, thickly anointed with the player's fairest good.

p: Merrily sports their troop, the three-and-fifty, like @Indra, @Indra, @Varuna, and @Mitra, #Soma, @Maghavan, @Savitar, @Visnu the @Deva whose ways are faithful. They bend not even to the #mighty's anger: the #King himself pays homage and reveres them.

p: Downward they roll, and then spring quickly upward, and, handless, force the #man with hands to serve them. Cast on the #board, like lumps of magic charcoal, though cold themselves they burn the heart to ashes.

p: The @Gambler's #wife is left forlorn and wretched: the #mother mourns the #son who wanders homeless. In constant fear, in debt, and seeking #riches, he goes by night unto the #home of others.

p: Sad is the @Gambler when he sees a @Matron, another's #wife, and his well-ordered dwelling. He yokes the brown #steeds in the early #morning, and when the fire is cold sinks down an outcast.

p: To the great @Captain of your #mighty army, who hath become the host's imperial #leader, to him I show my ten extended fingers: I speak the truth. No #wealth am I withholding.

p: Play not with #dice: no, cultivate thy corn-land. Enjoy the gain, and deem that #wealth sufficient. There are thy #cattle there thy #wife, O @Gambler. So this good @Indra, @Indra, @Varuna, and @Mitra, #Soma, @Maghavan, @Savitar, @Visnu himself hath told me.

p: Make me your #friend: show us some little mercy. Assail us not with your terrific fierceness. Appeased be your malignity and anger, and let the brown #dice snare some other captive.

hymns.title: HYMN XXXV, Devas.
hymns.text:
p: THESE fires associate with @Indra are awake, bringing their #light when first the @Dawn begins to #shine. May $Heaven and $Earth, great Pair, observe our holy #work. We claim for us this day the favour of the #Devas.

p: Yea, for ourselves we claim the grace of $Heaven and $Earth, of Saryanavan, of the Hills and #Mother #Streams. For innocence we pray to @Surya and to @Dawn. May the flowing #Soma bring us #bliss to-day.

p: May the great Twain, the Mothers. $Heaven and $Earth, this day preserve us free from sin for peace and happiness. May #Morning sending forth her #light drive sin afar. We meditate to kindled @Agni for felicity.

p: May this first @Dawn bring us the host of gracious #Devas: rich. May it richly #shine for us who strive for #wealth. The wrath of the malignan. May we keep afar. We meditate to kindled @Agni for feilicity.

p: #Dawns, who come forward with the bright beams of the #Sun, and at your earliest flushing bring to us the #light, #Shine ye on us to-day auspicious, for renown. We meditate to kindled @Agni for felicity.

p: Free from all sicknes. May the Mornings come to us, and let our fires mount upward with a lofty blaze. The Asvin Pair have harnessed their swift-moving #car. We meditate to kindled @Agni for felicity.

p: Send us to-day a portion choice and #excellent, O @Indra, @Indra, @Varuna, and @Mitra, #Soma, @Maghavan, @Savitar, @Visnu, for thou art he who dealeth #wealth. I cry to @Dhisana, #Mother of opulence. We meditate to kindled @Agni for felicity.

p: Further me this declaring of Eternal Law, the Law of #Devas, as we mortals acknowledge it! The #Sun goes up beholding all the rays of morn. We meditate to kindled @Agni for felicity.

p: This day we pray with innocence in strewing #grass, adjusting #pressing-stones, and perfecting the #hymn. Thou in the @Adityas’ keeping movest restlessly. We meditate to kindled @Agni for felicity.

p: To our great holy #grass I bid the #Devas at morn to #banquet, and will seat them as the seven monks. @Varuna, @Indra, @Mitra, @Bhaga for our gain. We meditate to kindled @Agni for felicity.

p: Come hither, O @Adityas, for our perfect weal: accordant #help  'our #offering that we may thrive. @Pusan, @Narasamsa, @Bhaga, both @Asvins, and enkindled @Agni we implore for happiness.

p: @Adityas, #Devas, vouchsafe that this our hom. May be #praise-worthy, prosperous, our #heroes' sure defence, for #cattle, for our #sons, for #progeny, for #life. We meditate to kindled @Agni for felicity.

p: This da. May all the #Maruts, all he near us with aid. May all our fires be well enkindled. May all #Devas come to us with gracious favour. May #spoil and #wealth he ours, and all possessions.

p: He whom ye aid, O #Deities, in battle, whom ye protect and rescue from affliction, who fears no danger at your #milk-libation, -suc. May we be to feast the #Devas, ye #Mighty.

hymns.title: HYMN XXXVI, Devas.
hymns.text:
p: THERE are the @Dawn and Night, the grand and beauteous Pair, $Earth. $Heaven, and @Varuna, @Mitra, and @Aryaman. @Indra I #call, the #Maruts, #Mountains, and the Floods, @Adityas. $Heaven and $Earth, the #Waters, and the $Sky.

p: May #Dyaus and @Prthivi, #wise, true to Holy Law, keep us in safety from distress and injury. Let not malignant Nirrti rule over us. We crave to-day this gracious favour of the #Devas.

p: #Mother of @Mitra and of opulent @Varuna. May @Aditi preserve us safe from all distress. May we obtain the #light of $Heaven without a foe. We crave this gracious favour of the #Devas to-day.

p: May ringing press-stones keep the @Raksasas afar, ill dream, and Nirrti, and each voracious fiend. May the @Adityas and the #Maruts shelter us. We crave this gracious favour of the #Devas to-day.

p: Full #flow #libations; on our #grass let @Indra sit; @Narasamsa the #singer laud with Sama hymns! #Wise be our hearts' imaginings that we may live. We crave this gracious favour of the #Devas to-day.

p: Ye @Asvins, make  'our #offering #ascend to $Heaven, and animate the rite that he may send us #bliss, Offered with holy oil, with forward-speeding rein. We crave the gracious favour of the #Devas to-day.

p: Hither I #call the band of #Maruts, swift to hear, great, purifying, bringing #bliss, to he our #Friends. May we increase our #wealth to glorify our name. We crave this graciousfavour of the #Devas to-day.

p: We bring the Stay of #Life, who makes the #waters swell, swift-hearing, #Friend of #Devas, who waits on #offering. May we control that Power, #Soma whose rays are bright. We crave this gracious favour of the #Devas to-day.

p: Alive ourselves, with living #sons, devoid of guilt. May we win this with winners by fair means to win. Let the prayer-haters bear our sin to every side. We crave this gracious favour of the #Devas to-day.

p: Hear us, O ye who claim the #worship of #mankind, and give us, O ye #Devas, the #gift for which we meditate, Victorious wisdom, fame with #heroes and with #wealth. We crave to-day this gracious favour of the #Devas.

p: We crave the gracious favour of the #Devas to-day, great favour of great #Devas, sublime and free from foes, that we may gain rich #treasure. sprung from #hero #sons. We crave this gracious favour of the #Devas to-day.

p: In great enkindled @Agni's keeping, and, for #bliss, free from all sin before @Mitra and @Varuna. May we share @Indra, @Indra, @Varuna, and @Mitra, #Soma, @Maghavan, @Savitar, @Visnu's best animating #help. We crave this gracious favour of the #Devas to-day.

p: All ye, the #Devas whom @Indra, @Indra, @Varuna, and @Mitra, #Soma, @Maghavan, @Savitar, @Visnu the #Father of truth, and @Varuna and @Mitra govern, Give us prosperity with #hero children, and opulence in kine and various #treasure..

p: @Indra, @Indra, @Varuna, and @Mitra, #Soma, @Maghavan, @Savitar, @Visnu, @Indra, @Indra, @Varuna, and @Mitra, #Soma, @Maghavan, @Savitar, @Visnu from cast and westward, @Indra, @Indra, @Varuna, and @Mitra, #Soma, @Maghavan, @Savitar, @Visnu, @Indra, @Indra, @Varuna, and @Mitra, #Soma, @Maghavan, @Savitar, @Visnu from north and southward, @Indra, @Indra, @Varuna, and @Mitra, #Soma, @Maghavan, @Savitar, @Visnu send us perfect health and comfort, @Indra, @Indra, @Varuna, and @Mitra, #Soma, @Maghavan, @Savitar, @Visnu let our days of #life be lengthened!

hymns.title: HYMN XXXVII. Surya.
hymns.text:
p: Do homage unto @Varuna's and @Mitra's Eye: offer this solemn #worship to the #Mighty @Deva, who seeth far away, the Ensign, #born of #Devas. Sing praises unto @Surya, to the #Son of #Dyaus.

p: May this my truthful speech guard me on every side wherever $Heaven and $Earth and days are spread abroad. All else that is in motion finds a place of rest: the #waters ever #flow and ever mounts the #Sun.

p: No godless #man from time remotest draws thee down when thou art driving forth with winged dappled #Steeds. One lustre waits upon thee moving to the cast, and, @Surya, thou arisest with a different #light.

p: O @Surya, with the #light whereby thou scatterest gloom, and with thy ray impellest every moving thing, Keep far from us all feeble, worthless #offering, and drive away disease and every evil dream.

p: Sent forth thou guardest well the Universe's law, and in thy wonted way arisest free from wrath. When @Surya, we address our meditations to thee to-day. May the #Devas favour this our purpose and desire.

p: This invocation, these our word. May $Heaven and $Earth, and @Indra and the #Waters and the #Maruts hear. Ne’e. May we suffer want in presence of the #Sun, and, living happy lives. May we attain old age.

p: Cheerful in #spirit, evermore, and keen of sight, with store of children, free from sickness and from sin, Long-living. May we look, O @Surya, upon thee uprising day by day, thou great as @Mitra is!

p: @Surya. May we live long and look upon thee still, thee, O Far-seeing One, bringing the #glorious #light, the radiant @Deva, the spring of #joy to every eye, as thou art mounting up o’er the high shining flood.

p: Thou by whose lustre all the world of #life comes forth, and by thy beams again returns unto its rest, O @Surya with the golden hair, #ascend for us day after day, still bringing purer innocence.

p: Bless us with #shine, bless us with perfect daylight, bless us with cold, with fervent heat and lustre. Bestow on us, O @Surya, varied #riches, to bless us in our #home and when we travel.

p: #Devas, to our living creatures of both kinds vouchsafe protection, both to bipeds and to quadrupeds, that the, may drink and eat invigorating #food. So grant us health and strength and perfect innocence.

p: If by some grievous sin we have provoked the #Devas, O #Deities, with the tongue or thoughtlessness of heart, that guilt, O #Vasus, lay upon the Evil One, on him who ever leads us into deep distress.

hymns.title: HYMN XXXVIII. Indra.
hymns.text:
p: O @Indra, in this battle great and #glorious, in this loud din of war #help us to #victory, Where in the strife for kine among bold ring-decked #men arrows fly all around and #heroes are subdued.

p: At #home disclose to us opulence rich in #food, streaming with #milk, O @Indra, meet to be renowned. @Sakra. May we be thine, the friendly Conqueror's: even as we desire, O @Vasu, so do thou.

p: The godless #man, much-lauded @Indra, whether he be Dasa or be Arya, who would war with us. Easy to conquer he for thee, with us, these foes: with the, may we subdue them in the clash of fight.

p: Him who must be invoked by many and by few, who standeth nigh with comfort in the war of #men, @Indra, famed #Hero, winner in the deadly strife, let us bring hitherward to-day to favour us.

p: For, @Indra, I have heard thee called Self. capturer, One, Steer! who never yields, who urges even the churl. Release thyself from @Kutsa and come hither. How shall one like thee sit still bound that h. May not move?

hymns.title: HYMN XXXIX. Asvins.
hymns.text:
p: As ’twere the name of #father, easy to invoke, we all assembled here invoke this #Car of yours, @Asvins, your swiftly-rolling circumambient #Car which he who worships must invoke at eve and @Dawn.

p: Awake all pleasant strains and let the hymns #flow forth: raise up abundant fulness: this is our desire. @Asvins, bestow on us a #glorious heritage, and give our princes #treasure. fair as #Soma is.

p: Ye are the #bliss of her who groweth old at #home, and helpers of the slow although he linger last. #Men #call you too, @Nasatyas, healers of the blind, the thin and feeble, and the #man with broken bones.

p: Ye made Cyavana, weak and worn with length of days, young again, like a #car, that he had power to move. Ye lifted up the #son of @Tugra from the floods. At our #libations must all these your acts be praised.

p: We will declare among the folk your ancient deeds heroic; yea, ye were Physicians bringing health. You, you who must be lauded, will we bring for aid, so that this foe of ours, O @Asvins. May believe.

p: Listen to me, O @Asvins; I have cried to you. Give me-your aid as sire and #mother aid their #son. Poor, without kin or #friend or ties of blood am I. Save me before it be too late, from this my curse.

p: Ye, mounted on your chariot brought to @Vimada the comely #maid of Purumitra as a bride. Ye, came unto the calling of the weakling's dame, and granted noble #offspring to the happy #wife.

p: Ye gave a ain the vigour of his youthful #life to tge #sage Kali when old age was coming nigh. Ye rescued Vandana and raised him from the pit, and in a moment gave $Vispala power to move.

p: Ye @Asvins Twain, endowed with manly strength, brought forth @Reblia when hidden in the cave and well-nigh dead, freed Saptavadliri, and for @Atri caused the pit heated with fire to be a pleasant resting-place.

p: On Pedu ye bestowed, @Asvins, a courser white, #mighty with nine-and-ninety varied #gifts of strength, a #horse to be renowned, who bore his #friend at speed, #joy-giving, @Bhaga-like to be invoked of #men.

p: From no side, ye Two #Kings whom non. May check or stay, doth grief, distress, or danger come u on the #man Whom, @Asvins swift to hear, borne on your glowing path, ye with your Consort make the foremost in the race.

p: Come on that Chariot which the @Rbhus wrought for you, the Chariot, @Asvins, that is speedier than thought, At harnessing whereof $Heaven's Daughter springs to birth, and from @Vivasvan come auspicious Night and Day.

p: Come, Conquerors of the sundered mountain, to our #home, @Asvins who made the #cow #stream #milk for @Sayu's sake, Ye who delivered even from the wolf's deep throat and set again at liberty the swallowed quail.

p: We have prepared this laud for you, O @Asvins, and, like the #Bhrgus, as a #car have framed it, have decked it as a #maid to meet the bridegroom, and brought it as a #son, our stay forever.

hymns.title: HYMN XL. Asvins.
hymns.text:
p: YOUR radiant Chariot-whither goes it on its way?-who decks it for you. #Heroes, for its happy course, Starting at daybreak, visiting each #morning every house, borne hitherward through prayer unto  'the #offering?

p: Where are ye, @Asvins, in the evening, where at morn? Where is your haltingplace, where rest ye for the night? Who brings you homeward, as the widow bedward draws his #brother, as the bride attracts the groom?

p: Early ye sing forth #praise as with a herald's #voice, and, meet for #worship, go each #morning to the house. Whom do ye ever bring to ruin? Unto whose #libations come ye. #Heroes, like two #Sons of #Kings?

p: Even as hunters follow two wild elephants, we with oblations #call you down at morn and eve. To folk who pay you offierings at appointed times, Chiefs ye bring #food to strengthen them.

p: To you, O @Asvins, came the daughter of a #King, Ghosa, and said, O #Heroes, this I beg of you: Be near me in the day, he near me in the night: #help me to gain a #car-borne chieftain rich in #steeds.

p: O @Asvins, ye are #wise: as @Kutsa comes to #men, bring your #car nigh the folk of him who sings your #praise. The bee, O @Asvins, bears your honey in her mouth, as the #maid carries it purified in her hand.

p: To Bhujyu and to Vasa ye come near with #help, O @Asvins, to Sinjara and to @Usana. Your #worshipper secures your friendship for himself. Through your protection I desire felicity.

p: Krsa and @Sayu ye protect, ye @Asvins Twain: ye Two assist the widow and the #worshipper; And ye throw open, @Asvins, unto those who win the #cattle-stall that thunders with its serenfold mouth.

p: The #Woman hath brought forth, the Infant hath appeared, the plants of wondrous #beauty straightway have sprung up. To him the #rivers run as down a deep descent, and he this day becomes their #master and their #lord.
