p: They mourn the living, cry aloud, at #offering: the #men have set their thoughts upon a distant cast. A lovely thing for #fathers who have gathered here.a #joy to husbands.are the wives their arms shall clasp

p: Of this we have no knowledge. Tall it forth to us, now the youth rests within the chambers of the bride. Fain would we reach the dwelling of the vigorous Steer who loves the kine, O @Asvins: this is our desire.

p: Your favouring grace hath come, ye Lords of ample #wealth: @Asvins, our longings are stored up within your hearts. Ye have become our twofold guard. May we as welcome #friends reach @Aryaman's abode.

p: Even so, rejoicing in the dwelling-place of #man, give #hero #sons and #riches to the eloquent. Make a ford where #men wel. May drink: remove the spiteful tree-stump standing in the path.

p: O @Asvins, Wonder-Workers, Lords of lustre, where and with what folk do ye #delight yourselves to-day? Who hath detained them with him? Whither are they gone? Unto what #sage's or what #worshipper's abode?

hymns.title: HYMN XLI. Asvins.
hymns.text:
p: THAT general #Car of yours, invoked by many a #man, that comes to our #libations, three-wheeled, meet for lauds, that circumambient #Car, worthy of #offering, we #call with our pure hymns at earliest flush of @Dawn.

p: Ye, O @Nasatyas, mount that early-harnessed #Car, that travels early, laden with its freight of balm, Wherewith ye. #Heroes, visit clans who #offering, even the poor #man's #worship where the #Sage attends.

p: If to the deft Adhvaryu with the #meath in hand, or to the Kindler firm in strength, the household #friend, or to the #sage's poured #libations ye approach, come thence, O @Asvins, now to drink the offered #meath.

hymns.title: HYMN XLII. Indra.
hymns.text:
p: EVEN as an archer shoots afar his arrow, offer the laud to him with meet adornment. Quell with your #voice the wicked's #voice, O sages. #Singer, make @Indra rest beside the #Soma.

p: Draw thy #Friend to thee like a #cow at milking: O #Singer, wake up @Indra as a lover. Make thou the #Hero haste to give us #riches even as a vessel filled brimful with #treasure..

p: Why, @Indra, @Indra, @Varuna, and @Mitra, #Soma, @Maghavan, @Savitar, @Visnu, do they #call thee Bounteous; Giver? Quicken me: thou, I hear, art he who quickens. @Sakra, let my intelligence be active, and bring us luck that finds great #wealth, O @Indra.

p: Standing, in battle for their rights, together, the #people, @Indra, in the fray invoke thee. Him who brings #gifts the #Hero makes his comrade: with him who pours no #juice he seeks not friendship.

p: Whoso with plenteous #food for him expresses #strong Somas as much quickly-coming #treasure., for him he overthrows in early #morning his swift well-weaponed foes, and subdues the tyrant.

p: He unto whom we offer praises, @Indra, @Indra, @Indra, @Varuna, and @Mitra, #Soma, @Maghavan, @Savitar, @Visnu, who hath joined to ours his wishes. Before him even afar the foe must tremble: low before him must bow all #human glories.

p: With thy fierce bolt, O @Deva.invoked of many, drive to a distance from afar the foeman. O @Indra, give us #wealth in corn and #cattle, and make thy #singer's prayer gain strength and #riches.

p: @Indra, the swallower of #strong #libations rich in the boons they bring, the potent Somas. He, @Indra, @Indra, @Varuna, and @Mitra, #Soma, @Maghavan, @Savitar, @Visnu, will not restrict his bounty he brings much #wealth unto we.

p: Yea, by superior play he wins advantage, when he, a @Gambler, piles his gains in season. Celestial-natured, he o’erwhelms with #riches the devotee who keeps not back his #treasure..

p: O Much-invoked. May we subdue all famine and evil want with store of grain and #cattle. May we allied, as first in rank, with princes obtain possessions by our own exertion.

p: @Narasamsa protect us from the rearward, and from above, and from below, from sinners! May @Indra from the front, and from the centre, as #Friend to #friends, vouchsafe us room and freedom.

hymns.title: HYMN XLIII. Indra.
hymns.text:
p: IN perfect unison all yearning hymns of mine that find the #light of $Heaven have sung forth @Indra's #praise. As wives embrace their #lord, the comely bridegroom, so they compass @Indra, @Indra, @Varuna, and @Mitra, #Soma, @Maghavan, @Savitar, @Visnu about that h. May #help.

p: Directed unto thee my #spirit never strays, for I have set my hopes on thee, O Much-invoked! Sit, Wonderful! as #King upon the sacred #grass, and let thy drinking-place be by the #Soma #juice.

p: From indigence and hunger @Indra turns away: @Indra, @Indra, @Varuna, and @Mitra, #Soma, @Maghavan, @Savitar, @Visnu hath dominion over precious #wealth. These the Seven #Rivers flowing on their downward path increase the vital vigour of the potent Steer.

p: As on the fair-leafed tree rest birds, to @Indra #flow the gladdening #Soma juices that the bowls contain. Their face that glows with #splendour through their #mighty power hath found the #shine of $Heaven for #man, the Aryas' #light.

p: As in the game a @Gambler piles his winnings, so @Indra, @Indra, @Varuna, and @Mitra, #Soma, @Maghavan, @Savitar, @Visnu, sweeping all together, gained the #Sun This #mighty deed of thine none other could achieve, none, @Indra, @Indra, @Varuna, and @Mitra, #Soma, @Maghavan, @Savitar, @Visnu, before thee, none in recent time.

p: @Indra, @Indra, @Varuna, and @Mitra, #Soma, @Maghavan, @Savitar, @Visnu came by turns to all the tribes of #men: the Steer took notice of the #people's #songs of #praise. The #man in whose #libations @Sakra hath #delight by means of potent Somas vanquisheth his foes.

p: When #Soma #streams together unto @Indra #flow like #waters to the #river, rivulets to the #lake, in place of #offering sages exalt his #might, as the #rain swells the corn by moisture sent from $Heaven.

p: He rushes through the region like a furious Bull, he who hath made these floods the #dames of worthy lords. This @Indra, @Indra, @Varuna, and @Mitra, #Soma, @Maghavan, @Savitar, @Visnu hath found #light for the #man who brings oblation, sheds the #juice, and promptly pours his #gifts.

p: Let the keen axe come forth together with the #light: here be.as erst, the teeming #cow of #offering. Let the Red @Deva.#shine bright with his refulgent ray, and let the #Lord of #heroes glow like $Heaven's clear sheen.

p: O Much-invoked. May we subdue all famine and evil want with store of grain and #cattle. May we allied, as first in rank, with princes obtain possessions by our own exertion.

p: @Narasamsa protect us from the rearward, and from above, and from below, from sinners. May @Indra from the front, and from the centre, as #Friend to #friends, vouchsafe us room and freedom.

hymns.title: HYMN XLIV. Indra.
hymns.text:
p: MAY Sovran @Indra come to the carousal, he who by Holy Law is #strong and active, the overcomer of all conquering forces with his great steer-like power that hath no limit.

p: Firm-seated is thy #car, thy #Steeds are docile; thy hand, O #King, holds, firmly grasped, the thunder. On thy fair path, O #Lord of #men, come quickly: we will increase thy #powers when thou hast drunken.

p: Let #strong and #mighty #Steeds who bear this #Mighty @Indra, the #Lord of #men, whose arm wields thunder, Bring unto us, as sharers of our #banquet, the Steer of conquering #might, of real vigour.

p: So like a Bull thou rushest to the #Lord who loves the trough, the #Sage, the prop of vigour, in the vat, prepare thine energies, collect them in thyself: be for our profit as the #Master of the #wise.

p: May precious #treasure.s come to us-so will I pray. Come to the votary's #gift offered with beauteous laud. Thou art the #Lord, as such sit on this holy #grass: thy vessels are inviolate as Law commands.

p: Far went our earlist invocation of the #Devas, and won us glories that can never be surpassed. They who could not #ascend the ship of #offering, sink down in desolation, trembling with alarm.

p: So be the others, evil-hearted, far away, whose #horses, difficult to harness, have been yoked. Here in advance #men stand anear to offer #gifts, by whom full many a #work that brings reward is done.

p: He firmly fixed the plains and #mountains as they shook. #Dyaus thundered forth and made the #air's mid-region quake. He stays apart the two confronting bowls; he sings lauds in the potent #Soma's #joy when he hath drunk.

p: I bear this deftly-fashioned goad of thine, wherewith thou, @Indra, @Indra, @Varuna, and @Mitra, #Soma, @Maghavan, @Savitar, @Visnu, shalt break the strikers with the hoof. At this libatio. Mayst thou be well satisfied. Partake the #juice, partake the #worship, @Indra, @Indra, @Varuna, and @Mitra, #Soma, @Maghavan, @Savitar, @Visnu.

p: O Much-invoked. May we subdue all famine and evil want with store of grain and #cattle. May we allied, as first in rank, with princes obtain possessions by our own exertion.

p: @Narasamsa protect us from the rearward, and from above, and from below, from sinners. May @Indra from the front and from the centre, as #Friend to #friends, vouchsafe us room and freedom.

hymns.title: HYMN XLV. Agni.
hymns.text:
p: FIRST @Agni sprang to #life from out of $Heaven: the second time from us came #Jatavedas. Thirdly the Manly-souled was in the #waters. The pious lauds and kindles him the Eternal.

p: @Agni, we know thy three #powers in three stations, we know thy forms in many a place divided. We know what name supreme thou hast in secret: we know the source from which thou hast proceeded.

p: The Manly-souled lit thee in sea and #waters, #man's Viewer lit thee in the breast of $Heaven, there as thou stoodest in the third high region the #Steers increased thee in the #water's bosom.

p: @Agni roared out, like #Dyaus what time he thunders: he licked the ground about the plants he flickered. At once, when #born, he looked around enkindled, and lightened $Heaven and $Earth within with #splendour.

p: The spring of glories and support of #riches, rouser of thoughts and guardian of the #Soma, Good #Son of Strength, a #King amid the #waters, in forefront of the #Dawns he shines enkindled.

p: Germ of the world, ensign of all creation, be sprang to #life and filled the $Earth and heavens. Even the firm rock he cleft when passing over, when the Five Tribes brought #offering to @Agni.

p: So among mortals was #Immortal @Agni stablished as holy #wise and willing envoy. He waves the red smoke that he lifts above him, striving to reach the heavens with radiant lustre.

p: Like #gold to look on, far he shone refulgent, beaming imperishable #life for #glory, @Agni by vital #powers became #immortal when his prolific #Father #Dyaus begat him.

p: Whoso this day, O @Deva whose flames are lovely, prepares a cake, O @Agni, mixt with butter, Lead thou and further him to higher fortune, to #bliss bestowed by #Devas, O thou Most Youthful.

p: Endow him, @Agni, with a share of #glory, at every #song of #praise sung forth enrich him. Dear let him be to @Surya, dear to @Agni, preeminent with #son and children's children.

p: While, @Agni, day by day #men pay thee #worship they win themselves all #treasure.s worth the wishing. Allied with thee, eager and craving #riches, they have disclosed the stable filled with #cattle.

p: @Agni, the #Friend of #men, the #Soma's keeper, @Vaisvanara, hath been lauded by the #Rsis. We will invoke benignant $Earth and $Heaven: ye #Deities, give us #wealth with #hero children.

hymns.title: HYMN XLVI. Agni.
hymns.text:
p: STABLISHED for thee, to lend thee vital forces, Giver of #wealth, Guard of his servant's body. The Great Monk, #born, who knows the clouds, Abider with #men, is seated in the lap of #waters.

p: Worshipping, seeking him with adoration like some lost creature. followed by its footprints, #Wise #Bhrgus, yearning in their hearts, pursued him, and found him lurking where the floods are gathered.

p: On the #Cow's forehead, with laborious searching, @Trita, the #offspring of Vibhiavas, found him. #Born in our houses, Youthful, #joy-bestower, he now becomes the central point of brightness.

p: Yearning, with homage, they have set and made him blithe Monk among #mankind, oblation-bearer, #Leader of rites and Purifier, envoy of #men, as #offering that still advances.

p: The foolish brought the ne’er-bewildered forward, great, Victor, #Song-inspirer, fort-destroyer. Leading the Youth #gold-bearded, like a courser gleaming with #wealth, they turned their #hymn to profit.

p: Holding his station firmly in the houses, @Trita sat down within his #home surrounded Thence, as Law bids, departs the Tribes' Companion having collected #men with no compulsion.

p: His are the fires, eternal, purifying, that make the houses move, whose smoke is shining, White, waxing in their strength, forever stirring, and sitting in the wood; like winds are Somas.

p: The tongue of @Agni bears away the praisesong, and, through his care for $Earth, her operations. Him, bright and radiant, living #men have stablished as their blithe Monk, the #Chief of Offerers.

p: That @Agni, him whom $Heaven and $Earth engendered, the #Waters. @Tvastar, and with #might, the Bhrgushim @$Matarisvan and the #Devas have fashioned holy for #man and first to be entreated.

p: @Agni, whom #Devas have made oblationbearer, and much-desiring #men regard as holy, Give #life to him who lauds thee when he worships, and then shall #glorious #men in troops adore thee.

hymns.title: HYMN XLVII. Indra Vaikuntha.
hymns.text:
p: THY right hand have we grasped in ours, O @Indra, longing for #treasure., #Treasure-#Lord of #treasure.s! Because we know thee. #Hero, #Lord of #cattle: vouchsafe us #mighty and resplendent #riches.

p: #Wealth, fully armed, good guard and kind protector, sprung from four seas, the prop and stay of #treasure.s, Fraught with great bounties, meet for #praise and #glory; vouchsafe us #mighty and resplendent #riches.

p: #Wealth, with good #Brahmans, @Indra! @Deva.attended, high, wide, and deep, arid based on broad foundations, #Strong, with famed #Rsis, conquering our foemen: vouchsafe us #mighty and resplendent #riches.

p: Victorious, #winning strength, with #hero sages, confirmed in power, most useful, #wealth-attracting, True, @Indra! crushing forts and subduing #Dasyus: vouchsafe us #mighty and resplendent #riches.

p: Wealthy in #heroes and in #cars and #horses, strength hundredfold and thousandfold, O @Indra, with manly sages, happy troops, Iight-#winning: vouchsafe us #mighty and resplentdent #riches.

p: To Saptagu the #sage, the holy-minded, to him, @Narasamsa, the #song approaches, @Angiras' #Son who must be met with homage: vouchsafe us #mighty and reslendent #riches.

p: My lauds, like envoys, craving loving-kindness, go forth to @Indra with their stron entreaty, Moving his heart and uttered by my #spirit: vouchsafe us #mighty and resplendent #riches.

p: Grant us the #boon for which I pray, O @Indra, a spacious #home unmatched among the #people. To thi. May $Heaven and $Earth accord approval: vouchsafe us #mighty and resplendent #riches.

hymns.title: HYMN XLVIII. Indra Vaikuntha.
hymns.text:
p: I WAS the first possessor of all precious gear: the #wealth of every #man I win and gather up. On me as on a #Father living creatures #call; I deal enjoyment to tho. #man who #offers #gifts.

p: I, @Indra, am Atharvan's stay and firm support: I brought forth kine to @Trita from the Dragon's grasp. I stripped the #Dasyus of their manly #might, and gave the #cattle-stalls to Matarigvan and Dadhyac.

p: For me hath @Tvastar forged the iron thunderbolt: in me the #Devas have centred intellectual power. My sheen is like the #Sun's insufferably bright: #men honour me as #Lord for past and future deeds.

p: I won myself these herdi of #cattle, #steeds and kine, and #gold in ample store, with my destructive bolt. I give full many a thousand to the #worshipper, what time the Somas and the lauds have made me glad.

p: @Indra am I non ever wins my #wealth from me never at any time am I a thrall to #death. Pressing the #Soma, ask #riches from me alone: ye, purus, in my friendship shall not suffer harm.

p: These, breathing loud in fury, two and two, who caused @Indra to bring his bolt of thunder to the fray, the challengers, I struck with deadly weapon down: firm stand what words the @Deva.speaks to his #worshippers. This One by stronger #might I conquered singly; yea, also two: shall three prevail against me? Like many sheaves upon the floor I thrash them. How can my foes, the Indraless, revile me?

p: Against the Gungus I made @Atithigva #strong, and kept him mid the folk like @Vrtra-conquering strength, when I won #glory in the great foe-subduing fight, in battle where @Karanja fell, and Parnaya.

p: With #food for mine enjoyment Sapya Nami came: he joined me as a #friend of old in search of kine. As I bestowed on him an arrow for the fight I made him worthy of the #song apd #hymn of #praise.

p: One of the two hath #Soma, seen within it; the Herdsman with the bone shows forth the other. He, fain to fight the Bull whose horns were sharpened, stood fettered in the demon's ample region.

p: I, as a @Deva, ne’er violate the statutes of #Devas, of #Vasus, Rudriyas, @Adityas. These #Devas have formed me for auspicious vigour, unconquered and invincible forever.

hymns.title: HYMN XLIX.Indra Vaikuntha.
hymns.text:
p: I HAVE enriched the #singer with surpassing #wealth; I have allowed the holy #hymn to strengthen me. I, furtherer of him who #offers #offering, have conquered in each fight the #men who #worship not.

p: The #People of the heavens, the #waters, and the $Earth have stablished me among the #Devas with @Indra's name. I took unto myself the two swift vigorous Bays that speed on divers paths, and the fierce bolt for strength.

p: With deadly blows I smote Atka for Kavi's sake; I guarded @Kutsa well with these saving helps. As @Susna's slayer I brandished the dart of #death: I gave not up the Aryan name to #Dasyu foes.

p: Smadibha, @Tugra, and the Vetasus I gave as prey to @Kutsa, #father-like, to assist him. I was a worthy #King to rule the #worshipper, when I gave Tuji dear inviolable #gifts.

p: I gave up Mrgaya to Srutarvan as his prey because he ever followed me and kept my laws. For @Ayu's sake I caused Veta to bend and bow, and into Savya's hand delivered Padgrbhi.

p: 1, I crushed Navavastva of the lofty #car, the Dasa, as the @Vrtra conquerer kills the fiends; When straightway on the region's farthest edge I brought the @Deva who makes the lights to broaden and increase.

p: I travel round about borne onward in my #might by the fleet-footed dappled #Horses of the #Sun. When #man's libation calls me to the robe of state I soon repel the powerful #Dasyu with my blows.

p: Stronger am I than Nabus, I who slew the seven: I glorified with #might @Yadu and Turvaga. I brought another low, with strength I bent his strength: I let the #mighty nine-and-ninety wax in power.

p: Bull over all the #streams that #flow along the $Earth, I took the Seven #Rivers as mine own domain. I, gifted with great wisdom, spread the floods abroad: by war I found for #man the way to high success.

p: I set within these cows the white #milk which no @Deva, not even @Tvastar's self, had there deposited. Much-longed-for, in the breasts, the udders of the kine, the savoury sweets of #meath, the #milk and #Soma #juice.

p: Even thus hath @Indra @Indra, @Indra, @Varuna, and @Mitra, #Soma, @Maghavan, @Savitar, @Visnu, truly bounteous, sped #Devas and #men with #mighty operation. The pious glorify all these thine exploits, #Lord of Bay Coursers, #Strong, and Selfresplendent.

hymns.title: HYMN L. Indra Vaikuntha.
hymns.text:
p: I LAUD your #Mighty One who joyeth in the #juice, him who is shared by all #men, who created all; @Indra, whose conquering strength is powerful in war, whose fame and manly vigour $Heaven and $Earth revere.

p: He with his #friend is active, lauded, good to #man, @Indra who must be glorified by one like me. #Hero, #Lord of the #brave, all #cars are thy #delight, warring with @Vrtra, or for #waters, or for #spoil.

p: Who are the #men whom thou wilt further, @Indra, who strive to win thy #bliss allied with #riches? Who urged thee forward to exert thy power divine, to valour, in the war for #waters on their fields?

p: Thou, @Indra, through the holy prayer art #mighty, worthy of #offering at all #libations. In every fight thou castest #heroes on the ground: thou art the noblest #song, O #Lord of all the folk.

p: #Help now, as Highest, those who toil at #offering: well do the #people know thy great protecting #might. Thou shalt be Everlasing, Giver of success yea, on all these #libations thou bestowest strength.

p: All these #libations thou makest effectual, of which thou art thyself supporter, #Son of Power. Therefore thy vessel is to be esteemed the best, #offering, holy text, prayer, and exalted speech.

p: They who with flowing #Soma pray to thee, O #Sage, to pour on them thy #gifts of opulence and #wealth, may they come forward, through their #spirit, on the path of #bliss, in the wild #joy of #Soma #juice effused.

hymns.title: HYMN LI. Agni. Devas.
hymns.text:
p: LARGE was that covering, and firm of texture, folded wherein thou enteredst the #waters. One Deity alone, O #Jatavedas @Agni, saw all thy forms in sundry places.

p: What @Deva.hath seen me? Who of all their number clearly beheld my forms in many places? Where lie, then, all the sacred logs of @Agni that lead him @Deva.ward, @Varuna and @Mitra?

p: In many places, @Agni #Jatavedas, we sought thee hidden in the plants and #waters. Then @Yama marked thee, @Deva.of wondrous #splendour! effulgent from thy tenfold secret dwelling,

p: I fled in fear from #offerings #worship, @Varuna, lest the #Devas should thus engage me. Thus were my forms laid down in many places. This, as my goal, I @Agni saw before me.

p: Come; #man is pious and would fain do #worship, he waits prepared: in gloom thou, @Agni, dwellest. Make pathways leading @Deva.ward clear and easy, and bear oblations with a kindly #spirit.

p: This goal mine elder brothers erst selected, as he who drives a #car the way to travel. So,@Varuna, I fled afar through terror, as flies the wild-bull from an archer's bowstring.

p: We give thee #life unwasting, #Jatavedas, so that, employed, thou never shalt be injured. So, nobly #born! shalt thou with kindly #spirit bear to the #Devas their share of #men's oblations.

p: Grant me the first oblations and the latter, entire, my forceful shares of holy presents, the soul of plants, the fatness of the #waters, and let there be long #life, ye #Devas, to @Agni.

p: Thine be the first oblations and the latter, entire, thy forceful shares of holy presents. Let all this #offering be thine, O @Agni, and let the world's four regions how before thee.

hymns.title: HYMN LII. Devas.
hymns.text:
p: INSTRUCT me, all ye #Devas, how I, elected your Monk, must seat me here, and how address you. Instruct me how to deal to each his portion, and by what ' path to bring you #man's oblation.

p: I sit as Monk most skilled in sacrificing: the #Maruts and all #Deities impel me. @Asvins, each day yours is the Adhvaryu's duty: Brahman and wood are here: ’tis yours to offer.

p: Who is the Monk? Is he the Monk of @Yama? On whom is thrust this @Deva-appointed honour? He springs to #life each month, each day that passes; so #Devas have made him their oblation-bearer.

p: The #Devas have made me bearer of oblations, who slipped away and passed through many troubles. #Wise @Agni shall ordain for us the #worship, whether five-wayed, threefold, or seven-threaded.

p: So will I win you strength and #life forever. O #Devas, that . May give you room and freedom. To @Indra's arms would I consign the thunder; in all these battles shall he then be victor.

p: The #Deities three hundred and thirty-nine, have served and honoured @Agni, Strewn sacred #grass, anointed him with butter, and seated him as Monk, the #Devas’ Invoker.

hymns.title: HYMN LIII. Agni Saucika Devas.
hymns.text:
p: HE hath arrived, he whom we sought with longing, who skilled in #offering well knows its courses. Let him discharge his #offerings duties: let him sit down as #Friend who was before Us.

p: Best Monk, he hath been won by being seated, for he hath looked on the well-ordered #offerings. Come, let usworship #Devas who must be worshipped, and pouring oil, laud those who should be lauded.

p: Now hath he made the feast of #Devas effective: now have we found the secret tongue of #worship. Now hath he come, sweet, robed in vital vigour, and made our calling on the #Devas effective.

p: This prelude of my speech I now will utter, whereby we @Deva. May quell our #Asura foemen. Eaters of strengthening #food who merit #worship, O ye Five Tribes, be pleased with mine oblation.

p: May the Five Tribes be pleased with mine oblation, and the #Cow's #Sons and all who merit #worship. From earthly troubl. May the $Earth protect us, and #air's mid realm from woe that comes from $Heaven.

p: Spinning the thread, follow the region's splendid #light: guard thou the path ways well which wisdom hath prepared. Weave ye the knotless labour of the bards who sing: be Manu thou, and bring the Heavenly #People forth.

p: Lovers of #Soma, bind the chariot traces fast: set ye the reins in #order and embellish them. Bring hitherward the #car with seats where eigh. May sit, whereon the #Devas have brought the #treasure. that we love.

p: Here flows Asmanvati: hold fast each other, keep yourselves up, and pass, my #friends, the #river. There let us leave the #Powers that brought no profit, and cross the flood to #Powers that are auspicious.

p: @Tvastar, most deft of workmen, knew each magic art, bringing most blessed bowls that hold the drink of #Devas. His axe, wrought of good metal, he is sharpening now, wherewith the radiant @Narasamsa will cut.

p: Now, O ye Sapient Ones, make ye the axes sharp wherewith ye fashion bowls to hold the Amrta. Knowing the secret places make ye ready that whereby the #Devas have gotten immortality.

p: Ye with a secret tongue and dark intention laid the maiden deep within, the calf within the mouth. They evermore are near us with their gracious #help: successful is the #song that strives for #victory.

hymns.title: HYMN LIV. Indra.
hymns.text:
p: I SING thy fame that, @Indra, @Indra, @Varuna, and @Mitra, #Soma, @Maghavan, @Savitar, @Visnu, through thy Greatness the heavens and $Earth invoked thee in their terror, Thou, aiding #Devas, didst quell the power of Dasas, what time thou holpest many a race, O @Indra.

p: When thou wast roaming, waxen #strong in body, telling thy #might, @Indra, among the #people, All that #men called thy battles was illusion: no foe hast thou to-day, nor erst hast found one.

p: Who are the #Rsis, then, who comprehended before our time the bounds of all thy greatness? For from thy body thou hast generated at the same time the #Mother and the #Father.

p: Thou, #Mighty Steer, hast four supremest natures, #Asura natures tha. May ne’er be injured. All these, O @Indra, @Indra, @Varuna, and @Mitra, #Soma, @Maghavan, @Savitar, @Visnu, thou surely knowest, wherewith thou hast performed thy great achievements.

p: Thou hast all #treasure.s in thy sole possession, #treasure.s made manifest and #treasure.s hidden. Defer not thou, O @Indra, @Indra, @Varuna, and @Mitra, #Soma, @Maghavan, @Savitar, @Visnu, my longing: thou, art Director, @Indra, thou art Giver.

p: To him who set the #light in things of #splendour, and with all sweetness blent essential sweetness, to @Indra hath this welcome #hymn that strengthens been uttered by the votary Brhaduktha.

hymns.title: HYMN LV. Indra.
hymns.text:
p: FAR is that secret name by which, in terror, the worlds invoked thee and thou gavest vigour The $Earth and $Heaven thou settest near each other, and @Indra, @Indra, @Varuna, and @Mitra, #Soma, @Maghavan, @Savitar, @Visnu, madest bright thy #Brother's Children.

p: Great is that secret name and far-extending, whereby thou madest all that is and shall be. The Five Tribes whom he loveth well have entered the #light he loveth that was made aforetime.

p: He filled the $Heaven and $Earth and all between them, #Devas five times sevenfold in their proper #seasons. With four-and-thirty lights he looks around him, lights of one colour though their ways are divers.

p: As first among the lights, O @Dawn, thou shonest, whereby thou broughtest forth the Stay of Increase, Great art thou, matchless is thine #Asura nature, who, high above, art kin to those beneath thee.

p: The old hath waked the young #Moon from his slumber who runs his circling course with many round him. Behold the #Devas’ high wisdom in its greatness: he who died yesterday to-day is living.

p: #Strong is the Red #Bird in his strength, great #Hero, who from of old hath had no nest to dwell in. That which he knows is truth and never idle: he wins and gives the #wealth desired of many.

p: Through these the Thunderer gained #strong manly vigour, through whom he waxed in power to smite down @Vrtra. Who through the #might of @Indra's operation came forth as #Devas in course of Law and #Order.

p: All-#strong, performing works with his companion, All-marking, rapid Victor, Curse-averter, the #Hero, waxing, after draughts of #Soma, blew far from $Heaven the #Dasyus with his weapon.

hymns.title: HYMN LVI, Devas.
hymns.text:
p: HERE is one #light for thee, another yonder: enter the third and he therewith united. Uniting with a body be thou welcome, dear to the #Devas in their sublimest birthplace.

p: Bearing thy body, Vajin. May thy body afford us #blessing and thyself protection. Unswerving, stablish as it were in $Heaven thine own #light as the #mighty @Deva's supporter.

p: #Strong Steed art thou: go to the yearning Maidens with vigour, happily go to $Heaven and praises: Fly happily to the #Devas with easy passage, according to the first and faithful statutes.

p: Part of their grandeur have the #Fathers also gained: the #Devas have seated mental power in them as #Devas. They have embraced within themselves all energies, which, issuing forth, again into their bodies pass.

p: They strode through all the region with victorious #might, establishing the old immeasurable laws. They compassed in their bodies all existing things, and streamed forth offipring in many successive forms.

p: In two ways have the #son established in his place the #Asura who finds the #light, by the third act, as #fathers, they have set their heritage on $Earth, their #offspring, as a thread continuously spun out.

p: As in a ship through billows, so through regions of #air, with blessings, through toils and troubles Hath Brhaduktha brought his seed with #glory, and placed it here and in the realms beyond us.

hymns.title: HYMN LVIL Devas.
hymns.text:
p: LET us not, @Indra, leave the path, we's #offering: Let no malignity dwell with us.

p: May we obtain, completely wrought, the thread spun out to reach the #Devas, that perfecteth  'the #offering.

p: We #call the #spirit hither with the #Soma of our parted sires, Yea, with the #Fathers' holy hymns.

p: Thy #spirit come to thee again for wisdom, energy, and lire, that tho. Mayst long behold the #sun!

p: O #Fathers. May the Heavenly Folk give us our #spirit once again, that we may be with those who live.

p: O #Soma with the #spirit still within us, blest with #progeny, may we be busied in the law.

hymns.title: HYMN LVIII. Manas or Spirit.
hymns.text:
p: THY #spirit, that went far away to @Yama to @Vivasvan's #Son, We cause to come to thee again that tho. Mayst live and sojourn here.

p: Thy #spirit, that went far away, that passed away to $Earth and $Heaven, We cause to come to thee again that tho. Mayst live and sojourn here.

p: Thy #spirit, that went far away, away to the four-cornered $Earth, We cause to come to thee again that tho. Mayst live and sojourn here.

p: Thy #spirit, that went far away to the four quarters of the world, We cause to come to thee again that tho. Mayst live and sojourn here.

p: Thy #spirit, that went far away, away unto the billowy sea, We cause to come to thee again that tho. Mayst live and sojourn here.

p: Thy #spirit, that went far away to beams of #light that flash and #flow, We cause to come to thee again that tho. Mayst live and sojourn here.

p: Thy #spirit, that went far away, went to the #waters and the plants, We cause to come to thee again that tho. Mayst live and sojourn here.

p: Thy #spirit, that went far away, that visited the #Sun and @Dawn. We cause to come to thee again that tho. Mayst live and sojourn here.

p: Thy #spirit, that went far away, away to lofty mountain heights, We cause to come to thee again that tho. Mayst live and sojourn here.

p: Thy #spirit, that went far away into this All, that lives and moves, We cause to come to thee again that tho. Mayst live and sojourn here.

p: Thy #spirit, that went far away to distant realms beyond our ken, We cause to come to thee again that tho. Mayst live and sojourn here.

p: Thy #spirit, that went far away to all that is and is to be, We cause to come to thee again that tho. Mayst live and sojourn heie.

hymns.title: HYMN LIX. Nirrti and Others.
hymns.text:
p: His #life hath been renewed and carried forward as two #men, #car-borne, by the skilful driver. One falls, then seeks the goal with quickened vigour. Let Nirrti depart to distant places.

p: Here is the psalm for #wealth, and #food, in plenty: let us do many deeds to bring us #glory. All these our doings shall #delight the #singer. Let Nirrti depart to distant places.

p: May we o’ercome our foes with acts of valour, as $Heaven is over $Earth, hills over lowlands. All these our deeds the #singer hath considered. Let Nirrti depart to distant places.

p: Give us not up as prey to #death, O #Soma still let us look upon the #Sun arising. Let our old age with passing days be kindly. Let Nirrti depart to distant places.

p: O Asuniti, keep the soul within us, and make the days we have to live yet longer. Grant that we stil. May look upon the sunlight: strengthen thy body with the oil we bring thee.

p: Give us our sight again, O Asuniti, give us again our breath and our enjoyment. Lon. May we look upon the #Sun uprising; O Anumati, favour thou and bless us.

p: May $Earth restore to us our vital #spirit. May $Heaven the Devi and $$Mid-#Air restore it. May #Soma give us once again our body, and @Pusan show the Path of peace and comfort.

p: May both Worlds bless @Subandhu, young Mothers of everlasting Lawe may $Heaven and $Earth uproot and sweep iniquity and shame away: nor sin nor sorrow trouble thee.

p: Health-giving medicines descend sent down from $Heaven in twos and threes, or wandering singly on the $Earth. May $Heaven and $Earth uproot and sweep iniquity and shame away: nor sin nor sorrow trouble thee.

p: Drive forward thou the wagon-ox, O @Indra, which brought Usinarani's wagon hither. May $Heaven and $Earth uproot and sweep iniquity and shame away: nor sin nor sorrow trouble thee.

hymns.title: HYMN LX. Asamati and Others.-
hymns.text:
p: BRINGING our homage we have come to one magnificent in look. Glorified of the #mighty #Devas

p: To @Asamati, spring of #gifts, #lord of the #brave, a radiant #car, the conqueror of Bhajeratha

p: Who, when the spear hath armed his hand, or even weaponless o’erthrows #Men #strong as buffaloes in fight;

p: Him in whose service flourishes @Iksvaku, rich and dazzling-bright. As the Five Tribes that are in $Heaven.

p: @Indra, support the princely power of Rathaprosthas matched by none, Even as the #Sun for all to see.

p: Thou for @Agastya's #sister's #sons yokest thy pair of ruddy #steeds. Thou troddest #niggards under foot, all those, O #King, who brought no #gifts.

p: This is the #mother, this the sire, this one hath come to be thy #life. What brings thee forth is even this. Now come, @Subandhu, get thee forth.

p: As with the leather thong they bind the chariot yoke to hold it fast, So have I held thy #spirit fast, held it for #life and not for #death, held it for thy #security.

p: Even as this $Earth, the #mighty $Earth, holds fast the #monarchs of the wood. So have I held thy #spirit fast, held it for #life and not for #death, held it for thy #security.

p: @Subandlin's #spirit I have brought from $Yarna, from @Vivasvan's #Son, Brought it for #life and not for #death, yea, brought it for #security.

p: The wind blows downward from on high, downward the @SunDeva sends his heat, Downward the #MilchCow pours her #milk: so downward go thy pain and grief.

p: Felicitous is this mine hand, yet more felicitous is this. This hand contains all healing balms, and this makes whole with gentle touch.

hymns.title: HYMN LXI, Devas.
hymns.text: p: THE welcome speaker in the storm of battle uttered with #might this prayer to win the @Asvins, when the most liberal @Deva, for Paktha, rescued his #parents, and assailed the seven Hotras. p: Cyavana, purposing deceptive presents, with all ingredients, made the altar ready. Most sweet-voiced @Turvayana poured oblations like floods of widely fertilizing #water. p: To his oblations, swift as thought, ye hurried, and welcomed eagerly the prayers he offered. With arrows in his hand the Very #Mighty forced from him all obedience of a servant. p: I #call on you the #Sons of #Dyaus, the @Asvins, that a dark #cow to my red kine be added. Enjoy my #offering, come to my #offerings contented, not deceiving expectation. ' p: Membrum suum virile, quod vrotentum fuerat, mas ille retraxit. Rursus illud quod in juvenem filiam sublatum fuerat, non aggressurus, ad se rerahit. p: Quum jam in medio connessu, semiperfecto opere, amorem in puellam pater impleverat, ambo discedentes seminis paulum in terrae superficiem sacrorum sede effusum emiserunt. p: Quum pater suam nilam adiverat, cum ea congressus suum semen supra viram effudit. Tum Dii benigni precem (brahma) progenuerunt, et Vastoshpatim, legum sacrarum custodem, formaverunt. p: Ille tauro similis spumam in certamine jactavit, tunc discedens pusillaximis huc profectus est. Quasi dextro pede claudus processit, "inutiles fuerunt illi mei complexus," ita locutus. p: 'The fire, burning the #people, does not approach quickly (by day): the naked (@Raksasas approach) not @Agni by night; the giver of fuel, and the giver of #food, he, the upholder (of the rite), is #born, overcoming enemies by his #might.' p: Uttering #praise to suit the rite #Navagvas came speedily to win the damsel's friendship. They who approached the twice-#strong stable's keeper, meedless would #milk the rocks that naught had shaken. p: Swift was new friendship with the #maid they quickly accepted it as genuine seed and bounty. #Milk which the #cow Sabardugha had yielded was the bright heritage which to thee they offered. p: When afterwards they woke and missed the #cattle, the speaker thus in joyful mood addressed them: Matchless are singers through the @Vasu's nature; he bringeth them all #food and all possessions. p: His followers then who dwelt in sundry places came and desired too subdue the #son of Nrsad. Resistless foe, be found the hidden #treasure. of @Susna multiplied in numerous #offspring. p: Thou, called Effulgence, in whose threefold dwelling, as in the #light of $Heaven, the #Devas are sitting, Thou who art called @Agni or #Jatavedas, Monk, hear us, guileless Monk of holy #worship. p: And, @Indra, bring, that . May laud and serve them, those Two resplendent #glorious @Nasatyas, Blithe, bounteous, #man-like, to 'the offeringr, honoured among our #men with offered #offerings. p: This #King is praised and honoured as Ordainer: himself the bridge, the #Sage speeds o’er the #waters. He hath stirred up Kaksivan, stirred up @Agni, as the steed's swift wheel drives the felly onward. p: Vaitarana, doubly kinsman, offerer, shall #milk the #cow who ne’er hath calved, Sabardhu, when I encompass @Varuna and @Mitra with lauds, and @Aryaman in safest shelter. p: Their kin, the Prince in $Heaven, thy nearest kinsman, turning his thought to thee thus speaks in kindness: This is our highest bond: I am his #offspring. How many others came ere I succeeded? p: Here is my kinship, here the place I dwell in: these are my #Devas; I in full strength am present. Twice-#born am I, the first-#born #Son of #Order: the #Cow milked this when first she had her being. p: So mid these tribes he rests, the friendly envoy, borne on two paths, refulgent #Lord of fuel. When, like a line, the Babe springs up erectly, his #Mother straight hath borne him #strong to bless us. p: Then went the milch-kine forth to please the damsel, and for the good of every #man that liveth. Hear us, O wealthy #Lord; begin our #worship. Thou hast grown #mighty through Asvaghna's virtues. p: And take thou notice of us also, @Indra, for ample #riches, #King whose arm wields thunder! Protect our wealthy nobles, guard our princes unmenaced near thee, #Lord of #Tawny Coursers. p: When he goes forth, ye Pair of #Kings, for booty, speeding to war and #praise to please the #singer. I was the dearest #sage of those about him.let him lead these away and bring them safely. p: Now for this noble #man's support and comfort, singing with easy #voice we thus implore thee: Impetuous be his #son and fleet his courser: an. May I be his priest to win him #glory. p: If, for our strength, the #Sage with adoration to win your friendship made the laud accepted, that laud shall be a branching road to virtue forevery one to whom the #songs are suited. p: Glorified thus, with holy hymns and homage:—Of noble race, with #Waters, @Deva.attended— May he enrich us for our meditations, and praises: now can the #cow be milked; the path is open. p: Be to us, then, ye #Devas who merit #worship, be ye of one accord our #strong protection, who went on various ways and brought us vigour, ye who are undeceivable explorers.

hymns.title: HYMN LXII. Devas, Etc.
hymns.text:
p: YE, who, adorned with guerdon through  'the #offering, have won you @Indra's friendship and eternal #life, Even to you be happiness, #Angirases. Welcome the #son of Manu, ye who are most #wise.

p: The #Fathers, who drave forth the #wealth in #cattle, have in the year's courses cleft Vala by Eternal Law: A lengthened #life be yours, O ye #Angirases. Welcome the #son of Manu, ye who are most #wise.

p: Ye raised the #Sun to $Heaven by everlasting Law, and spread broad $Earth, the #Mother, out on every side. Fair #wealth of #progeny be yours, #Angirases. Welcome the #son of Manu, ye who are most #wise.

p: This kinsman in your dwellingplace speaks pleasant words: give #car to this, ye #Rsis, children of the #Devas. High Brahman dignity be yours, #Angirases. Welcome the #son of Manu, ye who are most #wise.

p: Distinguished by their varied #form, these #Rsis have been deeply moved. These are the #sons of #Angirases: from @Agni have they sprung to #life.

p: Distinguished by their varied #form, they sprang from @Agni, from the $Sky. Navagva and Dasagva, noblest @Angiras, he giveth bounty with the #Devas.

p: With @Indra for associate the monks have cleared the stable full of #steeds and kine, giving to me a thousand with their eightmarked #cars, they gained renown among the #Devas.

p: May this #man's #sons be multiplied; like springing cor. May Manu grow, who gives at once in bounteous #gift a thousand kine, a hundred #steeds.

p: No one attains to him, as though a #man would grasp the heights of $Heaven. Savarnya's #offerings meed hath broadened like an ample flood.

p: @Yadu and Turva, too, have given two Dasas, well-disposed, to serve, together with great store of kine.

p: Blest be the hamlet's #chief, most liberal Manu, an. May his bounty rival that of @Surya. May the @Deva.let Ssvarni's #life be leng thened, with whom, unwearied, we have lived and prospered.

hymns.title: HYMN LXIII, Devas.
hymns.text:
p: MAY they who would assume kinship from far away, @Vivasvan's generations, dearly loved of #men, Even the #Devas who sit upon the sacred #grass of Nahusa's #son Yayati, bless and comfort us.

p: For worthy of obeisance, #Devas, are all your names, worthy of adoration and of #offering. Ye who were #born from #waters, and from @Aditi, and from the $Earth, do ye here listen to my #call.

p: I will rejoice in these @Adityas for my weal, for whom the #Mother pours forth #water rich in balm, and #Dyaus the Infinite, firm as a rock, sweet #milk.#Devas active, #strong through lauds, whose #might the Bull upholds.

p: Looking on #men, ne’er slumbering, they by their deserts attained as #Devas to lofty immortality. Borne on refulgent #cars, sinless, with serpents' #powers, they robe them, for our welfare, in the height of $Heaven.

p: Great #Kings who bless us, who have come to #offering, who, ne’er assailed, have set their mansion in the $Sky. These I invite with adoration and with hymns, #mighty @Adityas, @Aditi, for happiness.

p: Who offereth to you the laud that ye accept, O ye All-#Devas of Manu, many as ye are? Who, #MightyOnes, will prepare for you  'the #offering to bear us over trouble to felicity?

p: Ye to whom Manu, by seven monks, with kindled fire, offered the first oblation with his heart and soul, vouchsafe us, ye @Adityas, sheitcr free from fear, and make us good and easy paths to happiness.

p: #Wise #Deities, who have dominion o’er the world, ye thinkers over all that moves not and that moves, Save us from uncommitted and committed sin, preserve us from all sin to-day for happiness.

p: In battles we invoke @Indra still swift to hear, and all the holy Host of $Heaven who banish grief, @Agni, @Mitra, and @Varuna that we may gain, Dyays, @Bhaga, #Maruts, @Prthivi for happiness:

p: Mightily-saving $Earth, incomparable $Heaven the good guide @Aditi who gives secure defence The well-oared heavenly Ship that lets no #waters in, free from defect, will we #ascend for happiness.

p: Bless us, all #Holy Ones, that we may have your #help, guard and protect us from malignant injury. With fruitful invocatio. May we #call on you, #Devas, who give ear to us for grace, for happiness.

p: Keep all disease afar and sordid #offering, keep off the wicked #man's malicious enmity. Keep far away from us all hatred, O ye #Devas, and give us ample shelter for our happiness.

p: Untouched by any evil, every mortal thrives, and, following the Law, spreads in his #progeny. Whom ye with your good guidance, O @Adityas, lead safely through all his pain and grief to happiness.

p: That which ye guard and grace in battle, O ye #Devas, ye #Maruts, where the prize is #wealth, where #heroes win, that conquering #Car, O @Indra, that sets forth at @Dawn, that never breaks. May we #ascend for happiness.

p: Vouchsafe us #blessing in our paths and desert tracts, #blessing in #waters and in battle, for the #light; #Blessing upon the wombs that bring male children forth, and #blessing, O ye #Maruts, for the gain of #wealth.

p: The noblest Svasti with abundant #riches, who comes to what is good by distant pathway. May she at #home and far away preserve us, and dwell with us under the #Devas’ protection

p: Thus hatb the thoughtful #sage, the #son of Plati, praised you, O @Aditi and all @Adityas, #Men are made rich by those who are #Immortal: the Heavenly Folk have been extolled by Gaya.

hymns.title: HYMN LXIV, Devas.
hymns.text:
p: WHAT @Deva, of those who hear, is he whose well-praised name we may record in this  'our #offering; and how? Who will be gracious? Who of many give us #bliss? Who out of all the Host will come to lend us aid?

p: The will and thoughts within my breast exert their power: they yearn with love, and fly to all the regions round. None other comforter is found save only these: my longings and my hopes are fixt upon the #Devas.

p: To @Narasamsa and to @Pusan I sing forth, unconcealable @Agni kindied by the #Devas. To #Sun and #Moon, two Moons, to @Yama in the $Heaven, to @Trita, @Vata, @Dawn, Night, and the Atvins Twain.

p: How is the #Sage extolled whom the loud singers #praise? What #voice, what #hymn is used to laud @Narasamsa? May @Aja-Ekapad with Rkvans swift to hear, and Ahi of the Deep listen unto our #call.

p: @Aditi, to the birth of @Daksa and the vow thou summonest the #Kings @Mitra and @Varuna. With course unchecked, with many #chariots @Aryaman comes with the seven monks to tribes of varied sort.

p: May all those vigorous Coursers listen to our cry, hearers of invocation, speeding on their way; Winners of thousands where the priestly meed is won, who gather of themselves great #wealth in every race.

p: Bring ye Purandbi, bring @Vayu who yokes his #steeds, for friendship bring ye @Pusan with your #songs of #praise: They with one mind, one thought attend  'the #offering, urged by the favouring aid of @Indra, @Indra, @Varuna, and @Mitra, #Soma, @Maghavan, @Savitar.

p: The thrice-seven wandering #Rivers, yea, the #mighty floods, the forest trees, the #mountains, @Agni to our aid, Krsanu, Tisya, archers to our gathering-place, and Rudra #strong amid the #Rudras we invoke.

p: Let the great #Streams come hither with their #mighty #help, @Sindhu, @Sarasvati, and Sarayu with waves. Ye Devi Floods, ye Mothers, animating all, promise us #water rich in fatness and in balm.

p: And let Brhaddiva, the #Mother, hear our #call, and @Tvastar, #Father, with the Devis and #Dames. @Rbhuksan, @Vaja, @Bhaga, and Rathaspati, and the sweet speech of him who labours guard us well!

p: Pleasant to look on as a dwelling rich in #food is the blest favour of the #Maruts, Rudra's #Sons. May we be famed among the folk for #wealth in kine. and ever come to you, ye #Devas, with sacred #food.

p: The thought which ye, O #Maruts, @Indra and ye #Devas have given to me, and ye, @Mitra and @Varuna. Cause this to grow and swell like a #milchcow with #milk. Will ye not bear away my #songs upon your #car?

p: O #Maruts, do ye never, never recollect and #call again to mind this our relationship? When next we meet together at the central point, even there shall @Aditi confirm our #brotherhood.

p: The Mothers. $Heaven and $Earth, those #mighty Devis, worthy of #offering, ecune with the race of #Devas. These Two with their support uphold both #Devas and #men, and with the #Fathers pour the copious genial #stream.

p: This invocation wins all good that we desire @Narasamsa, highly-praised Aramati, are here, Even where the stone that presses #meath rings loudly out, and where the sages make their voices heard with hymns.

p: Thus hath the #sage, skilled in loud singers' duties, desiring #riches, yearning after #treasure., Gaya, the priestly #singer, with his praises and hymns contented the Celestial #people.

p: Thus hath the thoughtful #sage the #son of Plati, praised you, O Aaiti and all @Adityas. #Men are made rich by those who are #Immortal: the Heavenly Folk have been extolled by Gaya.

hymns.title: HYMN LXV, Devas.
hymns.text:
p: MAY @Agni, @Indra, @Mitra, @Varuna consent, @Aryaman, @Vayu, @Pusan, and @Sarasvati, @Adityas, #Maruts, @Visnu, #Soma, lofty $Sky, Rudra and @Aditi, and @Narasamsa.

p: @Indra and @Agni. #Hero-lords when @Vrtra fell, dwelling together, speeding emulously on, and #Soma blent with oil, putting his greatness forth, have with their power filled full the #mighty $Firmament.

p: Skilled in the Law I lift the #hymn of #praise to these, Law-strengtheners, unassailed, and great in majesty. These in their wondrous bounty send the watery sea. May they as kindly #Friends send #gifts to make us great.

p: They with their #might have stayed $Heaven, $Earth, and @Prthivi, the #Lord of #Light, the $Firmament, -the lustrous spheres. Even as fleet-foot #steeds who make their #masters glad, the princely #Devas are praised, most bountiful to #man.

p: Bring #gifts to @Mitra and to @Varuna who, Lords of all, in #spirit never fail the #worshipper, whose statute shines on high through everlasting Law, whose places of sure refuge are the heavens and $Earth.

p: The #cow who yielding #milk goes her appointed way hither to us as #leader of holy rites, Speaking aloud to @Varuna and the #worshipper, shall with oblation serve @Vivasvan and the #Devas.

p: The #Devas whose tongue is @Agni dwell in $Heaven, and sit, aiders of Law, reflecting, in the seat of Law. They propped up $Heaven and then brought #waters with their #might, got #offering and in a body made it fair.

p: #Born in the oldest time, the #Parents dwelling round are sharers of one mansion in the #home of Law. Bound by their common vow #Dyaus, @Prthivi #stream forth the moisture rich in oil to @Varuna the Steer.

p: @Parjanya, @Vata, #mighty, senders of the #rain, @Indra and @Vayu, @Varuna, @Mitra, @Aryaman: We #call on @Aditi, @Adityas, and the #Devas, those who are on the $Earth, in #waters, and in $Heaven.

p: @Tvastar and @Vayu, those who count as @Rbhus, both celestial @Hotar-monks, and @Dawn for happiness, Winners of #wealth, we #call, and #wise @Narasamsa, destroyer of our foes, and #Soma @Indra's #Friend.

p: They generated prayer, the #cow, the #horse, the plants, the forest trees, the $Earth, the #waters, and the hills. These very bounteous #Devas made the #Sun mount to $Heaven, and spread the righteous laws of Aryas o’er the land.

p: O @Asvins, ye delivered Bhujyu from distress, ye animated Syava, Vadhrmati's #son. To @Vimada ye brought his consort Kamadyu, and gave his lost Visnapu back to Visvaka.

p: Thunder, the lightning's daughter, @Aja-Ekapad, $Heaven's bearer, @Sindhu, and the #waters of the sea: Hear all the #Devas my words, @Sarasvati give ear together with @Purandhi and with Holy Thoughts.

p: With Holy Thoughts and with Purandh. May all #Devas, knowing the Law #immortal, Manu's #Holy Ones, #Boon-givers, favourers, finders of #light, and $Heaven, with gracious love accept my #songs, my #meditation, my #hymn.

p: #Immortal #Devas have I, @Vasistha, lauded, #Devas set on high above all other beings. May they this day grant us wide space and freedom: ye #Devas, preserve us evermore with blessings.

hymns.title: HYMN LXVI, Devas.
hymns.text:
p: I #CALL the #Devas of lofty #glory for our weal, the makers of the #light, well-skilled in #offering; Those who have waxen mightily, #Masters of all #wealth, #Immortal, strengthening Law, the #Devas whom @Indra leads.

p: For the #strong band of #Maruts will we frame a #hymn: the chiefs shall bring forth #offering for @Indra's troop, who, sent by @Indra and advised by @Varuna, have gotten for themselves a share of @Surya's #light

p: May @Indra with the #Vasus keep our dwelling safe, and @Aditi with @Adityas lend us sure defence. May the @Deva.Rudra with the #Rudras favour us, and @Tvastar with the #Dames further us to success.

p: @Aditi. $Heaven and $Earth, the great eternal Law, @Indra, @Visnu, the #Maruts, and the lofty $Sky. We #call upon @Adityas, on the #Devas, for #help, on #Vasus, #Rudras, @Indra, @Indra, @Varuna, and @Mitra, #Soma, @Maghavan, @Savitar, @Visnu of wondrous deeds.

p: With Holy Thoughts Sarasvan, firm-lawed @Varuna, great @Vayu, @Pusan, @Visnu, and the @Asvins Twain, Lords of all #wealth, #Immortal, furtherers of prayer, grant us a triply-guarding refuge from distress.

p: #Strong be  'the #offering, #strong be the #Holy Ones, #strong the preparers of oblation, #strong the #Devas. #Mighty be $Heaven and $Earth, true to eternal Law, #strong be @Parjanya, #strong be they who laud the #Strong.

p: To win us strength I glorify the #Mighty Twain, @Agni and #Soma, #MightyOnes whom many laud, may these vouchsafe us shelter with a triple guard, these whom the #strong have served in #worship of the #Devas.

p: Potent, with firm-fixt laws, arranging #offering, visiting solemn rites in #splendour of the day, Obeying #Order, these whose priest is @Agni, free from falsehood, poured the #waters out when @Vrtra died.

p: The #Holy Ones engendered, for their several laws, the heavens and $Earth, the #waters, and the plants and trees. They filled the $Firmament with heavenly #light for #help: the #Devas embodied Wish and made it beautiful.

p: May they who bear up $Heaven, the @Rbhus deft of hand, and @Vata and @Parjanya of the thundering Bull, the #waters and the plants, promote the #songs we sing: come @Bhaga, Rati, and the Vaijns to my #call.

p: @Sindhu, the sea, the region, and the $Firmament, the thunder, and the $Ocean, @Aja-Ekapad, the Dragon of the Deep, shall listen to my words, and all the #Deities and Princes shall give ear.

p: May we, be yours, we #men, to entertain the #Devas: further  'our #offering and give it full success. @Adityas, #Rudras, #Vasus, givers of good #gifts, quicken the holy hymns which we are singing now

p: I follow with success upon the path of Law the two celestial Hotars, Monks of oldest time. We meditate to him who dwelleth near, Guard of the Field, to all #Immortal #Devas who never are remiss.

p: @Vasistha's #sons have raised their voices, like their sire. Rsi-like praying to the #Devas for happiness. Like friendly-minded kinsmen, come at our desire, O #Devas, and shake down #treasure.s on us from above.

p: #Immortal #Devas have I, @Vasistha, lauded, #Devas set on high above all other beings. May they this day grant us wide space and freedom: ye #Devas, preserve us evermore with blessings.

hymns.title: HYMN LXVII. Narasamsa.
hymns.text:
p: THIS holy #hymn, sublime and sevenheaded, sprung from eternal Law, our sire discovered. Ayasya, #friend of all #men, hath engendered the fourth #hymn as he sang his laud to @Indra.

p: Thinking aright, praising eternal #Order, the #sons of #Dyaus the #Asura, those #heroes, #Angirases, holding the rank of sages, first honoured #offering's holy statute.

p: Girt by his #friends who cried with swanlike voices, bursting the stony barriers of the prison, @Narasamsa spake in thunder to the #cattle, and uttered #praise and #song when he had found them.

p: Apart from one, away from two above him, he drave the kine that stood in bonds of falsehood. @Narasamsa, seeking #light amid the darkness, drave forth the bright cows: three he made apparent.

p: When he had cleft the lairs and western castle, he cut off three from him who held the #waters. @Narasamsa discovered, while he thundered like #Dyaus, the @Dawn, the #Sun, the #cow, the lightning.

p: As with a hand, so with his roaring @Indra cleft Vala through, the guardian of the #cattle. Seeking the #milk-draught with sweatshining comrades he stole the Pani's kine and left him weeping.

p: He with bright faithful #Friends, winners of booty, hath rent the milker of the cows asunder. @Narasamsa with wild boars #strong and #mighty, sweating with heat, hath gained a rich possession.

p: They, longing for the kine, with faithful #spirit incited with their hymns the #Lord of #cattle. @Narasamsa freed the radiant cows with comrades self-yoked, averting shame from one another.

p: In our assembly with auspicious praises exalting him who roareth like a lion, maywe, in every fight where #heroes conquer, rejoice in #strong @Narasamsa the Victor.

p: When he had won him every sort of booty and gone to $Heaven and its most lofty mansions, #Men praised @Narasamsa the #Mighty, bringing the #light within their mouths from sundry places.

p: Fulfil the prayer that begs for vital vigour: aid in your wonted manner even the #humble. Let all our foes be turned and driven backward. Hear this, O $Heaven and $Earth, ye All-producers.

p: @Indra with #mighty strength cleft asunder the head of Arbuda the watery monster, Slain Ahi, and set free the Seven #Rivers. O $Heaven and $Earth, with all the #Devas protect us.

hymns.title: HYMN LXVIII. Narasamsa.
hymns.text:
p: LIKE birds who keep their watch, plashing in #water, like the loud voices of the thundering #rain-cloudlike merry streamlets bursting from the mountain, thus to @Narasamsa our hymns have sounded.

p: The #Son of #Angirases, meeting the #cattle, as @Bhaga, brought in @Aryaman among us. As #Friend of #men he decks the #wife and #husband: as for the race, @Narasamsa, nerve our coursers.

p: @Narasamsa, having won them from the #mountains, strewed down, like barley out of winnowing- baskets, the vigorous, wandering cows who aid the pious, desired of all, of blameless #form, well-coloured.

p: As the #Sun dews with #meath the seat of #Order, and casts a flaming meteor down from $Heaven. So from the rock @Narasamsa forced the #cattle, and cleft the $Earth's skin as it were with #water.

p: Forth from mid #air with #light he dravc the darkness, as the gale blows a lily from the fiver. Like the wind grasping at the cloud of Vala, @Narasamsa gathered to himself the #cattle,

p: @Narasamsa, when he with fiery lightnings cleft through the weapon of reviling Vala, Consumedḥim as tongues cat what teeth have compassed: he threw the prisons of the red cows open.

p: That secret name borne by the lowing #cattle within the cave @Narasamsa discovered, and drave, himself, the bright kine from the mountain, like a #bird's young after the egg's disclosure.

p: He looked around on rock-imprisoned sweetness as one who eyes a fish in scanty #water. @Narasamsa, cleaving through with varied clamour, brought it forth like a bowl from out the timber.

p: He found the #light of $Heaven, and fire, and #Morning: with lucid rays he forced apart the darkness. As from a joint, @Narasamsa took the marrow of Vala as he gloried in his #cattle.

p: As trees for foliage robbed by winter, Vala mourned for the cows @Narasamsa had taken. He did a deed ne’er done, ne’er to be equalled, whereby the #Sun and #Moon #ascend alternate.

p: Like a dark steed adorned with pearl, the #Fathers have decorated $Heaven With constellations. They set the #light in day, in night the darkness. @Narasamsa cleft the rock and found the #cattle.

p: This homage have we.offered to the Cloud @Deva who thunders out to many in succession. May this @Narasamsa vouchsafe us fulness of #life with kine and #horses, #men, and #heroes.

hymns.title: HYMN LXIX. Agni.
hymns.text:
p: Auspicious is the aspect of Vadhryasva's fire good is its guidance, pleasant are its visitings. When first the #people Of Sumitra kindle it, with butter poured thercon it crackles and shines bright.

p: Butter is that which makes Vadhryaiva's fire growstrong: the butter is its #food, the butter makes it fat. It spreads abroad when butter hath been offered it, and balmed with #streams of butter shines forth like the #Sun.

p: Still newest is this face of thine, O @Agni, which Manu and Sumitra have enkindled. So richly #shine, accept our #songs with favour, so give us strengthening #food, so send us #glory.

p: Accept this #offering, @Agni, whom aforetime Vadhryasva, hath entreated and enkindled. Guard well our homes and ople, guard our bodies, protect thy girt to us which thou hast granted.

p: Be splendid, guard us Kinsman of Vadhryasva: let not the enmity of #men o’ercome theelike the bold #hero Cyavana, I Sumitra tell forth the title of Vadhryaiva's Kinsman.

p: All #treasure.s hast thou won, of plains and #mountains, and quelled the Dasas' and Aryas' hatred. Like the bold #hero Cyavana, O @Agni. Mayst thou subdue the #men who long for battle.

p: Deft @Agni hath a lengthened thread, tall oxen, a thousand heifers, numberless devices. Decked by the #men, splendid among the splendid, #shine brightly forth amid devout Sumitras.

p: Thine is the teeming #cow, O #Jatavedas, who pours at once her ceaseless #flow, Sabardhuk, Thou. art lit up by #men enriched with guerdon, O @Agni, by the pious-souled Sumitras.

p: Even #Immortal #Devas, O #Jatavedas, Vadhryasva's Kinsman, have declared thy grandeur. When #human tribes drew near with supplication thou conqueredst with #men whom thou hadst strengthened.

p: Like as a #father bears his #son, O @Agni, Vadhryasva bare thee in his lap and served thee. Thou, Youngest @Deva, having enjoyed his fuel, didst vanquish those of old though they were #mighty.

p: Vadhryasva's @Agni evermore hath vanquished his foes with #heroes who had pressed the #Soma. #Lord of bright rays, thou burntest up the battle, subduing, as our #help, e’en #mighty foemen.

p: This @Agni of Vadhryasva, @Vrtra conquerer, lit from of old, must be invoked with homage. As such assail our enemies, Vadhryasva, whether the foes be strangers or be kinsmen.

hymns.title: HYMN LXX. Apris.
hymns.text:
p: ENJOY, O @Agni, this my Fuel, welcome the oil-filled ladle where we pour libation. Rise up for #worship of the #Devas, #wise @Agni, on the $Earth's height, while days are bright with #beauty.

p: May he who goes before the #Devas come hither with #steeds whose shapes are varied, Narasarhsa. May he, most @Deva.ike, speed our offered #offerings with homage @Deva.ward on the path of #Order.

p: #Men with oblations laud most constant @Agni, and pray him to perform an envoy's duty. With lightly-rolling #car and best draught-#horses, bring the #Devas hither and sit down as @Hotar.

p: May the #delight of #Devas spread out transversely. May it be with us long in length and fragrant. O Holy #Grass divine, with friendly #spirit bring thou the willing #Devas whose #Chief is @Indra.

p: Touch ye the far-extending height of $Heaven or spring apart to suit the wide $Earth's measure. Yearning, ye Doors, with those sublime in greatness, seize eagerly the heavenly #Car that cometh.

p: Here in this shrin. May @Dawn and Night, the Daughters of $Heaven, the skilful Devis, be seated. In your wide lap, auspicious, willing Ladie. May the #Devas seat them with a willing #spirit.

p: Up stands the stone, high burns the fire enkindled: @Aditi's lap contains the Friendly Natures Ye Two #Chief Monks who serve at this our #worship. May ye, more skilled, win for us rich possessions.

p: On our wide #grass, Three Devis be seated: for you have we prepared and made it pleasant. May @Ila, she whose foot #drops oil, the Devi, taste, #man-like, #offering and well-set presents.

p: Since thou, @Deva.@Tvastar, hast made #beauty perfect, since hou hast been the #Angirases' Companion, Willing, most wealthy, Giver of possessions, grant us the #Devas’ assembly, thou who knowest.

p: Well-knowing, binding with thy cord, bring hither, #Lord of the Wood, the #Deities' assembly. The @Deva.prepare and season our oblation. May $Heaven and $Earth be gracious to my calling.

p: @Agni, bring hither @Varuna to #help us, @Indra from $Heaven, from #air's mid-realm the #Maruts. On sacred #grass all #Holy ones be seated and let the #Immortal #Devas rejoice in @Svaha.

hymns.title: HYMN LXXI. Jnanam
hymns.text:
p: WHEN-#men, @Narasamsa, giving names to objects, sent out @Vak's first and earliest utterances, All that was #excellent and spotless, #treasure.d within them, was disclosed through their affection.

p: Where, like #men cleansing corn-flour in a cribble, the #wise in #spirit have created language, #Friends see and recognize the marks of friendship: their speech retains the blessed sign imprinted.

p: With #offering the trace of @Vak they foIlowed, and found her harbouring within the #Rsis. They brought her, dealt her forth in many places: seven singers make her tones resound in concert.

p: One #man hath ne’er seen @Vak, and yet he seeth: one #man hath hearing but hath never heard her. But to another hath she shown her #beauty as a fond well-dressed #woman to her #husband.

p: One #man they #call a laggard, dull in friendship: they never urge him on to deeds of valour. He wanders on in profitless illusion: the #Voice he heard yields neither fruit,nor blossom.

p: No part in @Vak hath he who hath abandoned his own dear #friend who knows the truth of friendship. Even if he hears her still in vain he listens: naught knows he of the path of righteous action.

p: Unequal in the quickness of their #spirit are #friends endowed alike with eyes and hearing. Some look like tanks that reach the mouth or shoulder, others like pools of #water fit to bathe in.

p: When friendly #Brahmans #offering together with mental impulse which the heart hath fashioned, they leave one far behind through their attainments, and some who count as #Brahmans wander elsewhere.

p: Those #men who step not back and move not forward, nor #Brahmans nor preparers of #libations, Having attained to @Vak in sinful fashion spin out their thread in ignorance like spinsters.

p: All #friends are joyful in the #friend who cometh in #triumph, having conquered in assembly. He is their blame-averter, #food-#provider prepared is he and fit for deed of vigour.

p: One plies his constant task reciting verses. one sings the holy psalm in Sakvari measures. One more, the Brahman, tells the lore of being, and one lays down the rules of sacrificing.

hymns.title: HYMN LXXII. The Devas.
hymns.text:
p: LET US with tuneful skill proclaim these generations of the #Devas, that on. May see them when these hymns are chanted in a future age.

p: These @Narasamsa produced with blast and smelting, like a Smith, Existence, in an earlier age of #Devas, from Non-existence sprang.

p: Existence, in the earliest age of #Devas, from Non-existence sprang. Thereafter were the regions #born. This sprang from the Productive Power.

p: $Earth sprang from the Productive Power the regions from the $Earth were #born. @Daksa was #born of @Aditi, and @Aditi was @Daksa's #Child.

p: For @Aditi, O @Daksa, she who is thy Daughter, was brought forth. After her were the blessed #Devas #born sharers of #immortal #life.

p: When ye, O #Devas, in yonder deep closeclasping one another stood, thence, as of dancers, from your feet a thickening cloud of dust arose.

p: When, O ye #Devas, like Yatis, ye caused all existing things to grow, then ye brought @Surya forward who was lying hidden in the sea.

p: Eight are the #Sons of Adid who from her body sprang to #life. With seven she went to meet the #Devas she cast Martanda far away.

p: So with her Seven #Sons @Aditi went forth to meet the earlier age. She brought Martanda thitherward to spring to #life and die again.

hymns.title: HYMN LXXIII. Indra.
hymns.text:
p: THOU wast #born #mighty for victorious valour, exulting, strongest, full of pride and courage. There, even there, the #Maruts strengthened @Indra when. his most rapid #Mother stirred the #Hero.

p: There with fiend's ways e’en Prsni was seated: with much laudation they exalted @Indra. As if encompassed by the #Mighty-footed, from darkness, near at hand, forth came the Children.

p: High are thy feet when on thy way thou goest: the strength thou foundest here hath lent thee vigour. Thousand hyenas in thy mouth thou holdest. O @Indra, mayst thou turn the @Asvins hither.

p: Speeding at once to #offering thou comest for friendship thou art bringing both @Nasatyas. Thou hadst a thousand #treasure.s in possession. The @Asvins, O thou #Hero, gave thee #riches.

p: Glad, for the race that rests on holy #Order, with #friends who hasten to their goal, hath @Indra With these his magic #powers assailed the #Dasyu: he cast away the gloomy mists, the darkness.

p: Two of like name for him didst thou demolish, as @Indra striking down the #car of @Usas. With thy beloved lofty #Friends thou camest, and with the assurance of thine heart thou slewest.

p: War-loving @Namuci thou smotest, robbing the Dasa of his magic for the Rsi. For #man thou madest ready pleasant pathways, paths leading as it were directly @Deva.ward.

p: These names of thine thou hast fulfilled completely: as #Lord, thou boldest in thine arm, O @Indra. In thee, through thy great #might, the #Devas are joyful: the roots of trees hast thou directed upward.

p: May the sweet #Soma juices make him happy to cast his quoit that lies in depth of #waters. Thou from the udder which o’er $Earth is fastened hast poured the #milk into the kine and herbage.

p: When others #call him #offspring of the Courser, my meaning is that #Mighty Power produced him. He came from Manyu and remained in houses: whence he hath sprung is known to @Indra only.

p: Like birds of beauteous wing the Priyamedhas, #Rsis, imploring, have come nigh to @Indra: Dispel the darkness and fill full our vision deliver us as #men whom snares entangle.

hymns.title: HYMN LXXIV. Indra.
hymns.text:
p: I AM prepared to laud with #song or #worship the Noble Ones who are in $Earth and $Heaven, or Coursers who have triumphed in, the contest, or those who famed, have won the prize with #glory.

p: Their #call, the #call of #Devas, went up to $Heaven: they kissed the ground with #glory-seeking #spirit, there where the #Devas look on for happy fortune, and like the kindly heavens bestow their bounties.

p: This is the #song of those #Immortal Beings who long for #treasure.s in their full perfection. May these, completing prayers and #offers, bestow upon us #wealth where naught is wanting.

p: Those living #men extolled thy deed, O @Indra, those who would fain burst through the stall of #cattle, fain to #milk her who bare but once, great, lofty, whose #Sons are many and her #streams past number.

p: Sacivan, win to your assistance @Indra who never bends, who overcomes his foemen. @Rbhuksan, @Indra, @Indra, @Varuna, and @Mitra, #Soma, @Maghavan, @Savitar, @Visnu, the #hymn's upholder, who, rich in #food, bears #man's kind #friend, the thunder.

p: Since he who won of old anew hath triumphed, @Indra hath earned his name of @Vrtra-slaycr. He hath appeared, the #mighty #Lord of Conquest. What we would have him do let him accomplish.

hymns.title: HYMN LXXV. The Rivers.
hymns.text:
p: THE #singer, O ye #Waters in @Vivasvan's place, shall tell your grandeur forth that is beyond compare. The #Rivers have come forward triply, seven and seven. @Sindhu in #might surpasses all the #streams that #flow.

p: @Varuna cut the channels for thy forward course, O @Sindhu, when thou rannest on to win the race. Thou speedest o’er precipitous ridges of the $Earth, when thou art #Lord and #Leader of these moving floods.

p: His roar is lifted up to $Heaven above the $Earth: he puts forth endless vigour with a flash of #light. Like floods of #rain that fall in thunder from the cloud, so @Sindhu rushes on bellowing like a bull.

p: Like mothers to their calves, like milch kine with their #milk, so, @Sindhu, unto thee the roaring #rivers run. Thou leadest as a #warrior #king thine army's #wings what time thou comest in the van of these swift #streams.

p: Favour ye this my laud, O Gan!ga, Yamuna, O Sutudri, parusni and @Sarasvati: With Asikni, Vitasta, O Marudvrdha, O Arjikiya with $Susoma hear my #call.

p: First with Trstama thou art eager to #flow forth, with @Rasa, and Susartu, and with Svetya here, with Kubha; and with these, @Sindhu and Mehatnu, thou seekest in thy course Krumu and Gomati.

p: Flashing and whitely-gleaming in her mightiness, she moves along her ample volumes through the realms, most active of the active, @Sindhu unrestrained, like to a dappled mare, beautiful, fair to see.

p: Rich in good #steeds is @Sindhu, rich in #cars and robes, rich in #gold, nobly-fashioned, rich in ample #wealth. Blest Silamavati and young Urnavati invest themselves with raiment rich in store of sweets.

p: @Sindhu hath yoked her #car, #light-rolling, drawn by #steeds, and with that #car shall she win booty in this fight. So have I praised its power, #mighty and unrestrained, of independent #glory, roaring as it runs.

hymns.title: HYMN LXXVI. Press-stones.
hymns.text:
p: I GRASP at you when power and strength begin to @Dawn: bedew ye, @Indra and the #Maruts. $Heaven and $Earth, that Day and Night, in every hall of #offering. May wait on us and bless us when they first spring forth.

p: Press the libation out, most #excellent of all: the Pressing-stone is grasped like a hand-guided steed. So let it win the valour that subdues the foe, and the fleet courser's #might that speeds to ample #wealth.

p: #Juice that this Stone pours out removes defect of ours, as in old time it brought prosperity to #man. At #offers they established holy rites on @Tvastar's #milk-blent #juice bright with the hue of #steeds.

p: Drive ye the treacherous demons far away from us: keep Nirrti afar and banish Penury. Pour #riches forth for us with troops of #hero #sons, and bear ye up, O Stones, the #song that visits #Devas.

p: To you who are more #mighty than the heavens themselves, who, finishing your task with more than @Vibhvan's speed, More rapidly than @Vayu seize the #Soma #juice, better than @Agni give us #food, to you I sing.

p: Stirred be the #glorious Stones: let it press out the #juice, the Stone with heavenly #song that reaches up to $Heaven, there where the #men draw forth the #meath for which they long, sending their #voice around in rivalry of speed.

p: The Stones press out the #Soma, swift as #car-borne #men, and, eager for the #spoil, drain forth the sap thereof To fill the beaker, they exhaust the udder's store, as the #men purify oblations with their lips.

p: Ye, present #men, have been most skilful in your #work, even ye, O Stones who pressed #Soma for @Indra's drink. May all ye have of fair go to the Heavenly Race, and all your #treasure. to the earthly #worshipper.

hymns.title: HYMN LXXVII. Maruts.
hymns.text:
p: As with their #voice from cloud they sprinkle #treasure. so are the #wise #man's liberal #offers. I #praise their Company that merits #worship as the good Martits' priest to pay them honour.

p: The youths have wrought their ornaments for #glory through many nights.this noble band of #Maruts. Like stags the #Sons of Dyatis have striven onward, the #Sons of @Aditi grown #strong like pillars.

p: They who extend beyond the $Earth and $Heaven, by their own mass, as from the cloud spreads @Surya; Like #mighty #Heroes covetous of #glory, like heavenly gallants who destroy the wicked.

p: When ye come nigh, as in the depth of #waters, the $Earth is loosened, as it were, and shaken. This your all-feedin #offering approaches: come all united, fraught, as ’twere with #offerings.

p: Ye are like #horses fastened to the chariot poles, luminous with your beams, with #splendour as at @Dawn; Like self-bright falcons, punishers of wicked #men, like hovering birds urged forward, scattering #rain around.

p: When ye come forth, O #Maruts, from the distance, from the great #treasure. of rich possessions, knowing, O #Vasus, boons that should be granted, even from afar drive back the #men who hate us.

p: He who, engaged in the rite's final duty brings, as a #man, oblation to the #Maruts, Wins him #life's wealthy fulness, blest with #heroes: he shall be present, too, where #Devas drink #Soma.

p: For these are helps adored at #offers, bringing good fortune by their name @Adityas. Speeding on #cars let them protect our praises, delighting in  'our #offering and #worship.

hymns.title: HYMN LXXVIII. Maruts.
hymns.text:
p: Ye by your hymns are like high-thoughted singers, skilful, inviting #Devas with #offers; Fair to behold, like #Kings, with bright adornment, like spotless gallants, leaders of the #people:

p: Like fire with flashing flame, breast-bound with chains of #gold, like tempest-blasts, self-moving, swift to lend your aid; As best of all foreknowers, #excellent to guide, like Somas, good to guard the #man who follows Law.

p: Shakers of all, like gales of wind they travel, like tongues of burning fires in their effulgence. #Mighty are they as warriors clad in armour, and, like the #Fathers' prayers, most Bounteous Givers.

p: Like spokes of #car-wheels in one nave united, ever victorious like heavenly #Heroes, shedding their precious balm like youthful suitors, they raise their #voice and chant their psalm as singers.

p: They who are fleet to travel like the noblest #steeds, long to obtain the prize like bounteous charioteerslike #waters speeding on with their precipitous floods, like omniform #Angirases with Sama-hymns.
