p: Even if your wicked bodies, O ye #Panis, were arrow-proof, your words are weak for wounding; And were the path to you as yet unmastered, @Narasamsa in neither case will spare you.

p: Paved with the rock is this our #treasure chamber; filled full of precious things, of kine, and #horses. These #Panis who are watchful keepers guard it. In vain hast thou approached this lonely station.

p: #Rsis will come inspirited with #Soma, #Angirases unwearied, and #Navagvas. This stall of #cattle will they part among them: then will the #Panis wish these words unspoken.

p: Even thus, O @Sarama, hast thou come hither, forced by celestial #might to make the #journey. Turn thee not back, for thou shalt be our #sister: O Blest One, we will give thee of the #cattle.

p: #Brotherhood, #sisterhood, I know not either: the dread #Angirases and @Indra know them. They seemed to long for kine when I departed. Hence, into distance, be ye gone, O #Panis.

p: Hence, far away, ye #Panis! Let the #cattle lowing come forth as holy Law commandeth, Kine which @Narasamsa, and #Soma, #Rsis, sages, and #pressing-stones have found when hidden.

hymns.title: HYMN CIX, Devas.
hymns.text:
p: THESE first, the boundless Sea, and @$Matarisvan, fierce-glowing Fire, the #Strong, the #Bliss-bestower. And heavenly Floods, first-#born by holy #Order, exclaimed against the outrage on a Brahman.

p: #King #Soma first of all, without reluctance, made restitution of the Brahman's consort. @Mitra and @Varuna were the inviters: @Agni as Hota; took her hand and led her.

p: The #man, her pledge, must by her hand be taken when they have cried, she is a Brahman's consort. She stayed not for a herald to conduct her: thus is the kingdom of a ruler guarded.

p: Thus spake of her those #Devas of old, Seven #Rsis who sate them down to their austere devotion: Dire is a Brahman's #wife led #home by others: in the supremest $Heaven she plants confusion.

p: The Brahmacari goes engaged in duty: he is a member of the #Devas’ own body. Through him @Narasamsa obtained his consort, as the #Devas gained the ladle brought by #Soma.

p: So then the #Devas restored her, so #men gave the #woman back again. The #Kings who kept their promises restored the Brahman's wedded #wife,

p: Having restored the Brahman's #wife, and freed them, with #Devas’ aid, from sin, they shared the fulness of the $Earth, and won themselves extended sway.

hymns.title: HYMN CX. Apris.
hymns.text:
p: THOU in the house of #man this day enkindled worshippest #Devas as @Deva, O #Jatavedas. Observant, bright as @Mitra, bring them hither: thou art a sapient and foreknowing envoy.

p: Tanunapat, fair-tongued, with sweet #meath balming the paths and waysof #Order, make them pleasant. Convey  'our #offering to $Heaven, exalting with holy thoughts ourhymns of #praise and #worship.

p: Invoked, deserving prayer and adoration, O @Agni, come accordant with the #Vasus. Thou art, O Youthful #Lord, the #Devas’ Invoker, so, best of Offerers, bring them quickly.

p: By rule the Sacred #Grass is scattered eastward, a robe to clothe this $Earth when #dawns are breaking. Widely it spreads around and far-extended, fair for the #Devas and bringing peace and freedom.

p: Let the expansive Doors be widely opened, like wives who deck their #beauty for their husbands. Lofty, celestial, all-impelling Portals, admit the #Devas and give them easy entrance.

p: Pouring sweet dews let holy Night and #Morning, each close to each, he seated at their station, Lofty, celestial #Dames with #gold to deck them. assuming all their fair and radiant #beauty.

p: Come the two first celestial sweet-voiced Hotars, arranging #offering for #man to #worship As singers who inspire us in assemblies, showing the eastward #light with their direction.

p: Let @Bharati come quickly to our #worship, and @Ila showing like a #human being. So let @Sarasvati and both her fellows, deft Devis, on this fair #grass be seated.

p: @Hotar more skilled in #offering, bring hither with speed to-day @Deva.@Tvastar, thou who knowest. Even him who formed these two, the $Earth and $Heaven the #Parents, with their forms, and every creature..

p: Send to our #offerings which thyself thou balmest the Companies of #Devas in ordered season. @Agni, @Vanaspati the Immolator sweeten our offered #gift with #meath and butter.

p: @Agni, as soon as he was #born, made ready  'the #offering, and was the #Devas’ preceder. May the #Devas cat our #offering consecrated according to this true Monk's #voice and guidance.

hymns.title: HYMN CXI. Indra.
hymns.text:
p: BRING forth your sacred #song ye prudent singers, even as are the thoughts of #human beings. Let us draw @Indra with true deeds anear us: he loves our #songs, the #Hero, and is potent.

p: The #hymn shone brightly from the seat of #worship: to the kine came the Bull, the Heifer's Offipring With #mighty bellowing hath he arisen, and hath pervaded even the spacious regions.

p: @Indra knows, verily, how to hear our singing, for he, victorious, made a path for @Surya. He made the #Cow, and be became the Sovran of $Heaven, primeval, matchless, and unshaken.

p: Praised by #Angirases, @Indra demolished with #might the works of the great watery monster Full many regions, too, hath he pervaded, and by his truth supported $Earth's foundation.

p: The counterpart of $Heaven and $Earth is @Indra: he knoweth all #libations, slayeth @Susna. The vast $Sky with the #Sun hath he extended, and, best otpillars, stayed it with a pillar.

p: The @Vrtra-slaver with his bolt felled @Vrtra: the magic of the godless, waxen #mighty. Here hast thou, Bold Assailant, boldly conquered. Yea, then thine arms, O @Indra, @Indra, @Varuna, and @Mitra, #Soma, @Maghavan, @Savitar, @Visnu, were potent.

p: When the #Dawns come attendant upon @Surya their rays discover #wealth of divers colours. The Star of $Heaven is seen as ’twere approaching: none knoweth aught of it as it departeth.

p: Far have they gone, the first of all these #waters, the #waters that flowed forth when @Indra sent them. Where is their spring, and where is their foundation? Where now, ye #Waters, is your inmost centre?

p: Thou didst free #rivers swallowed by the Dragon; and rapidly they set themselves in motion, Those that were loosed and those that longed for freedom. Excited now to speed they run unresting.

p: Yearning together they have sped to @Sindhu: the Fort-destroyer, praised, of old, hath loved them. @Indra, may thy terrestrial #treasure.s reach us, and our full #songs of #joy approach thy dwelling.

hymns.title: HYMN CXII. Indra.
hymns.text:
p: DRINK of the #juice, O @Indra, at thy plea. sure, for thy first draught is early morn's libation. Rejoice, that tho. Mayst subdue our . O #Hero, and we with lauds will tell thy #mighty exploits.

p: Thou hast a #car more swift than thought, O @Indra; thercon come hither, come to drink the #Soma. Let thy Bay #Steeds, thy Stallions, hasten hither, with whom thou cornest nigh and art delighted.

p: Deck out thy body with the fairest colours, with golden #splendour of the #Sun adorn it. O @Indra, turn thee hitherward invited by us thy #friends; be seated and be joyful.

p: O thou whose grandeur in thy festive transports not even these two great worlds have comprehended. Come, @Indra, with thy dear #Bay #Horses harnessed, come to our dwelling and the #food thou lovest.

p: Pressed for thy joyous #banquet is the #Soma, #Soma whereof thou, @Indra, ever drinking, Hast waged unequalled battles with thy foemen, which prompts the #mighty #flow of thine abundance.

p: Found from of old is this thy cup, O @Indra: @Satakratu, drink therefrom the #Soma. Filled is the beaker with the #meath that gladdens, the beaker which all #Deities #delight in.

p: From many a side with proffered entertainment the folk are calling thee, O #Mighty @Indra. These our #libations shall for thee be richest in sweet #meath: dvink thereof and find them pleasant.

p: I will declare thy deeds of old, O @Indra, the #mighty acts which thou hast first accomplished. In genuine wrath thou loosenedst the mountain so that the Brahman easily found the #cattle.

p: #Lord of the hosts, amid our bands be seated: they #call thee greatest #Sage among the sages. Nothing is done, even far away, without thee: great, wondrous, @Indra, @Indra, @Varuna, and @Mitra, #Soma, @Maghavan, @Savitar, @Visnu, is the #hymn I sing thee.

p: Aim of our eyes be thou, for we implore thee, O @Indra, @Indra, @Varuna, and @Mitra, #Soma, @Maghavan, @Savitar, @Visnu, #Friend of #friends and #Lord of #treasure.s. Fight, #Warrior #strong in truth, fight thou the battle: give us our share of undivided #riches.

hymns.title: HYMN CXTII. Indra.
hymns.text:
p: THE Heavens and the $Earth accordant with all #Devas encouraged graciously that vigorous #might of his. When he came showing forth his majesty and power, he drank of #Soma #juice and waxed exceeding #strong.

p: This majesty of his @Visnu extols and lauds, making the stalCthat gives the #meath #flow forth with inight. When @Indra @Indra, @Indra, @Varuna, and @Mitra, #Soma, @Maghavan, @Savitar, @Visnu with those who followed him had smitten @Vrtra he deserved the choice of #Devas.

p: When, bearing warlike weapons, fain to win thee #praise, thou mettest @Vrtra, yea, the Dragon, for the fight, then all the #Maruts who were gathered with #dice there extolled, O #Mighty One, thy powerful majesty.

p: Soon as he sprang to #life he forced asun. der hosts: forward the #Hero looked to manly deed and war. He cleft the rock, he let concurrent #streams #flow forth, and with his skilful art stablished the heavens' wide vault.

p: @Indra hath evermore possessed surpassing power: he forced, far from each other, $Heaven and $Earth apart. He hurled impetuous down his iron thunderbolt, a #joy to @Varuna's and @Mitra's #worshipper.

p: Then to the #mighty #powers of @Indra, to his wrath, his the fierce #Stormer, loud of #voice, they came with speed; What time the Potent One rent @Vrtra with his strength, who held the #waters back, whom darkness compassed round.

p: Even in the first of those heroic acts which they who strove together came with #might to execute, Deep darkness fell upon the slain, and @Indra won by #victory the right of being first invoked.

p: Then all the #Devas extolled, with eloquence inspired by draughts of #Soma #juice, thy deeds of manly #might. As @Agni eats the dry #food with his tcetlv, he ate @Vrtra, the Dragon, maimed by @Indra's deadly dart.

p: Proclaim his many friendships, met with friendship, made with singers, with the skilful and the eloquent. @Indra, when he subdues Dhuni and Cumuri, lists to Dabhiti for his faithful #spirit's sake.

p: Give #riches manifold with noble #horses, to be remembered while my #songs address thee. May we by easy paths pass all our troubles: find us this day a ford wide and extensive.

hymns.title: HYMN CXIV, Devas.
hymns.text:
p: Two perfect springs of heat pervade the Threefold, and come for their #delight is @$Matarisvan. Craving the #milk of $Heaven the #Devas are present: well do they know the praisesong and the Saman.

p: The Monks beard far away, as they are ordered, serve the three Nirrtis, for well they know them. Sages have traced the cause that first produced them, dwelling in distant and mysterious chambers.

p: The Youthful One, well-shaped, with four locks braided, brightened with oil, puts on the ordinances. Two Birds of #mighty power are seated near her, there where the #Deities receive their portion.

p: One of these Birds hath passed into the sea of #air: thence he looks round and views this universal world. With simple heart I have beheld him from anear: his #Mother kisses him and he returns her kiss.

p: Him with fair #wings though only One in nature, #wise singers shape, with #songs, in many figures. While they at #offers fix the metres, they measure out twelve chalices of #Soma.

p: While they arrange the four and six-and-thirty, and duly #order, up to twelve, the measures, Having disposed  'the #offering thoughtful sages send the #Car forward with the Rc and Saman.

p: The Chariot's majesties are fourteen others: seven sages lead it onward with their Voices. Who will declare to us the ford Apnana, the path whereby they drink first draughts of #Soma?

p: The fifteen lauds are in a thousand places that is as vast as $Heaven and $Earth in measure. A thousand spots contain the #mighty thousand. @Vak spreadeth forth as far as Prayer extendeth.

p: What #sage hath learned the metres' application? Who hath gained @Vak, the #spirit's aim and object? Which ministering priest is called eighth #Hero? Who then hath tracked the two Bay #Steeds of @Indra?

p: Yoked to his chariot-pole there stood the Coursers: they only travel round $Earth's farthest limits. These, when their driver in his #home is settled, receive the allotted meed of their exertion.

hymns.title: HYMN CXV. Agni.
hymns.text:
p: VERILY wondrous is the tender Youngling's growth who never draweth nigh to drink his Mothers' #milk. As soon as she who hath no udder bore him, he, faring on his great errand, suddenly grew #strong.

p: Then @Agni was his name, most active to bestow, gathering up the trees with his consuming tooth; Skilled in fair #offering, armed with destroying tongue, impetuous as a bull that snorteth in the mead.

p: #Praise him, yourDeva who, #bird-like, rests upon a tree, scattering #drops of #juice and pouring forth his flood, Speaking aloud with flame as with his lips a priest, and broadening his paths like one of high command.

p: Thou Everlasting, whom, far-striding fain to burn, the winds, uninterrupted, never overcome, they have approached, as warriors eager for the fight, heroic @Trita, guiding him to gain his wish.

p: This @Agni is the best of @Kanvas, @Kanvas' #Friend, Conqueror of the foe whether afar or near. May @Agni guard the singers, guard the princes well. May @Agni grant to us our princes' gracious #help.

p: Do thou, Supitrya, swiftly following, make thyself the #lord of #Jatavedas, mightiest of all, who surely gives a #boon even in thirsty land most powerful, prepared to aid us in the wilds.

p: Thus noble @Agni with princes and mortal #men is lauded, #excellent for conquering strength with chiefs, #Men who are well-disposed as #friends and true to Law, even as the heavens in majesty surpass #mankind.

p: O #Son of Strength, Victorious, with this title Upastuta's most potent #voice reveres thee. Blest with #brave #sons by thee we will extol thee, and lengthen out the days of our existence.

p: Thus, @Agni, have the #sons of Vrstihavya, the #Rsis, the Upastutas invoked thee. Protect them, guard the singers and the princes. With Vasat! have they come, with hands uplifted, with their uplifted hands and cries of #Glory!

hymns.title: HYMN CXV1. Indra.
hymns.text:
p: DRINK #Soma #juice for #mighty power and vigour, drink, Strongest One, that tho. Mayst smite down @Vrtra. Drink thou, invoked, for strength, and #riches: drink thou thy fill of #meath and pour it down, O @Indra.

p: Drink of the foodful #juice stirred into motion, drink what thou choosest of the flowing #Soma. Giver of weal, be joyful in thy #spirit, and turn thee hitherward to bless and prosper.

p: Let heavenly #Soma gladden thee, O @Indra, let that effused among #mankind #delight thee. Rejoice in that whereby thou gavest freedom, and that whereby thou conquerest thy foemen.

p: Let @Indra come, impetuous, doubly #mighty, to the poured #juice, the Bull, with two Bay Coursers. With juices pressed in #milk, with #meath presented, glut evermore thy bolt, O Foe-destroyer.

p: Dash down, outffaming their sharp flaming weapons, the #strong-holds of the #men urged on by demons. I give thee, #Mighty One, great strength and conquest: go, meet thy foes and rend them in the battle.

p: Extend afar the votary's fame and #glory, as the firm archer's strength drives off the foeman. Ranged on our side, grown #strong in #might that conquers, never defeated, still increase thy body.

p: To thee have we presented this oblation: accept it, Sovran Ruler, free from anger. #Juice, @Indra, @Indra, @Varuna, and @Mitra, #Soma, @Maghavan, @Savitar, @Visnu, for thee is pressed and ripened: eat, @Indra, drink of that which stirs to meet thee.

p: Eat, @Indra, these oblations which approach thee: be pleased with #food made ready and with #Soma. With entertainment we receive thee friendly: effectual be  'theofferings wishes.

p: I send sweet speech to @Indra and to @Agni: with hymns I speed it like a boat through #waters. Even thus, the #Devas seem moving round about me, the fountains and bestowers of our #riches.

hymns.title: HYMN CXVII. Liberality.
hymns.text:
p: THE #Devas have not ordained hunger to be our #death: even to the well-fed #man comes #death in varied shape. The #riches of the liberal never waste away, while he who will not give finds none to comfort him.

p: The #man with #food in store who, when the needy comes in miserable case begging for bread to eat, Hardens his heart against him-even when of old he did him service-finds not one to comfort him.

p: Bounteous is he who gives unto the beggar who comes to him in want of #food and feeble. Success attends him in the shout of battle. He makes a #friend of him in future troubles.

p: No #friend is he who to his #friend and comrade who comes imploring #food, will offer nothing. Let him depart-no #home is that to rest in-, and rather seek a stranger to support him.

p: Let the rich satisfy the poor implorer, and bend his eye upon a longer pathway. #Riches come now to one, now to another, and like the wheels of #cars are ever rolling.

p: The foolish #man wins #food with fruitless labour: that #food -I speak the truth- shall be his ruin. He feeds no trusty #friend, no #man to love him. All guilt is he who eats with no partaker.

p: The ploughshare ploughing makes the #food that feeds us, and with its feet cuts through the path it follows. Better the speaking than the silent Brahman: the liberal #friend outyalues him who gives not.

p: He with one foot hath far outrun the biped, and the two-footed catches the three-footed. Four-footed creatures come when bipeds #call them, and stand and look where five are met together.

p: The hands are both alike: their labour differs. The yield of #sister milch-kine is unequal. Twins even diffier in their strength and vigour: two, even kinsmen, differ in their bounty.

hymns.title: HYMN CXVIII. Agni.
hymns.text:
p: @Agni, refulgent among #men thou slayest the devouring fiend, Bright Ruler in thine own abode.

p: Thou springest up when worshipped well the #drops of butter are thy #joy When ladies are brought near to thee.

p: Honoured with #gifts he shines afar, @Agni #adorable with #song: The dripping ladle balms his face.

p: @Agni with honey in his mouth, honoured with #gifts, is balmed with oil, Refulgent in his #wealth of #light.

p: Praised by our hymns thou kindlest thee, Oblation-bearer, for the #Devas As such do mortals #call on thee.

p: To that #Immortal @Agni pay #worship with oil, ye mortal #men. #Lord of the house, whom none deceives.

p: O @Agni, burn the @Raksasas with thine unconquerable flame #Shine guardian of Eternal Law.

p: So, @Agni, with thy glowing face burn fierce against the female fiends, Shining among Uruksayas.

p: Uruksayas have kindled thee, Oblation-bearer, thee, with hymns. Best #Worshipper among #mankind.

hymns.title: HYMN CXIX. Indra.
hymns.text:
p: THIS, even this was my resolve, to win a #cow, to win a steed: Have I not drunk of #Soma #juice?

p: Like violent gusts of wind the draughts that I have drunk have lifted me Have I not drunk of #Soma #juice?

p: The draughts I drank have borne me up, as fleet-foot #horses draw a #car: Have I not drunk of #Soma #juice?

p: The #hymn hath reached me, like a #cow who lows to meet her darling calf: Have I not drunk of #Soma #juice?

p: As a wright bends a chariot-seat so round my heart I bend the #hymn: Have I not drunk of #Soma #juice?

p: Not as a mote within the eye count the Five Tribes of #men with me: Have I not drunk of #Soma #juice?

p: The heavens and $Earth themselves have not grown equal to one half of me Have I not drunk of #Soma #juice?

p: I in my grandeur have surpassed the heavens and all this spacious $Earth Have I not drunk of #Soma #juice?

p: Aha! this spacious $Earth will I deposit either here or there Have I not drunk of #Soma #juice?

p: In one short moment will I smite the $Earth in fury here or there: Have I not drunk of #Soma #juice?

p: One of my flanks is in the $Sky; I let the other trail below: Have I not drunk of #Soma #juice?

p: 1, greatest of the #MightyOnes, am lifted to the $Firmament: Have I not drunk of #Soma #juice?

p: I seek the #worshipper's abode; oblation-bearer to the #Devas: Have I not drunk of #Soma #juice?

hymns.title: HYMN CXX. Indra.
hymns.text:
p: IN all the worlds That was the Best and Highest whence sprang the #Mighty #Devas, of splendid valour. As soon as #born he overcomes his foemen, be in whom all who lend him aid are joyful.

p: Grown #mighty in his strength, with ample vigour, he as a foe strikes fear into the Dasa, Eager to win the breathing and the breathless. All sang thy #praise at #banquet and oblation.

p: All concentrate on thee their mental vigour, what time these, twice or thrice, are thine assistants. Blend what is sweeter than the sweet with sweetness: win. quickly with our #meath that #meath in battle.

p: Therefore in thee too, thou who winnest #riches, at every #banquet are the sages joyful. With mightier power, Bold @Deva, extend thy firmness: let not malignant Yatudhanas harm thee.

p: Proudly we put our trust in thee in battles, when we behold great #wealth the prize of combat. I with my words impel thy weapons onward, and sharpen with my #meditation thy vital vigour.

p: Worthy of praises, many-shaped, most skilful, most energetic, @Aptya of the Aptyas: He with his #might destroys the seven Danus, subduing many who were deemed his equals.

p: Thou in that house which thy protection guardeth bestowest #wealth, the higher and the lower. Thou stablishest the two much-wandering Mothers, and bringest many deeds to their completion.

p: Brhaddiva, the foremost of #light-winners, repeats these holy prayers, this strength of @Indra. He rules the great self-luminous fold of #cattle, and all the doors of #light hath he thrown open.

p: Thus hath Brhaddiva, the great Atharvan, spoken to @Indra as himself in person. The spotless Sisters, they who are his Mothers, with power exalt him and impel him onward.

hymns.title: HYMN CXXI. Ka.
hymns.text:
p: IN the beginning rose Hiranyagarbha, #born Only #Lord of all created beings. He fixed and holdeth up this $Earth and $Heaven. What @Deva.shall we adore with our oblation?

p: Giver of vital breath, of power and vigour, he whose commandments all the #Devas acknowledge -. The #Lord of #death, whose shade is #life #immortal. What @Deva.shall we adore with our oblation?

p: Who by his grandeur hath become Sole Ruler of all the moving world that breathes and slumbers; He who is Loord of #men and #Lord of #cattle. What @Deva.shall we adore with our oblation?

p: His, through his #might, are these snow-covered #mountains, and #men #call sea and @Rasa his possession: His arms are these, his are these heavenly regions. What @Deva.shall we adore with our oblation?

p: By him the heavens are #strong and $Earth is stedfast, by him #light's realm and $Sky-vault are supported: By him the regions in $$Mid-#Air were measured. What @Deva.shall we adore with our oblation?

p: To him, supported by his #help, two #armies embattled look while trembling in their #spirit, when over them the risen #Sun is shining. What @Deva.shall we adore with our oblation?

p: What time the #mighty #waters came, containing the universal germ, producing @Agni, thence sprang the #Devas’ one #spirit into being. What @Deva.shall we adore with our oblation?

p: He in his #might surveyed the floods containing productive force and generating #Worship. He is the @Deva.of gods, and none beside him. What @Deva.shall we adore with our oblation?

p: Nee. May he harm us who is $Earth's Begetter, nor he whose laws are sure, the heavens' #Creator. He who brought forth the great and lucid #waters. What @Deva.shall we adore with our oblation?

p: @Prajapati! thou only comprehendest all these created things, and none beside thee. Grant us our hearts' desire when we invoke thee. May we have store of #riches in possession.

hymns.title: HYMN CXXII. Agni.
hymns.text:
p: I #PRAISE the @Deva.of wondrous #might like @Indra, the lovely pleasant Guest whom all must welcome. May @Agni, Monk and #Master of the household, give #hero strength and all-sustaining #riches.

p: O @Agni, graciously accept this #song of mine, thou passing-#wise who knowest every ordinance. Enwrapped in holy oil further the course of prayer: the #Devas bestow according to thy holy law.

p: #Immortal, wandering round the seven stations, give, a liberal Giver, to the pious #worshipper, #Wealth, @Agni, with #brave #sons and ready for his use: welcome the #man who comes with fuel unto thee.

p: The seven who bring oblations #worship thee, the #Strong, the first, the Great #Chief Monk, Ensign of #offering, the oil-anointed Bull, @Agni who hears, who sends as @Deva.full #hero strength to him who freely gives.

p: First messenger art thou, meet for election: drink thou thy fill invited to the Anirta, the #Maruts in the votary's house adorned thee; with lauds the #Bhrgus gave thee #light and #glory.

p: Milking the teeming #Cow for all-sustaining #food. O #Wise One, for the #worship-loving #worshipper, Thou, @Agni, dropping oil, thrice lighting works of Law, showest thy wisdom circling #home and #offering.

p: They who at flushing of this @Dawn appointed thee their messenger, these #men have paid thee #reverence. #Devas strengthened thee for #work that must be glorified, @Agni, while they made butter pure for #offering.

p: Arrangers in our synods, @Agni, while they sang Vasisistha s #sons have called thee down, the Potent One. Maintain the growth of #wealth with #men who #offering. Ye #Devas, preserve us with your blessings evermore.

hymns.title: HYMN CXXIII. Vena.
hymns.text:
p: SEE, Vena, #born in #light, hath driven hither, on chariot of the #air, the Calves of Prsni. Singers with hymns caress him as an infant there where the #waters and the sunlight mingle.

p: Vena draws up his wave from out the $Ocean. mist-#born, the fair one's back is made apparent, Brightly he shone aloft on #Order's summit: the hosts sang #glory to their common birthplace.

p: Full many, lowing to their joint-possession, dwelling together stood the Darling's Mothers. Ascending to the lofty height of #Order, the bands of singers 'sip the sweets of Amrta.

p: Knowing his #form, the sages yearned to meet him: they have come nigh to hear the wild Bull's bellow. Performing #offering they reached the #river: for the #Gandharva found the #immortal #waters.

p: The #Apsaras, the Lady, sweetly smiling, supports her Lover in sublimest $Heaven. In his #Friend's dwelling as a #friend he wanders: he, Vena, rests him on his golden pinion.

p: They gaze on thee with longing in their #spirit, as on a #strong-winged #bird that mounteth $Sky-ward; On thee with #wings of #gold, @Varuna's envoy, the #Bird that hasteneth to the #home of @Yama.

p: Erect, to $Heaven hath the #Gandharva mounted, pointing at us his many-coloured weapons; Clad in sweet raiment beautiful to look on, for he, as #light, produceth forms that please us.

p: When as a spark he cometh near the $Ocean, still looking with a vulture's eye to $Heaven, His lustre, joying in its own bright #splendour, maketh dear glories in the lowest region.

hymns.title: HYMN CXXIV. Agni, Etc.
hymns.text:
p: COME to this #offering of ours, O @Agni, threefold, with seven threads and five divisions. Be our oblation-bearer and preceder: thou hast lain lon enough in during darkness.

p: I come a @Deva.foreseeing from the godless to immortality by secret pathways, While I, ungracious one, desert the gracious, leave mine own #friends and seek the kin of strangers.

p: 1, looking to the guest of other lineage, have founded many a rule of Law and #Order. I bid farewell to the Great @Deva, the #Father, and, for neglect, obtain my share of #worship.

p: I tarried many a year within this altar: I leave the #Father, for my choice is @Indra. Away pass @Agni, @Varuna and #Soma. Rule ever changes: this I come to favour.

p: These #Asuras have lost their #powers of magic. But thou, O @Varuna, if thou dost love me, O #King, discerning truth and right from falsehood, come and be #Lord and Ruler of my kingdom.

p: Here is the #light of $Heaven, here allis lovely; here there is radiance, here is #air's wide region. Let us two slaughter @Vrtra. Forth, O #Soma! Thou art oblation: we therewith will serve thee.

p: The #Sage hath fixed his #form by wisdom in the heavens: @Varuna with no violence let the #waters #flow. Like women-folk, the floods that bring prosperity have eau lit his hue and colour as they gleamed and shone.

p: These wait upon his loftiest power and vigour: he dwells in these who #triumph in their @Deva.ead; And they, like #people who elect their ruler, have in abhorrence turned away from @Vrtra.

p: They #call him #Swan, the abhorrent floods' Companion, moving in friendship with #celestial #Waters. The poets in their thought have looked on @Indra swiftly approaching when Anustup calls him.

hymns.title: HYMN CXXV. Vak.
hymns.text:
p: I TRAVEL with the #Rudras and the #Vasus, with the @Adityas and All-#Devas I wander. I hold aloft both @Varuna and @Mitra, @Indra and @Agni, and the Pair of @Asvins.

p: I cherish and sustain high-swelling #Soma, and @Tvastar I support, @Pusan, and @Bhaga. I load with #wealth the zealous sdcrificer who pours the #juice and #offers his oblation

p: I am the Queen, the gatherer-up of #treasure.s, most thoughtful, first of those who merit #worship. Thus #Devas have stablished me in many places with many homes to enter and abide in.

p: Through me alone all eat the #food that feeds them.each #man who sees, brewhes, hears the word outspoken They know it not, but yet they dwell beside me. Hear, one and all, the truth as I declare it.

p: 1, verily, myself announce and utter the word that #Devas and #men alike shall welcome. I make the #man I love exceeding #mighty, make him a #sage, a Rsi, and a Brahman.

p: I bend the bow for Rudra that his arro. May strike and subdue the hater of devotion. I rouse and #order battle for the #people, and I have penetrated $Earth and $Heaven.

p: On the world's summit I bring forth the #Father: my #home is in the #waters, in the $Ocean. Thence I extend o’er all existing creatures, and touch even yonder $Heaven with my forehead.

p: I breathe a #strong breath like the wind and tempest, the while I hold together all existence. Beyond this wide $Earth and beyond the heavens I have become so #mighty in my grandeur.

hymns.title: HYMN CXXVI, Devas.
hymns.text:
p: No peril, no severe distress, ye #Devas, affects the mortal #man, whom @Aryaman and @Mitra lead, and Varima, of one accord, beyond his foes.

p: This very thing do we desire, @Varuna, @Mitra, @Aryaman, Whereby ye guhrd the mortal #man from sore distress, and lead him safe beyond his foes.

p: These are, each one, our present helps, @Varuna, @Mitra, @Aryaman. Best leaders, best deliverers to lead us on and bear as safe beyond our foes.

p: Ye compass round and guard each #man, @Varuna, @Mitra, @Aryaman: In your dear keepin. May we be, ye who are #excellent as guides beyond our foes.

p: @Adityas are beyond all foes.@Varuna, @Mitra, @Aryaman: #Strong Rudra with the #Marut host, @Indra, @Agni let us #call for weal beyond our foes.

p: These lead us safely over all, @Varuna, @Mitra, @Aryaman, these who are #Kings of living #men, over all troubles far away beyond our foes.

p: May they give #bliss to aid us well, @Varuna, @Mitra, @Aryaman: May the @Adityas, when we meditate, grant us wide shelter and defence beyond our foes.

p: As in this place, O #Holy Ones, ye #Vasus freed even the Gaud when her feet were fettered. So free us now from trouble and affliction: and let our #life be lengthened still, O Api.

hymns.title: HYMN CXXVII. Night.
hymns.text:
p: WITH all her eyes the Devi Night looks forth approaching many a spot: She hath put all her glories on.

p: #Immortal. she hath filled the waste, the Devi hath filled height and depth: She conquers darkness with her #light.

p: The Devi as she comes hath set the @Dawn her #Sister in her place: And then the darkness vanishes.

p: So favour us this night, O thou whose pathways we have visited As birds their nest upon the tree.

p: The villagers have sought their homes, and all that walks and all that flies, Even the falcons fain for prey.

p: Keep off the she-wolf and the wolf, O Urmya, keep the thief away; Easy be thou for us to pass.

p: Clearly hath she come nigh to me who decks the dark with richest hues: O #Morning, cancel it like debts.

p: These have I brought to thee like kine. O Night, thou #Child of $Heaven, accept This laud as for a conqueror.

hymns.title: HYMN CXXVIII, Devas.
hymns.text:
p: LET me win #glory, @Agni, in our battles: enkindling thee. May we support our bodies. May the four regions bend and bow before me: with thee for guardia. May we win in combat.

p: May all the #Devas be on my side in battle, the #Maruts led by @Indra, @Visnu, @Agni. Mine be the middle #air's extended region, an. May the wind blow favouring these my wishes.

p: May the #Devas grant me #riches. May the #blessing and invocation of the #Devas assist me. Foremost in fight be the divine Invokers. May we, unwounded, have #brave #heroes round us.

p: For me let them present all mine oblations, and let my mind's intention be accomplished. May I he guiltless of the least transgression: and, all ye #Devas, do ye combine to bless us.

p: Ye six divine Expanses, grant us freedom: here, all ye #Devas, acquit yourselves like #heroes. Let us not lose our children or our bodies: let us not benefit the foe, #King #Soma!

p: Baffling the wrath of our opponents, @Agni, guard us as our infallible Protector. Let these thy foes turn back and seek their houses, and let their thought who watch at #home be ruined.

p: #Lord of the world, #Creator of creators the saviour @Deva who overcomes the foeman. May #Devas, @Narasamsa, both @Asvins shelter from ill this #offering and offerer.

p: Foodful, and much-invoked, at this our callin. May the great Bull vouchsafe us wide protection. #Lord of Bay Coursers, @Indra, blew our children: harm us not, give us not as prey to others.

p: Let those who are our foemen stay. afar from us: with @Indra and with @Agni we will drive them off. #Vasus, @Adityas, #Rudras have exalted me, made me far-reaching, #mighty, thinker, sovran #lord.

hymns.title: HYMN CXXIX. Creation.
hymns.text:
p: THEN was not non-existent nor existent: there was no realm of #air, no $Sky beyond it. What covered in, and where? and what gave shelter? Was #water there, unfathomed depth of #water?

p: #Death was not then, nor was there aught #immortal: no sign was there, the day's and night's divider. That One Thing, breathless, breathed by its own nature: apart from it was nothing whatsoever.

p: Darkness there was: at first concealed in darkness this All was indiscriminated chaos. All that existed then was void and #form less: by the great power of Warmth was #born that Unit.

p: Thereafter rose Desire in the beginning, Desire, the primal seed and germ of #Spirit. Sages who searched with their heart's thought discovered the existent's kinship in the non-existent.

p: Transversely was their severing line extended: what was above it then, and what below it? There were begetters, there were #mighty forces, free action here and energy up yonder

p: Who verily knows and who can here declare it, whence it was #born and whence comes this creation? The #Devas are later than this world's production. Who knows then whence it first came into being?

p: He, the first origin of this creation, whether he formed it all or did not #form it, whose eye controls this world in highest $Heaven, he verily knows it, or perhaps he knows not.

hymns.title: HYMN CXXX. Creation.
hymns.text:
p: THE #offering drawn out with threads on every side, stretched by a hundred sacred ministers and one. This do these #Fathers weave who hitherward are come: they sit beside the warp and cry, Weave forth, weave back.

p: The #Man extends it and the #Man unbinds it: even to this vault of $Heaven hath he outspun, it. These pegs are fastened to the seat of #worship: they made the Sama-hymns their weaving shuttles.

p: What were the rule, the #order and the model? What were the wooden fender and the butter? What were the #hymn, the chant, the recitation, when to the @Deva.all #Deities paid #worship?

p: Closely was Gayatri conjoined with @Agni, and closely @Indra, @Indra, @Varuna, and @Mitra, #Soma, @Maghavan, @Savitar, @Visnu combined with Usnih. Brilliant with Ukthas, #Soma joined Anustup: @Narasamsa's #voice by Brhati was aided.

p: Viraj adhered to @Varuna and @Mitra: here Tristup day by day was @Indra's portion. Jagati entered all the #Devas together: so by this knowledge #men were raised to #Rsis.

p: So by this knowledge #men were raised to #Rsis, when ancient #offering sprang up, our #Fathers. With the mind's eye I think that I behold them who first performed this #offerings #worship.

p: They who were versed in ritual and metre, in hymns and rules, were the Seven @Deva.ike #Rsis. Viewing the path of those of old, the sages have taken up the reins like chariot-drivers.

hymns.title: HYMN CXXXI. Indra.
hymns.text:
p: DRIVE all our enemies away, O @Indra, the western, #mighty Conqueror, and the eastern. #Hero, drive off our northern foes and southern, that we in thy wide shelte. May be joyful.

p: What then? As #men whose fields are full of barley reap the ripe corn removing it in #order, So bring the #food of those #men, bring it hither, who went not to prepare the #grass for #worship.

p: #Men come not with one #horse at sacred #seasons; thus they obtain no honour in assemblies. Sages desiring herds of kine and #horses strengthen the #mighty @Indra for his friendship.

p: Ye, @Asvins, Lords of #Splendour, drank full draughts of grateful #Soma #juice, and aided @Indra in his #work with @Namuci of #Asura birth.

p: As #parents aid a #son, both @Asvins, @Indra, aided thee with their wondrous #Powers and wisdom. When thou, with #might. hadst drunk the draught that gladdens, @Sarasvati, O @Indra, @Indra, @Varuna, and @Mitra, #Soma, @Maghavan, @Savitar, @Visnu, refreshed thee.

p: @Indra is #strong to save, rich in assistanc. May he, possessing all, be kind and gracious. May he disperse our foes and give us safety, an. May we be the lords of #hero vigou r.

p: May we enjoy his favour, his the Hol. May we enjoy his blessed loving kindness. May this rich @Indra, as our good Protector, drive off and keep afar all those who hate us.

hymns.title: HYMN CXXXII. Mitra. Varuna.
hymns.text:
p: MAY #Dyaus the #Lord of lauded #wealth, and $Earth stand by the #man who #offers #offering, an. May the @Asvins, both the #Devas, strengthen the #worshipper with #bliss.

p: As such we honour you, @Mitra and @Varuna, with hasty zeal, most blest, you who sustain the folk. May we, through your friendship for the #worshipper, subdue the fiends.

p: And when we seek to win your love and friendship, weẉho have precious #wealth in our possession, or when the #worshipper augments his #riches let not his #treasure.s be shut up

p: That other, #Asura! too was #born of $Heaven. thou art, O @Varuna, the #King of all #men. The chariot's #Lord was well content, forbearing to anger #Death by sin so great. This sin hath Sakaputa here committed. #Heroes who fled to their dear #friend he slayeth, when the Steed bringeth down your grace and favour in bodies dear and worshipful.

p: Your #Mother @Aditi, ye #wise, was purified with #water even as $Earth is purified from $Heaven. Show love and kindness here below: wash her in rays of heavenly #light.

p: Ye Twain have seated you as Lords of #Wealth, as one who mounts a #car to him who sits upon the pole, upon the wood. These our disheartened tribes Nrmedhas saved from woe, Sumedhas saved from Woe.

hymns.title: HYMN CXXXIII. Indra.
hymns.text:
p: SING strength to @Indra that shall set his chariot in the foremost place. Giver of room in closest fight, slayer of foes in shock of war, be thou our great encourager. Let the weak bowstrings break upon the bows of feeble enemies.

p: Thou didst destroy the Dragon: thou sentest the #rivers down to $Earth. Foeless, O @Indra, wast thou #born. Thou tendest well each choicest thing. Therefore we draw us close to thee. Let the weak bowstrings break upon the bows of feeble enemies.

p: Destroyed be all malignities and all our enemy's designs. Thy bolt thou castest, at the foe, O @Indra, who would srnite us dead: thy liberal bounty gives us #wealth.

p: The robber #people round about, @Indra, who watch and aim at us. Trample them down beneath thy foot; a conquering scatterer art thou.

p: Whoso assails us, @Indra, be the #man a stranger or akin, Bring down, thyself, his strength although it be as vast as are the heavens.

p: Close to thy friendship do we cling, O @Indra, and depend, or, thee. Lead us beyond all pain and grief along the path of holy Law.

p: Do thou bestow upon us her, O @Indra, who yields according to the #singer's longing, that the great Co. May, with exhaustless udder, pouring a thousand #streams, give #milk to feed us.

hymns.title: HYMN CXXXIV. Indra.
hymns.text:
p: As, like the #Morning, thou hast filled, O @Indra, both the $Earth and $Heaven. So as the #Mighty One, great #King of all the #mighty world of #men, the Devi #Mother brought thee forth, the Blessed #Mother gave thee #life.

p: Relax that mortal's stubborn strength whose heart is bent on wickedness. Trample him down beneath thy feet who watches for and aims at us. The Devi #Mother brought thee forth, the Blessed #Mother gave thee #life.

p: Shake down, O Slayer of the foe, those great all splendid enemies. With all thy #powers, O @Sakra, all thine helps, O @Indra, shake them down:

p: As thou, O @Satakratu O Indrv, shakest all things down As #wealth for him who sheds the #juice, with thine assistance thousandfold.

p: Around, on every side like #drops of sweat let lightning-flashes fall. Let all malevolence pass away from us like threads of Darva #grass.

p: Thou bearest in thine hand a lance like a long hook, great Counsellor! As with his foremost foot a goat, draw down the branch, O @Indra, @Indra, @Varuna, and @Mitra, #Soma, @Maghavan, @Savitar, @Visnu.

p: Never, O #Devas, do we offend, nor are we ever obstinate: we walk as holy texts command. Closely we clasp and cling to you, cling to your sides, beneath your arms.

hymns.title: HYMN CXXXV. Yama.
hymns.text:
p: IN the Tree clothed with goodly leaves where @Yama drinketh with the #Devas, the #Father, #Master of the house, tendeth with love our ancient Sires.

p: I looked reluctantly on him who cherishes those #men of old, On him who treads that evil path, and then I yearned for this again.

p: Thou mountest, though thou dost not see, O #Child, the new and wheel-less #car Which thou hast fashioned mentally, onepoled but turning every way.

p: The #car which thou hast made to roll hitherward from the Sages, #Child! This hath the Saman followed close, hence, laid together on a ship.

p: Who was the #father of the #child? Who made the chariot roll away? Who will this day declare to us how the funeral #gift was made?

p: When the funeral #gift was placed, straightway the point of flame appeared. A depth extended in the front: a passage out was made behind.

p: Here is the seat where @Yama dwells, that which is called the #Home of #Devas: Here minstrels blow the flute for him here he is glorified with #songs.

hymns.title: HYMN CXXXVI. Kesins.
hymns.text:
p: HE with the long loose locks supports @Agni, and moisture, $Heaven, and $Earth: He is all $Sky to look upon: he with long hair is called this #light.

p: The Munis, girdled with the wind, wear garments soiled of yellow hue. They, following the wind's swift course go where the #Devas have gone before.

p: Transported with our Munihood we have pressed on into the winds: You therefore, mortal #men. behold our natural bodies and no more.

p: The Muni, made associate in the holy #work of every @Deva, Looking upon all varied forms flies through the region of the #air.

p: The Steed of @Vata, @Vayu's #friend, the Muni, by the #Devas impelled, in both the oceans hath his #home, in eastern and in western sea.

p: Treading the path of sylvan beasts, #Gandharvas, and Apsarases. He with long locks, who knows the wish, is a sweet most delightful #friend

p: @Vayu hath churned for him: for him he poundeth things most hard to bend, when he with long loose locks hath drunk, with Rudra, #water from the cup.

hymns.title: HYMN CXXXVII Devas.
hymns.text:
p: YE #Devas, raise up once more the #man whom ye have humbled and brought low. O #Devas, restore to #life again the #man who hatb committed sin.

p: Two several winds are blowing here, from @Sindhu, from a distant land. May one breathe energy to thee, the other blow disease away.

p: Hither, O Wind, blow healing balm, blow all disease away, thou Wind; For thou who hast all medicine comest as envoy of the #Devas.

p: I am come nigh to thee with balms to give thee rest and keep thee safe. I bring thee blessed strength, I drive thy weakening malady away.

p: Here let the #Devas deliver him, the #Maruts’ band deliver him: All things that be deliver him that he be freed from his disease.

p: The #Waters have their healing power, the #Waters drive disease away. The #Waters have a balm for all: let them make medicine for thee.

p: The tongue that leads the #voice precedes. Then with our ten-fold branching hands, with these two chasers of disease we stroke thee with a gentle touch.

hymns.title: HYMN CXXXVIII. Indra.
hymns.text:
p: ALLIED with thee in friendship, @Indra, these, thy monks, remembering Holy Law, rent @Vrtra limb from limb, when they bestowed the #Dawns and let the #waters #flow, and when thou didst chastise dragons at @Kutsa's #call.

p: Thou sentest forth productive #powers, clavest the hills, thou dravest forth the kine, thou drankest pleasant #meath. Thou gavest increase through this Tree's surpassing #might. The #Sun shone by the #hymn that sprang from Holy Law.

p: In the mid-way of $Heaven the #Sun unyoked his #car: the Arya found a match to meet his Dam foe. Associate with @Rjisvan @Indra overthrew the solid forts of Pipru, conjuring #Asura.

p: He boldly cast down forts which none had e’er assailed: unwearied he destroycd the godless #treasure.-stores. Like #Sun and #Moon he took the stronghold's #wealth away, and, praised in #song, demolished foes with flashing dart.

p: Armed with resistless weapons, with vast power to cleave, the @Vrtra conquerer whets his darts and deals fordi wounds. Bright @Usas was afraid of @Indra's slaughtering bolt: she went upon her way and left her chariot there.

p: These are thy famous exploits, only thine, when thou alone hast left the other reft of #offering. Thou in the heavens hast set the ordering of the Moons: the #Father bears the felly portioned out by thee.

hymns.title: HYMN CXXXIX. Indra, indra, Varuna, and Mitra, Soma, Maghavan, Savitar, Visnu.
hymns.text:
p: @Savitar, golden-haired, hath lifted eastward, bright With the sunbeams, his eternal lustre; He in whose energy #wise @Pusan marches, surveying all existence like a herdsman.

p: Beholding #men he sits amid the $Heaven filling the two world-halves and #air's wide region. He looks upon the rich far-spreading pastures between the eastern and the western limit.

p: He, root of #wealth, the gatherer-up of #treasure.s, looks with his #might on every #form and figure. @Indra, @Indra, @Varuna, and @Mitra, #Soma, @Maghavan, @Savitar, @Visnu, like a @Deva.hose Law is constant, stands in the battle for the #spoil like @Indra.

p: #Waters from #offering came to the #Gandharva @Visvavasu, O #Soma, when they saw him. @Indra, approaching quickly, marked their going, and looked around upon the #Sun's enclosures.

p: This #song @Visvavasu shall sing us, meter of #air's mid-realm celestial #Gandharva, that we may know aright both truth and falsehood. May he inspire our thoughts and #help our praises.

p: In the floods' track he found the bootyseeker: the rocky #cow-pen's doors he threw wide open. These, the #Gandharva told him, Rowed with Amrta. @Indra knew well the puissancc of the dragons.

hymns.title: HYMN CXL. Agni.
hymns.text:
p: @Agni, #life-power and fame are thine: thy fires blaze mightily, thou rich in #wealth of beams! #Sage, passing bright, thou givest to the #worshipper, with strength, the #food that merits laud.

p: With brilliant, purifying sheen, with perfect sheen thou liftest up thyself in #light. Thou, visiting both thy Mothers, aidest them as #Son: thou joinest close the $Earth and $Heaven.

p: O #Jatavedas, #Son of Strength, rejoice ihyself, gracious, in our fair hymns and #songs. In thee are #treasure.d various forms of strengthening #food, #born nobly and of wondrous #help.

p: @Agni, spread forth, as Ruler, over living things: give #wealth to us, #Immortal @Deva. Thou shinest out from #beauty fair to look upon: thou leadest us to conquering power.

p: To him, the #wise, who orders #offerings, who hath great #riches un der his control, Thou givest blest award of good, and plenteous #food, givest him #wealth that conquers all.

p: The #men have set before them them for their welfare @Agni, #strong, visible to all, the Holy. Thee, @Deva.ike One, with ears to hear, most famous, #men's generations magnify with #praise-#songs.

hymns.title: HYMN CXLI, Devas.
hymns.text:
p: TURN hither, @Agni, speak to us: come to us with a gracious mind. Enrich us, #Master of the house: thou art the Giver of our #wealth.

p: Let Aryarnan vouchsafe us #wealth, and @Bhaga, and @Narasamsa. Let the #Devas give their #gifts, and let @Sunrta, Devi, grant us #wealth.

p: We #call #King #Soma to our aid, and @Agni with our #songs and hymns, @Adityas, @Visnu, @Surya, and the Brahman Monk @Narasamsa.

p: @Indra, @Vayu, @Narasamsa, #Devas swift to listen, we invoke, that in the synod all the fol. May be benevolent to us.

p: Urge @Aryaman to send us #gifts, and @Indra, and @Narasamsa, @Vata, @Visnu, @Sarasvati and the #Strong Courser @Indra, @Indra, @Varuna, and @Mitra, #Soma, @Maghavan, @Savitar, @Visnu.

p: Do thou, O @Agni, with thy fires strengthen our #meditation and #offering: Urge givers to bestow their #wealth to aid our service of the #Devas.

hymns.title: HYMN CXLII. Agni.
hymns.text:
p: WITH thee, O @Agni, was this #singer of the laud: he hath no other kinship, O thou #Son of Strength. Thou givest blessed shelter with a triple guard. Keep the destructive lightning far away from us.

p: Thy birth who seekest #food is in the falling flood, @Agni: as Comrade thou winnest all living things. Our coursers and our #songs shall be victorious: they of themselves advance like one who guards the herd.

p: And thou, O @Agni, thou of @Deva.ike nature, sparest the stones, while caring up the brushwood. Then are thy tracks like deserts in the corn-lands. Let us not stir to wrath thy #mighty arrow.

p: O'er hills through vales devouring as thou goest, thou partest like an army fain for booty As when a barber shaves a beard, thou shavest $Earth when the wind blows on thy flame and fans it.

p: Apparent are his lines as he approaches the course is single, but the #cars are many, when, @Agni making thine arms resplendent, advancest o’er the land spread out beneath thee.

p: Now let thy strength, thy burning flames fly upward, thine energies, O @Agni, as thou toilest. Gape widely, bend thee, waxing in thy vigour: let all the #Vasus sit this day beside thee.

p: This is the #waters' #reservoir, the great abode of gathered #streams. Take thou another path than this, and as thou listest walk thereon.

p: On thy way hitherward and hence let flowery Durva #grass spring up Let there be lakes with lotus blooms. These are the mansions of the flood.

hymns.title: HYMN CXLIII. Asvins.
hymns.text:
p: YE made that @Atri, worn with eld, free as a #horse to win the goal. When ye restored to youth and strength Kaksivan like a #car renewed,

p: Ye freed that @Atri like a #horse, and brought him newly-#born to $Earth. Ye loosed him like a firm-tied knot which #Devas unsoiled by dust had bound.

p: #Heroes who showed most wondrous power to @Atri, strive to win fair #songs; For then, O #Heroes of the $Sky, your #hymn of #praise shall cease no more.

p: This claims your notice, Bounteous #Devas! - oblation, @Asvins! and our love, that ye, O #Heroes, in the figh. May bring us safe to ample room.

p: Ye Twain to Bhujyu tossed about in $Ocean at the region's end, @Nasatyas, with your winged sterds came nigh, and gave him strength to win.

p: Come with your joys, most liberal #Devas, Lords of all #treasure.s, bringing weal. Like fresh full #waters to a well, so. #Heroes come and be with us.

hymns.title: HYMN CXLIV. Indra.
hymns.text:
p: THIS deathless @Indu, like a steed, #strong and of full vitality, belongs to thee, the Orderer.

p: Here, by us, for the #worshipper, is the #wise bolt that works with skill. It brings the bubbling beverage as a dexterous #man brings the effectual #strong drink.

p: Impetuous Ahisuva, a bull among cows of his, looked down upon the restless Hawk.

p: That the #strong-pinioned #Bird hath brought, #Child of the Falcon, from afar, what moves upon a hundred wheels along the female Dragon's path.

p: Which, fair, unrobbed, the Falcon brought thee in his foot, the red-hued dwelling of the #juice; Through this came vital power which lengthens out our days, and kinship through its #help awoke.

p: So @Indra is by lndu's power; e’en among #Devas will it repel great treachery. Wisdom, most Sapient One, brings force that lengthens #life. May wisdom bring the #juice to us.

hymns.title: HYMN CXLV. Sapatnibadhanam.
hymns.text:
p: FROM out the $Earth I dig this plant, a herb of most effectual power, Wherewith one quells the rival #wife and gains the #husband for oneself.

p: Auspicious, with expanded leaves, sent by the #Devas, victorious plant, Blow thou the rival #wife away, and make my #husband only mine.

p: Stronger am 1, O Stronger One, yea, mightier than the mightier; And she who is my rival #wife is lower than the lowest #dames.

p: Her very name I utter not: she takes no pleasure in this #man. Far into distance most remote drive we the rival #wife away.

p: I am the conqueror, and thou, thou also act victorious: As #victory attends us both we will subdue my fellow-#wife.

p: I have gained thee for vanquisher, have grasped thee with a stronger spell. As a #cow hastens to her calf, so let thy #spirit speed te me, hasten like #water on its way.

hymns.title: HYMN CXLVI. Aranyani.
hymns.text:
p: GODDESS of wild and forest who seemest to vanish from the sight. How is it that thou seekest not the village? Art thou not afraid?

p: What time the grasshopper replies and swells the shrill cicala's #voice, Seeming to sound with tinkling bells, the Lady of the Wood exults.

p: And, yonder, #cattle seem to graze, what seems a dwelling-place appears: Or else at eve the Lady of the Forest seems to free the wains.

p: Here one is calling to his #cow, another there hath felled a tree: At eve the dweller in the wood fancies that somebody hath screamed.

p: The Devi never subdues, unless some murderous enemy approach. #Man eats of savoury fruit and then takes, even as he wills, his rest.

p: Now have I praised the Forest Queen, sweet-scented, redolent of balm, the #Mother of all sylvan things, who tills not but hath stores of #food.

hymns.title: HYMN CXLVII Indra.
hymns.text:
p: I TRUST in thy first wrathful deed, O @Indra, when thou slewest @Vrtra and didst #work to profit #man; What time the two world-halves fell short of thee in #might, and the $Earth trembled at thy force, O Thunder-anned.

p: Thou with thy magic #powers didst rend the conjurer @Vrtra, O Blameless One, with heart that longed for fame. #Heroes elect thee when they battle for the prey, thee in all #offers worthy of renown.

p: @Deva.Much-invoked, take pleasure in these princes here, who, thine exalters, @Indra, @Indra, @Varuna, and @Mitra, #Soma, @Maghavan, @Savitar, @Visnu, have come to #wealth. In synods, when the rite succeeds, they #hymn the #Strong for #sons and #progeny and #riches undisturbed.

p: That #man shall find #delight in well-protected #wealth whose care provides for him the quick-sought joyous draught. Bringing oblations, strengthened @Indra, @Indra, @Varuna, and @Mitra, #Soma, @Maghavan, @Savitar, @Visnu, by thee, he swiftly wins the #spoil with #heroes in the fight.

p: Now for our band, O @Indra, @Indra, @Varuna, and @Mitra, #Soma, @Maghavan, @Savitar, @Visnu, when lauded, make ample room with #might, and grant us #riches. Magician thou, our @Varuna and @Mitra, deal #food to us, O Wondrous, as #Dispenser.

hymns.title: HYMN CXLVIII. Indra.
hymns.text:
p: WHEN we have pressed the #juice we laud thee, @Indra, and when, most Valorous we have won the booty. Bring us prosperity, as each desires it under thine own protection. May we conquer.

p: Sublime from birth. Mayst thou O @Indra. #Hero, with @Surya overcome the Dasa races. As by a fountain's side, we bring the #Soma that lay concealed, close-hidden in the #waters.

p: Answer the votary's hymns, for these thou knowest, craving the #Rsis’ prayer, thyself a #Singer May we be they who take #delight in Somas: these with sweet #food for thee, O Chariot-rider.

p: These holy prayers, O @Indra, have I sung thee: grant to the #men the strength of #men, thou #Hero. Be of one mind with those in whom thou joyest: keep thou the singers safe and their companions.

p: Listen to Prthi's #call, heroic @Indra, and be thou lauded by the hymns of Venyahim who hath sung thee to thine oil-rich dwelling, whose rolling #songs have sped thee like a torrent.

hymns.title: HYMN CXLIX. Indra, indra, Varuna, and Mitra, Soma, Maghavan, Savitar, Visnu.
hymns.text:
p: @Savitar fixed the $Earth with bands to bind it, and made $Heaven stedfast where no prop supported. @Indra, @Indra, @Varuna, and @Mitra, #Soma, @Maghavan, @Savitar, @Visnu milked, as ’twere a restless courser, #air, sea bound fast to what no foot had trodden.

p: Well knoweth @Indra, @Indra, @Varuna, and @Mitra, #Soma, @Maghavan, @Savitar, @Visnu, O #Child of #Waters, where $Ocean, firmly fixt, o’erflowed its limit. Thence sprang the world, from that uprose the region: thence $Heaven spread out and the wide $Earth expanded.

p: Then, with a full crowd of #Immortal Beings, this other realm came later, high and holy. First, verily, @Indra, @Indra, @Varuna, and @Mitra, #Soma, @Maghavan, @Savitar, @Visnu's #strong-pinioned Eagle was #born: and he obeys his law forever.

p: As warriors to their #steeds, kine to their village, as fond #milk giving cows approach their youngling, as #man to #wife, let @Indra, @Indra, @Varuna, and @Mitra, #Soma, @Maghavan, @Savitar, @Visnu come downward to us, $Heaven's bearer, #Lord of every #blessing.

p: Like the Angirasa Hiranvastupa, I #call thee, @Indra, @Indra, @Varuna, and @Mitra, #Soma, @Maghavan, @Savitar, @Visnu, to this achievement: So worshipping and lauding thee for favour I watch for thee as for the stalk of #Soma.

hymns.title: HYMN CL. Agni.
hymns.text:
p: THOU, bearer of oblations, though kindled, art kindled for the #Devas. With the @Adityas, #Rudras, #Vasus, come to us: to show us favour come to us.

p: Come hither and accept with #joy this #offering and #hymn of ours. O kindled @Deva, we mortals are invoking thee, calling on thee to show us grace.

p: I laud thee #Jatavedas, thee #Lord of all blessings, with my #song. @Agni, bring hitherward the #Devas whose Laws we love, whose laws we love, to show us grace.

p: @Agni the @Deva.was made the great High-Monk of #Devas, #Rsis have kindled @Agni, #men of mortal mould. @Agni I invocate for #winning ample #wealth. kindly disposed for #winning #wealth.

p: @Atri and Bharadvaja and Gavisthira, @KanVa and Trasadasyu, in our fight he helped. On @Agni calls @Vasistha, even the household priest, the household priest to win his grace.

hymns.title: HYMN CLI. Faith.
hymns.text:
p: By #Faith is @Agni kindled, through #Faith is oblation offered up. We celebrate with praises #Faith upon the height of happiness.

p: Bless thou the #man who gives, O #Faith; #Faith, bless the #man who fain would give. Bless thou the liberal #worshippers: bless thou the word that I have said.

p: Even as the #Deities maintained #Faith in the #mighty #Asuras, So make this uttered wish of mine true for the liberal #worshippers.

p: Guarded by @Vayu, #Devas and #men who #offering draw near to #Faith. #Man winneth #Faith by yearnings of the heart, and opulence by #Faith.

p: #Faith in the early #morning, #Faith at noonday will we invocate, #Faith at the setting of the #Sun. O #Faith, endow us with belief.

hymns.title: HYMN CLII. Indra.
hymns.text:
p: A #MIGHTY Governor art thou, Wondrous, Destroyer of the foe, whose #friend is never done to #death, and never, never overcome.

p: #Lord of the clan, who brings us #bliss, #Strong, #Warrior, Slayer of the fiend, may India, #Soma-drinker, go before us, Bull who gives us peace.

p: Drive @Raksasas and foes away, break thou in pieces @Vrtra'sjaws: O @Vrtra-subduing @Indra, quell the foeman's wrath who threatens us.

p: O @Indra, beat our foes away, #humble the #men who challenge us: Send down to nether darkness him who seeks to do us injury.

p: Baffle the foeman's plan, ward off his weapon who would conquer us. Give shelter from his furious wrath, and keep his murdering dart afar.

hymns.title: HYMN CLIII. Indra.
hymns.text:
p: SWAYING about, the Active Ones came nigh to @Indra at his birth, and shared his great heroic #might.

p: Based upon strength and #victory and power, O @Indra is thy birth: Thou, #Mighty One, art #strong indeed.

p: Thou art the @Vrtra conquerer @Indra, hast spread the $Firmament: Thou hast with #might upheld the heavens.

p: Thou, @Indra, bearest in thine arms the lightning that accords with thee, Whetting thy thunderbolt with #might.

p: Thou, @Indra, art preeminent over all creatures in thy #might: Thou hast pervaded every place.

hymns.title: HYMN CLIV. New Life.
hymns.text:
p: FOR some is #Soma purified, some sit by #offerings oil: To those for whom the #meath flows forth, even to those let him depart.

p: Invincible through Fervour, those whom Fervour hath advanced to $Heaven, who showed great Fervour in their lives, -even to those let him depart.

p: The #heroes who contend in war and boldly cast their lives away, or who give guerdon thousandfold, -even to those let him depart.

p: Yea, the first followers of Law, Law's pure and holy strengtheners, the #Fathers, @Yama! Fervour-moved,even to those let him depart.

p: Skilled in a thousand ways and means, the sages who protect the #Sun, the #Rsis, @Yama! Fervour-moved.even to those let him depart.

hymns.title: HYMN CLV. Various.
hymns.text:
p: ARAYI, one-eyed limping hag, fly, ever-screeching, to the hill. We frighten thee away with these, the #heroes of Sirimbitha.

p: Scared from this place and that is she, destroyer of each germ unborn. Go, sharp-horned Brahmanaspti and drive Arayi far away.

p: Yon log that floats without a #man to guide it on the #river's edge. Seize it, thou thing with hideous jaws, and go thou far away thereon.

p: When, foul with secret stain and spot, ye hastened onward to the breast, All @Indra's enemies were slain and passed away like froth and foam.

p: These #men have led about the #cow, have duly carried @Agni round, and raised their #glory tg the #Devas. Who will attack them with success?

hymns.title: HYMN CLVI. Agni.
hymns.text:
p: LET #songs of ours speed @Agni forth like a fleet courser in the race, and we will win each prize through him.

p: @Agni the dart whereby we gain kine for ourselves with #help from thee. That send us for the gain of #wealth.

p: O @Agni, bring us #wealth secure, vast #wealth in #horses and in kine: Oil thou the socket, turn the wheel.

p: O @Agni, thou hast made the #Sun, Eternal Star, to mount the $Sky, bestowing #light on living #men.

p: Thou, @Agni, art the #people's #light, best, dearest, seated in thy shrine: Watch for the #singer, give him #life.

hymns.title: HYMN CLVII, Devas.
hymns.text:
p: WE will, with @Indra and all #Devas to aid us, bring these existing worlds into subjection.

p: Our #offering, our bodies, and our offspr. let @Indra #form together with @Adityas.

p: With the @Adityas, with the band of #Maruts. May @Indra be Protector of our bodies.

p: As when the #Devas came, after they had slaughtered the #Asuras, keeping safe their @Deva.ike nature,

p: Brought the #Sun hitherward with #mighty #powers, and looked about them on their vigorous @Deva.ead.

hymns.title: HYMN CLVIII. Surya.
hymns.text:
p: MAY @Surya guard us out of $Heaven, and @Vata from the $Firmament, and @Agni from terrestrial spots.

p: Thou @Indra, @Indra, @Varuna, and @Mitra, #Soma, @Maghavan, @Savitar, @Visnu whose flame deserves hundred #libations, be thou pleased: From failing lightning keep us safe.

p: May @Indra, @Indra, @Varuna, and @Mitra, #Soma, @Maghavan, @Savitar, @Visnu the @Deva, an. May Parvata also give us sight; May the #Creator give us sight.

p: Give sight unto our eye, give thou our bodies sight that the, may see: May we survey, discern this world.

p: Thus, @Surya. May we look on thee, on thee most lovely to behold, See clearly with the eyes of #men.

hymns.title: HYMN CLIX. Saci Paulomi.
hymns.text:
p: YON #Sun hath mounted up, and this my happy fate hate mounted high. I knowing this, as conqueror have won my #husband for mine own.

p: I am the banner and the head, a #mighty arbitress am I: I am victorious, and my #Lord shall be submissive to my will.

p: My #Sons are slayers of the foe, my Daughter is a ruling Queen: I am victorious: o’er my #Lord my #song of #triumph is supreme.

p: Oblation, that which @Indra gave and thus grew #glorious and most high. This have I offered, O ye #Devas, and rid me of each rival #wife.

p: Destroyer of the rival #wife, Sole #Spouse, victorious, conqueror, the others' #glory have I seized as ’twere the #wealth of weaker #Dames.

p: I have subdued as conqueror these rivals, these my fellow-wives, that . May hold imperial sway over this #Hero and the folk.

hymns.title: HYMN CLX. Indra.
hymns.text:
p: TASTE this #strong draught enriched with offered #offerings: with all thy chariot here unyoke thy Coursers. Let not those other offerers stay thee, @Indra: these #offerings shed for thee are ready.

p: Thine is the #juice effused, thine are the juices yet to be pressed: our resonant #songs invite thee. O @Indra, pleased to-day with this libation, come, thou who knowest all and drink the #Soma.

p: Whoso, devoted to the @Deva, effuses #Soma for him with yearning heart and #spirit. Never doth @Indra give away his #cattle: for him he makes the lovely #Soma famous.

p: He looks with Ioving favour on the mortal who, like a rich #man, pours for him the #Soma. @Indra, @Indra, @Varuna, and @Mitra, #Soma, @Maghavan, @Savitar, @Visnu in his bended arm supports him: he subdues, unasked, the #men who hate devotion.

p: We #call on thee to come to us, desirous of goods and #spoil, of #cattle, and of #horses. For thy new love and favour are we present: let us invoke thee, @Indra, as our welfare.

hymns.title: HYMN CLXI. Indra.
hymns.text:
p: FOR #life I set thee free by this oblation from the unknown decline and from Consumption; Or, if the grasping demon have possessed him, free him from her, O @Indra, thou and @Agni.

p: Be his days ended, be he now departed, be he brought very near to #death already, Out of Destruction's lap again I bring him, save him for #life to last a hundred autumns.

p: With hundred-eyed oblation, hundred-autumned, bringing a hundred lives, have I restored him, that @Indra for a hundred year. May lead him safe to the farther shore of all misfortune.

p: Live, waxing in thy strength, a hundred autumns, live through a hundred springs, a hundred winters. Through hundred-lived oblation @Indra, @Agni, @Narasamsa, @Indra, @Indra, @Varuna, and @Mitra, #Soma, @Maghavan, @Savitar, @Visnu yield him for a hundred!

p: So have I found and rescued thee thou hast returned with youth renewed. Whole in thy members! I have found thy sight and all thy #life for thee.

hymns.title: HYMN CLXII. Agni
hymns.text:
p: MAY @Agni, yielding to our #meditation, the Raksas-slayer, drive away The malady of evil name that hath beset thy labouring womb.

p: @Agni, concurring in the prayer, drive off the eater of the flesh, the malady of evil name that hath attacked thy babe and womb.

p: That which destroys the sinking germ, the settled, moving embryo, that which will kill the babe at birth.even this will we drive far away.

p: That which divides thy legs that he may lie between the married pair, that penetrates and licks thy side.even this will we exterminate.

p: What rests by thee in borrowed #form of #brother, lover, or of #lord, and would destroy thy #Progeny.even this will we exterminate.

p: That which through sleep or darkness hath deceived thee and lies down by thee, and will destroy thy #progeny.even this will we exterminate.

hymns.title: HYMN CLXIII
hymns.text:
p: FROM both thy nostrils, from thine eyes, from both thine ears and from thy chin, forth from thy head and brain and tongue I drive thy malady away.

p: From the neck-tendons and the neck, from the breast-bones and from the spine, From shoulders, upper, lower arms, I drive thy malady away.

p: From viscera and all within, forth from the rectum, from the heart, From kidneys, liver, and from spleen, I drive thy malady away.

p: From thighs, from knee-caps, and from heels, and from the forepart of the feet, From hips from stomach, and from groin I drive thy malady away.

p: From what is voided from within, and from thy hair, and from they nails, From all thyself from top to toe, I drive thy malady away.

p: From every member, every hair, disease that comes in every joint, From all thyself, from top to toe, I drive thy malady away.

hymns.title: HYMN CLXIV. Dream-charm.
hymns.text:
p: AVAUNT, thou #Master of the mind Depart, and vanish far away. Look on Destruction far from hence. The live #man's mind is manifold.

p: A happy #boon do #men elect, a #mighty #blessing they obtain. #Bliss with Vaivasvata they see. The live #man's mind seeks many a place.

p: If by address, by blame, by imprecation we have committed sin, awake or sleeping, All hateful acts of ours, all evil doing. May @Agni bear away to distant places.

p: When, @Indra, @Narasamsa, our deeds are wrongful and unjust, may provident Angirasa prevent our foes from troubling, us.

p: We have prevailed this day and won: we are made free from sin and guilt. Ill thoughts, that visit us awake or sleeping, seize the #man we hate, yea, seize the #man who hateth us.

hymns.title: HYMN CLXV, Devas.
hymns.text:
p: GODS, whatsoe’er the Dove came hither seeking, sent to us as the envoy of Destruction, for that let us sing hymns and make atonement. Well be it with our quadrupeds and bipeds.

p: Auspicious be the Dove that hath been sent us, a harmless #bird, ye #Devas, within our dwelling. May @Agni, #Sage, be pleased with our oblation, an. May the Missile borne on #wings avoid us.

p: Let not the Arrow that hath #wings distract us: beside the fire-place, on the hearth it settles. May, it bring welfare to our #men and #cattle: here let the Dove, ye #Devas, forbear to harm us.

p: The screeching of the owl is ineffective and when beside the fire the Dove hath settled, to him who sent it hither as an envoy, to him be #reverence paid, to #Death, to @Yama.

p: Drive forth the Dove, chase it with holy verses: rejoicing, bring ye hither #food and #cattle, Barring the way against all grief and trouble. Let the swift #bird fly forth and leave us vigour.

hymns.title: HYMN CLXVI. Sapatnanasanam.
hymns.text:
p: MAKE me a bull among my peers, make me my rivals, conqueror: Make me the slayer of my foes, a sovran ruler, #lord of kine

p: I am my rivals’ slayer, like @Indra unwounded and unhurt, and all these enemies of mine are vanquished and beneath my feet.

p: Here, verily, I bind you fast, as the two bow-ends with the string. Press down these #men, O #Lord of Speech, that the, may humbly speak to me.

p: Hither I came as conqueror with #mighty all-effecting power, and I have mastered all your thought, your synod, and your holy #work.

p: May I be highest, having gained your strength in war, your skill in peace my feet have trodden on your heads. Speak to me from beneath my feet, as frogs from out the #water croak, as frogs from out the #water croak.

hymns.title: HYMN CLXVII. Indra.
hymns.text:
p: THIS pleasant #meath, O @Indra, is effused for thee: thou art the ruling #Lord of beaker and of #juice. Bestow upon us #wealth with many #hero #sons: thou, having glowed with Fervour, wonnest heavenly #light.

p: Let us #call @Sakra to #libations here effused, winner of #light who joyeth in the potent #juice. Mark well this #offering of ours and come to us: we pray to @Indra, @Indra, @Varuna, and @Mitra, #Soma, @Maghavan, @Savitar, @Visnu the Vanquisher of hosts.

p: By royal #Soma's and by @Varuna's decree, under @Narasamsa's and Anumati's guard, This day by thine authority, O @Indra, @Indra, @Varuna, and @Mitra, #Soma, @Maghavan, @Savitar, @Visnu, maker, Disposer thou! have I enjoyed the jars.

p: 1, too, urged on, have had my portion, in the bowl, and as first Prince I drew forth this my #hymn of #praise, when with the prize I came unto the flowing #juice, O Visvamitra, Jamadagni, to your #home.

hymns.title: HYMN CLXVIII. Vayu.
hymns.text:
p: O THE Wind's chariot, O its power and #glory! Crashing it goes and hath a #voice of thunder. It makes the regions red and touches $Heaven, and as it moves the dust of $Earth is scattered.

p: Along the traces of the Wind they hurry, they come to him as #dames to an assembly. Borne on his #car with these for his @Attendants, the @Deva.speeds forth, the universe's Monarch.

p: Travelling on the paths of #air's mid-region, no single day doth he take rest or slumber. Holy and earliest-#born, #Friend of the #waters, where did he spring and from what region came he?

p: Germ of the world, the #Deities’ vital #spirit, this @Deva moves ever as his will inclines him. His #voice is heard, his shape is ever viewless. Let us adore this Wind with our oblation.

hymns.title: HYMN CLXIX. COWS.
hymns.text:
p: MAY the wind blow upon our Cows with healing. May they eat herbage full of vigorous juices. May they drink #waters rich in #life and fatness: to #food that moves on feet be gracious, Rudra.

p: Like-coloured, various-hued, or single-coloured, whose names through #offering are known to @Agni, whom the #Angirases produced by Fervour.vouchsafe to these, @Parjanya, great protection.

p: Those who have offered to the #Devas their bodies, whose varied forms are all well known to #Soma. Those grant us in our #cattle-pen, O @Indra, with their full #streams of #milk and plenteous #offspring.

p: @Prajapati, bestowing these upon me, one-minded with all #Devas and with the #Fathers, Hath to our #cow-pen brought auspicious #cattle: s. May we own the #offspring they will bear us.

hymns.title: HYMN CLXX. Surya.
hymns.text:
p: MAY the Bright @Deva.drink #glorious #Soma-mingled #meath, giving  'the #offering's #lord uninjured #life; He who, wind-urged, in person guards our #offspring well, hath nourished them with #food and shines o’er many a land.

p: Radiant, as high Truth, cherished, best at #winning strength, Truth based upon the statute that supports the heavens. He rose, a #light, that kills #Vrtras and enemies, best slayer of the #Dasyus, #Asuras, and foes.

p: This #light, the best of lights, supreme, all-conquering, winner of #riches, is exalted with high laud. All-lighting, radiant, #mighty as the #Sun to see, he spreadeth wide unfailing #victory and strength.

p: Beaming forth #splendour with thy #light, thou hast attained $Heaven's lustrous realm. By thee were brought together all existing things, possessor of all @Deva.ead, All-effecting @Deva.

hymns.title: HYMN CLXXI. Indra.
hymns.text:
p: FOR Ita's sake who pressed the #juice @Indra, didst protect his #car, and hear the #Soma-giver's #call.

p: Thou from his skin hast borne the head of the swift-moving combatant, and sought the #Soma-pourer's #home.

p: Venya, that mortal #man, hast thou, for Astrabudhna the devout, O @Indra, many a time set free.

p: Bring, @Indra, to the east again that #Sun who now is in the west, Even against the will of #Devas.

hymns.title: HYMN CLXXII. Dawn.
hymns.text:
p: WITH all thy #beauty come: the kine approaching with full udders follow on thy path.

p: Come with kind thoughts, most liberal, rousing the #warrior's #hymn of #praise, with bounteous ones,

p: As nourishers we tie the thread, and, liberal with our bounty, offer #offering.

p: @Dawn drives away her #Sister's gloom, and, through her excellence, makes her retrace her path.

hymns.title: HYMN CLXXIII. The King.
hymns.text:
p: BE with us; I have chosen thee: stand stedfast and immovable. Let all the #people wish for thee let not thy kingship fall away.

p: Be even here; fall not away be like a mountain unremoved. Stand stedfast here like @Indra's self, and hold the kingship in the grasp.

p: This #man hath @Indra stablished, made secure by #strong oblation's power. May #Soma speak a benison, and @Narasamsa, on him.

p: Firm is the $Sky and firm the $Earth, and stedfast also are these hills. Stedfast is all this living world, and stedfast is this #King of #men.

p: Stedfast. May @Varuna the #King, stedfast, the @Deva.@Narasamsa, Stedfast. May @Indra, stedfast too. May @Agni keep thy stedfast reign.

p: On constant #Soma let us think with constant #offerings, and may @Indra make the clans bring #tribute unto thee alone.

hymns.title: HYMN CLXXIV. The King.
hymns.text:
p: WITH #offering for success in fight whence @Indra was victorious. With this, O @Narasamsa, let us attain to royal sway.

p: Subduing those who rival us, subduing all malignities, withstand the #man who menaces, withstand the #man who angers us.

p: #Soma and @Indra, @Indra, @Varuna, and @Mitra, #Soma, @Maghavan, @Savitar have made thee a victorious #King All #elements have aided thee, to make thee general conqueror.

p: Oblation, that which @Indra. gave and thus grew #glorious and most high. This have I offered, #Devas! and hence now, verily, am rivalless.

p: Victorious, with royal sway, Over these being. May I rule. May I be Sovran of the folk.

hymns.title: HYMN CLXXV. Press-stones.
hymns.text:
p: MAY @Indra, @Indra, @Varuna, and @Mitra, #Soma, @Maghavan, @Savitar, @Visnu the @Deva, O Stones, stir you according to the Law: Be harnessed to the shafts, and press.

p: Stones, drive calamity away, drive ye away malevolence: Make ye the Cows our medicine.

p: Of one accord the upper Stones, giving the Bull his bull-like strength, Look down with pride on those below.

p: May @Indra, @Indra, @Varuna, and @Mitra, #Soma, @Maghavan, @Savitar, @Visnu the @Deva, O Stones, stir you as Law commands for him Who #offers, pouring #juice.

hymns.title: HYMN CLXXVI. Agni.
hymns.text:
