p: WITH hymns of #praise their #sons have told aloud the @Rbhus' #mighty deeds. Who, all-supporting, have enjoyed the $Earth as, twere a #mother #cow.

p: Bring forth the @Deva.with #song divine, being #Jatavedas hitherward, to bear our #gifts at once to $Heaven.

p: He here, a devoted Monk, led forward comes to #offering. Like a #car covered for the road, he, glowing, knows, himself, the way.

p: This @Agni rescues from distress, as ’twere from the #Immortal Race, a @Deva.yet mightier than strength, a @Deva who hath been made for #life.

hymns.title: HYMN CLXXVII. Mayabheda.
hymns.text:
p: THE sapient with their #spirit and their mind behold the #Bird adorned with all an #Asura's magic #might. Sages observe him in the $Ocean's inmost depth: the #wise disposers seek the station of his rays.

p: The flying #Bird bears Speech within his #spirit: erst the #Gandharva in the womb pronounced it: And at the seat of #offering the sages cherish this radiant, heavenly-bright invention.

p: I saw the Herdsman, him who never resteth, approaching and departing on his pathways. He, clothed in gathered and diffusive #splendour, within the worlds continually travels.

hymns.title: HYMN CLXXVIII. Tarksya.
hymns.text:
p: THIS very #mighty one whom #Devas commission, the Conqueror of #cars, ever triumphant, Swift, fleet to battle, with uninjured fellies, even @Tarksya for our weal will we #call hither.

p: As though we offered up our #gifts to @Indra, may we #ascend. him as a ship. for safety. Like the two wide worlds, broad, deep far-extended. May we be safe both when he comes and leaves you.

p: He who with #might the Five Lands hath pervaded, like @Surya with his lustre, and the #waters— His strength wins hundreds, thousands none avert it, as the young #maid repelleth not her lover.

hymns.title: HYMN CLXXIX. Indra.
hymns.text:
p: Now lift ye up yourselves and look on @Indra's seasonable share. If it be ready, offer it; unready, ye have been remise.

p: Oblation is prepared: come to us, @Indra; the #Sun hath travelled over half his #journey. #Friends with their stores are sitting round thee waiting like lords of clans for the tribe's wandering chieftain.

p: Dressed in the udder and on fire, I fancy; well-dressed, I fancy, is this recent present. Drink, @Indra, of the curd of noon's libation with favour, Thunderer, thou whose deeds are #mighty.

hymns.title: HYMN CLXXX. Indra.
hymns.text:
p: O MUCH-INVOKED, thou hast subdued thy foemen: thy #might is loftiest; here display thy bounty. In thy right hand, O @Indra, bring us #treasure.s: thou art the #Lord of #rivers filled with #riches.

p: Like a dread wild beast roaming on the mountain thou hast approached us from the farthest distance. Whetting thy bold and thy sharp blade, O @Indra, crush thou the foe and scatter those who hate us.

p: Thou, #mighty @Indra, sprangest into being as strength for lovely lordship o’er the #people. Thou drovest off the folk who were unfriendly, and to the #Devas thou gavest room and freedom.

hymns.title: HYMN CLXXXI, Devas.
hymns.text:
p: VASIṢṬHA mastered the Rathantara, took it from radiant @Dhatar, @Indra, @Indra, @Varuna, and @Mitra, #Soma, @Maghavan, @Savitar, @Visnu, and @Visnu, Oblation, portion of fourfold oblation, known by the names of Saprathas and Prathas.

p:  These sages found what lay remote and hidden,  'the #offering's loftiest secret essence. From radiant @Dhatar, @Indra, @Indra, @Varuna, and @Mitra, #Soma, @Maghavan, @Savitar, @Visnu, and @Visnu, from @Agni, Bharadvaja brought the Brhat.

p: They found with mental eyes the earliest Yajus, a pathway to the #Devas, that had descended. From radiant @Dhatar, @Indra, @Indra, @Varuna, and @Mitra, #Soma, @Maghavan, @Savitar, @Visnu, and @Visnu, from @Surya did these sages bring the Gharma.

hymns.title: HYMN CLXXXII. Narasamsa.
hymns.text:
p: BRHASPATI lead us safely over troubles and turn his evil thought against the sinner; Repel the curse, and drive away ill-feeling, and give  'the offeringr peace and comfort!

p: May @Narasamsa aid us at Prayaja: blest be our Anuyaja at invokings. May he repel the curse, and chase ill-feeling, and give  'the offeringr peace and comfort.

p: May he whose head is flaming burn the demons, haters of prayer, so that the arrow subdue them. May he repel the curse and chase ill-feeling, and give  'the offeringr peace and comfort.

hymns.title: HYMN CLXXXIII. The Offerer, Etc.
hymns.text:
p: I SAW thee meditating in thy #spirit what sprang from Fervour and hath thence developed. Bestowing #offspring here, bestowing #riches, spread in thine #offspring, thou who cravest children.

p: I saw thee pondering in thine heart, and praying that in due time thy body #might be fruitful. Come as a youthful #woman, rise to meet me: spread in thine #offspring, thou who cravest children.

p: In plants and herbs, in all existent beings I have deposited the germ of increase. All #progeny on $Earth have I engendered, and #sons in women who will be hereafter.

hymns.title: HYMN CLXXXIV.
hymns.text:
p: MAY @Visnu #form and mould the womb. May @Tvastar duly shape the forms, @Prajapati infuse the #stream, and @Dhatar lay the germ for thee.

p: O Sinivali, set the germ, set thou the germ, @Sarasvati: May the Twain #Devas bestow the germ, the @Asvins crowned with lotuses.

p: That which the @Asvins Twain rub forth with the attrition-sticks of #gold. That germ of thine we invocate, that in the tenth month tho. Mayst bear.

hymns.title: HYMN CLXXXV. Aditi.
hymns.text:
p: GREAT, unassailable must he the heavenly favour of Three #Devas, @Varuna, @Mitra, @Aryaman.

p: O'er these, neither at #home nor yet abroad or pathways that are Strange, the evil-minded foe hath power

p: Nor over him. the #man on whom the #Sons of @Aditi bestow Eternal #light that h. May live.

hymns.title: HYMN CLXXXVI. Vayu.
hymns.text:
p: FILLING our hearts with health and #joy. May @Vata breathe his balm on us May he prolong our days of #life.

p: Thou art our #Father, @Vata, yea, thou art a #Brother and a #friend, So give us strength that we may live.

p: The store of Amrta laid away yonder, O @Vata, in thine #home. Give us thereof that we may live.

hymns.title: HYMN CLXXXVII. Agni.
hymns.text:
p: To @Agni send I forth my #song, to him the Bull of all the folk: May he bear us past our foes.

p: Who from the distance far away shines brilliantly across the wastes: May he bear us past our foes.

p: The Bull with brightly-gleaming flame who utterly consumes the fiends May he bear us past our foes.

p: Who looks on all existing things and comprehends them with his viewe may he bear us past our foes.

p: Resplendent @Agni, who was #born in farthest region of the #air: May he bear us past our foes.

hymns.title: HYMN CLXXXVIII. Agni.
hymns.text:
p: Now send ye #Jatavedas forth, send hitherward the vigorous Steed To seat him on our sacred #grass.

p:  I raise the lofty eulogy of #Jatavedas, raining boons, with sages for his #hero band.

p: With flames of #Jatavedas which carry oblation to the #Devas, may he promote  'our #offering.

hymns.title: HYMN CLXXXIX. Surya.
hymns.text:
p: THIS spotted Bull hath come, and sat before the #Mother in the east, Advancing to his #Father $Heaven.

p: Expiring when he draws his breath, she moves along the lucid spheres: The Bull shines out through all the $Sky.

p: #Song is bestowed upon the #Bird: it rules supreme through thirty realms Throughout the days at break of morn.

hymns.title: HYMN CXC. Creation.
hymns.text:
p: FROM Fervour kindled to its height Eternal Law and Truth were #born: Thence was the Night produced, and thence the billowy flood of sea arose.

p: From that same billowy flood of sea the Year was afterwards produced, ordainer of the days nights, #Lord over all who close the eye.

p: @Dhatar, the great #Creator, then formed in due #order #Sun and #Moon. He formed in #order $Heaven and $Earth, the regions of the #air, and #light.

hymns.title: HYMN CXCI. Agni.
hymns.text:
p: THOU, #mighty @Agni, gatherest up all that is precious for thy #friend. Bring us all #treasure.s as thou art enkindled in libation's place

p: Assemble, speak together: let your minds be all of one accord, as ancient #Devas unanimous sit down to their appointed share.

p: The place is common, common the assembly, common the mind, so be their thought united. A common purpose do I lay before you, and #worship with your general oblation.

p: One and the same be your resolve, and be your minds of one accord. United be the thoughts of all that al. May happily agree.
